Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
I know it's not a Portal game, but it hits pretty close to home. The similarities are there. Just instead of playing with portals, you're using time manipulation to get through the puzzles. You'll even have those moments of getting stuck after thinking the puzzle's your b*tch, wondering how the hell you made it this far in life, just to realize you should of seen it from the start. Good times. Also the gun you use talks back and forth with you throughout the game which reminds me a bit of when GLaDOS became a potato.

Recommandé
28.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2022
"I almost canned the whole idea several months into development because I was so worried about the comparisons [to Portal]."
-Daniel Stubbington, Creator and Developer.



When people reference Portal while talking about this game, it doesn't make it any less of a gem, as many other games have used classics as an influence and have failed to capture their magic and for this game to do it and to be as polished, and of such high quality with only one dev, is truly mind-boggling.

However, it stands out with it's unique rewind mechanic which is extremely clever and fun to play around with, and its narrative which gives meaning to everything in the game and drives you to move forward.

I adore this game, and I believe that if you enjoyed Portal, then you will also love this game.
 
aho_1029
204 produits enregistrés

53 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 aout 2023
Difficulty : 1.5/5 (Easy)
Global : 4/5 (Great)

Curator page : Anokturnus

There's a certain number of pure Portal-like games out there (Lightmatter, Relicta, Turing Test, QUBE, Magnetic etc) but The Entropy Centre has to be the best I've played.
I usually don't like these games a lot because they often fail to reproduce what makes the Portal series such a masterpiece, leaving only easy and not really interesting puzzles.

So why isn't The Entropy Centre like them?

Well, it is puzzle-wise unfortunately. Especially if you're already familiar with the time rewind mechanic, you won't have any trouble at all.
Every puzzle is solved rather quickly and only doing the solution takes time. If you've played some Portal 2 workshop maps, the puzzles of the Entropy Centre are very similar to all those easy maps with a bunch of things scattered that you have to activate in the correct order. Except you have to record the solution this time.
The problem with the time rewind mechanic is that creating hard puzzles means creating tedious ones, the game trapped itself with this core mechanic. That's why I don't really mind and understand the puzzles being a bit too easy.
I'll skip the other mechanics, everything in Portal 2 is in there. I'll just talk about the jump pad, the hitbox could be better because sometimes you hit the edge and it doesn't count. And missing a jump pad jump means restarting the solution so it can be annoying.

Where The Entropy Centre actually shines is on every other aspect :

- Let's start with the best, the story. The Entropy Centre is a moon base where people solve puzzles to gather entropy energy in order to rewind the Earth when a cataclysmic event happens.
You are Aria and you wake up alone in the devastated centre and the Earth is exploding, so your goal is to rewind it yourself.
That's the sort of story I really like and it was well done, including the ending (though I think the story has even more potential). There's also a lot of lore to find in the mails of certain computers.

- As you probably guessed from the story, the atmosphere is unreal. The destroyed Earth in the background unleashes shockwaves on the centre, destroying parts of it and allowing you to create paths by rewinding the debris. The walking sections outside of the puzzles aren't boring at all, that's for sure.

- The game runs very smoothly, that's clearly something to praise. Most games nowadays are optimized like sh*t.
The visuals are also stunning, seriously. And that's why I think exploration could've been made more important. There are sections of the game in which you can explore a bit, but there's usually nothing to find and that's a shame.

- The characters are very cool with very good voice acting, dialogues and humor.

- The sound design is top notch.

The Entropy Centre isn't perfect and doesn't reach the greatness of its inspiration, but it's an extremely good tribute. Especially when you know it has mostly been developped by one person, that's just outstanding.
 
Anokturnus
358 produits enregistrés
0
60 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2022
《熵中心》 是一款冒险解谜游戏，有一定战斗元素，有参考另一款经典游戏，但本次只聊这款游戏。如果自己并不缺乏耐心，那么这款游戏将会带来很棒的体验！需要耐心并不是指游戏解谜过程枯燥，而是因为某些谜题有一定挑战性，大多面临的挑战是需要玩家发挥自己的逆向思维。加上个别机制不太清晰，因此解谜的过程可能就需要玩家多次试错。

因此有两个机制需要注意：弹跳板会根据玩家掉落高度决定玩家的弹跳高度；回溯中的物体可以被抓取移动，并且不会影响后续的回溯路线。
　欢迎关注 网易UU鉴赏家培养计划
　来这里找优质游戏、开黑日友、白嫖UU时长卡　
　加速Steam社区、游戏记得用UU哦_(:з」∠)_　

学术概念与游戏的结合
“熵（entropy）”，一种相对复杂的学术概念，在不同学科上有不同的定义。但有科学家用通俗易懂的话解释了这一概念，大概如下：一个东西（人事物）不论发生什么，其总是向着无序、混乱和毁灭的方向发展。
不过游戏并没有想深入探讨“熵”的现实学术内容，只是取用了部分比较容易理解的关键词：无序、混乱和毁灭。这其实是非常聪明的选择，探讨学术内容会让玩家的理解成本增加，而选择学术概念进行二创不容易被学术的严谨性束缚住玩法，同时实际存在的物理学概念还可以让作品更有厚度，整体而言就是在创作上有更大的发挥空间。

游戏的节奏
游戏流程其实是由一个个解谜关卡组成，但游戏的场景设计巧妙的将一个个关卡进行了连接，所以在进行游戏时并没有强烈的闯关感。即使利用电梯进行明显的章节转换设计，也会在某个关卡中利用操控电梯探索不同楼层的方式减弱这种关卡感。这种看似与解谜没有直接关系的设计，其实是让玩家的体验会趋于线性流程化，增加游戏的沉浸感。

游戏的剧情和玩法
理论上剧情和玩法要分开说，可本作的玩法与剧情深度绑定。游戏剧情与核心玩法围绕三个关键词进行，无序、混乱和毁灭。把无序的道具放在合适的位置，从而变成某种意义上的有序；搞清楚混乱的故事；拯救毁灭的一切。
说实话，最初玩家对当前情况会有些莫名其妙，也会质疑游戏中解谜测试的价值。可是随着游戏的推进，这些看似莫名其妙的内容会开始得到答案，看似解谜与拯救世界毫无关联的两种东西会被合理的联系到一起，甚至会让玩家在知道部分答案时惊叹一声：原来如此。也就是说开发者让整个流程从设定到故事，再到玩法上做到了某种逻辑自洽。

整体而言这是一款很纯粹的游戏。游戏的核心玩法主要围绕那把手持式熵设备展开，玩家将要利用这个设备的回溯功能（熵时间操纵术）解开这些测试谜题和化解危险环境，前行寻找一切的真相。在游戏设定中，成功解谜后的熵信息还可以用来产生熵能，熵能与剧情有直接关系。
除了核心玩法外，游戏并没有多的养成和道具展示页面，收集品主要是76份情报，这些情报更多是塑造游戏环境和对故事背景的补充，不影响游戏的进程，但会影响你对这个世界的了解程度。

游戏的不足
游戏的目标很明确，就是围绕熵的概念的进行。不过游戏可能是为了打造更好的沉浸感，游戏的引导较弱，特别是某些机制不够明显，可能会有卡关的情况，因此需要玩家不断尝试总结经验。再重复下有两个机制需要注意：弹跳板会根据玩家掉落高度决定玩家的弹跳高度；回溯中的物体可以被抓取移动，并且不会影响后续的回溯路线。（希望能帮助到游戏中的你）
●场景的模型摆放不太讲究，游戏中有多次掉进某些缝隙中出不来，然后回到在主菜单重置游戏。（场景优点放下面说）
●没有明确的存档功能和存档点。游戏存档大概是根据场景转换进行，还好场景转换点较多，不至于游戏进度大量消失。
●另外就是游戏的核心机制，其实这不算不足。只是整体感觉在根据熵的特性设计的谜题还有挖掘的空间。

游戏的体验
游戏的体验过程是比较舒服的。特别是当游戏开始十多分钟后的一个场景体验，看着坍塌的建筑在你脚下被重塑，并从中化险为夷，这种体验直接将玩家闹闹吸引住！

游戏专注玩法，将逆向思维的解谜机制贯彻到底，没有其它功能系统，甚至除设置页面和主菜单外，就没有额外的UI了。其实这很考验开发者对于关卡的设计和游戏整体素质的把控。当然从游戏的成品来看，开发组成功把控了游戏的节奏和素质。
●在角色塑造上，可圈可点，虽然主角的塑造偏普通，但机器人阿斯特拉的塑造让我印象深刻。
●前面提到游戏性其实也还有挖掘空间，可开发组在合适的时间结束了流程，这直接避免了玩家在有限机制下长流程中将会面对的枯燥感。
●加上游戏的美术表现不错，场景和道具很有质感，场景环境氛围感也很强，让人相信这就是末世景象。
●只是场景模型偶尔卡位的情况和机制不清晰的情况成为了游戏最大的短板。

一言以蔽之这款游戏瑕不掩瑜，如果你不反感解谜游戏，那么这款游戏非常推荐。

最后感谢各位亚莉雅的阅读！
 
K Reaper
0
35 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

While Valve hasn’t quite abandoned the world of Aperture Science, it seems unlikely a new Portal game is on the horizon. Even though puzzle games are rarely my favorite, Portal and Portal 2 left such a lasting impression that I’ve been ‘chasing the dragon’ for the last 11 years. I’ve played quite a few enjoyable games in that time, but only now do I feel like a game has captured the essence of what made the Portal games stand out. It wasn’t just being a solid first-person puzzle game, it also was crafting a world you explored and discovering pieces of a mystery.

Abbreviated Review:
Vidéo YouTube™: The Entropy Centre - Portal Returns (Kinda) | Abbreviated Review 
Vues : 622
This isn't Portal. I don't know that any game will ever reach the lofty near-perfection of that neglected franchise. But this is as close as you can get spiritually without just simply remaking the...


A Career in Puzzles
The premise of Entropy Centre is part of the story, so I don’t want to get too deep into it, but the general idea is that you work in this facility exploring room-spanning puzzles. You solve those puzzles with a time manipulation device that can rewind objects to a previous location and state. Much like Portal, this involves moving yourself and items around to trigger platforms, raise elevators, and open doors. It borrows a notable chunk of Portal’s mechanics – though here, instead of having lasers reflected by mirror boxes and light bridges redirected with portals, the special cubes themselves create those tools.

There is still a simple standard cube that activates pads for triggering doors and such, but there are also unique cubes like the “tall cube” that starts as a flat broken-down box but can be shifted back in time to be rebuilt and lift anything above it. Things like the “tall cube” and “bounce cube,” neither of which are actually cubes, are introduced and combined with the rest of your tools to be picked up, placed, and shifted back through time across their path with your "Personal Exercise Assistant"(PEA) – which is also a sentient AI device named Astra. Astra doesn’t direct you through your puzzle experience, but she does create an entertaining and somewhat endearing character vaguely similar to GLaDOS (though much friendlier).

The puzzles that you solve begin with plenty of easy tasks to get you oriented with the idea of “start where you finish,” which persists throughout the game. However, it didn't take too long for the difficult to ramp and leave me stumped for a least a little while at certain points. Yet, even when it felt like an eternity of being lost in thought, the timer at the end of the level usually stated more like five or ten minutes at most. The puzzle rooms have various traversal areas interspersed between them that also involve rewinding time, but usually in a way that’s more about action and movement than standing around thinking of solutions. With moments like rewinding falling debris or sometimes lifting yourself on a collapsed walkway.

Rewinding a Mystery
Portal didn’t become a near-universally lauded game just because it had fun puzzles or original gameplay. The now instantly recognizable world and memorable characters like GLaDOS, Cave Johnson, and Wheatley (to a lesser degree) and their mysterious connections within the story kept players interested even beyond the gameplay. The Entropy Centre adopts some of that same allure by putting the main character in mysterious circumstances and creating memorable characters to keep the game lively even when it’s relatively slow. It’s aided by having a voiced protagonist who quickly establishes a personality and has entertaining interactions with Astra.

While your character, Aria, suffers from the somewhat trope-y affliction of amnesia, that isn’t something the story clings to for long. The focus is more on the task at hand, and it drives the character forward without a need to grind through exposition. However, throughout the game, you’ll discover computer terminals that you can access to read e-mails that slowly unlock more of the narrative. I was always excited to find these since they’re not all out in the open and obvious. Several are hidden away and, according to the tracker, I missed something like 10 of them throughout my 10-hour run.

By the time I reached the end of the game, I had already surmised the bulk of the plot, which I don’t think will be uncommon, yet I still enjoyed witnessing everything that happened. That, in my opinion, is a sign of quality writing and storytelling. To still be compelled to continue even when you know what is going to happen is uncommon in my experience - and really enjoying it is even rarer.

Days of Future Past
The Entropy Centre isn’t perfect. For one, every time I read “Centre,” I say “Cent-reh.” That’s more of a personal problem though, I guess. The only issue that is probably more universal is that there is a point in the game where it feels like it’s progressing toward a natural ending and then it just doesn’t end. You somewhat unceremoniously make your way back to just moving from puzzle room to puzzle room like it didn’t happen. It’s such a cool sequence and probably one of the most memorable in the game, but it ends up making the one or two hours remaining feel much longer.

There aren’t many other critical points I can think of though. The game may not be the most visually impressive – in part due to the lack of diversity in assets – but then it will have absolutely beautiful moments. The trio of voice actors is each fantastic in their own way, the writing is almost always appealing and appropriate, and even the music is fitting throughout. This all coalesces with the already pleasant blend of fast action sequences and slower challenging puzzle gameplay to make the game thoroughly compelling, even with its third-act hiccup. If you’re a fan of Portal or first-person puzzle games in general, this is one you have to try. Plus it has a demo if you’re still on the fence.


If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: Endyo’s Indies, Abbreviated Reviews
 
Endyo

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

SDHQ STEAM DECK PERFORMANCE REVIEW:

Follow our curator page for more Steam Deck reviews and our Twitter for immediate updates on all SDHQ content including reviews, news, and more!


This review is based ONLY on performance of the game on the STEAM DECK.


The Game Itself:


The Entropy Centre is a first-person puzzle game where you are tasked to think...in reverse! Solve complex puzzles with your trusty AI gun ASTRA and manipulate objects in this time-bending adventure to find the truth behind The Entropy Centre and save Earth...if you can. I couldn't help but compare this to Portal 2 a bit, but I wouldn't say it is a negative statement here. I felt a similar joy playing this and I enjoyed the visuals and witty dialog I encountered throughout my time. I can say, without a doubt, it was definitely worth the experience. But now we have to take a look on how it really runs on the Steam Deck!


Steam Deck Performance:


Since the demo, The Entropy Centre has come a long way and definitely gotten significantly better in terms of optimization, but it is not perfect. At max settings, depending on the area, you will get a range of 30-50 FPS with battery drain around 22W - 25W. This fluctuated even more when moving around, so max settings definitely isn't the way to go, at least not like this!

Thankfully, with how much more optimized The Entropy Centre is now, I was able to easily get 3 different builds focusing on different aspects. This one was harder for me to choose which I preferred, but the battery focus will be my favorite as it still feels really smooth, looks great, and lasts a bit longer than the others. For the recommended build, I kept all settings on high except for Shadows and Effect quality, a 1152x720 resolution and FSR Sharpness 1, and resolution scale of 70%, I was able to keep battery drain under 14W most of the time, with the average being around 12.5W for 3+ hours of battery life.

I then proceeded to create a build that would keep almost all settings on ultra with a 100% resolution scale. This was achievable with a 40 FPS cap, shadow quality on high, and TDP limit of 11. While the TDP could be pushed higher and could maybe increase framerate to 50, there were too many times the game dropped framerate noticeably and 40 just felt way more comfortable.

From there, I decided to create a 60 FPS build as well, but it does require some compromises. With this build, you will get around the same battery drain as the quality, but everything will need to be lowered a bit. The compromises aren't so bad in the grand scheme, and it is harder to separate on the smaller screen, but it can be noticeable in certain places regarding high concentrations of shadows.

Regardless of whichever build I chose, there were always certain sections that stuttered a little. This mainly occurred when entering new areas, though running around semi-outside areas that have collapsing architecture tended to slow things down a bit too. These only lasted 5 seconds at most and then went back to normal, but they did still happen and wouldn't completely go away. Otherwise, I didn't have much issue keeping stable framerates!

The Entropy Centre was one of the demos I tried for NEXT last month and loved the premise and visual presentation, so it brings me great pleasure to say it has only gotten better! In the demo, hitting 40 felt like a stretch, but being able to hit 50 and 60 so easily and stable while staying under 20W drain is an accomplishment. Overall, the pros heavily outweigh the ♥♥♥♥ and I am happy to recommend adding this one to your libraries!


SDHQ[steamdeckhq.com] is a website made for curating Steam Deck news, guides, and providing optimization/builds for games on the Deck.
 
BARBECUEDKITTY
4
34 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
本人花了7小时多一点全通关，在这里给出一个比较全面中肯的无剧透评测。

首先给出结论：
一般推荐。
①如果是没怎么玩过解谜类游戏的玩家（轻度玩家），或者对类传送门游戏感兴趣的玩家，推荐试一试，剧情和演出还不错，游戏难度也挺合适；
②如果是解谜游戏玩的比较多的玩家（硬核玩家），或者是想体验解谜设计的玩家，不是很推荐，建议打更低折扣入或者不尝试。

下面详细说一下这游戏的优缺点：
一、机制与谜题设计
解谜类游戏，最看重的还是机制与谜题设计上，因此放在第一个说。这个游戏在这方面可以说发挥很一般，甚至可以给不及格，因此我不太推荐解谜玩家游玩此游戏。
(1) 机制设计。首先是时间逆转这一核心机制，设计的很不错，可玩性很高。但其他元件机制设计的就很一般了，借鉴传送门的元件十分的多，有一些机制甚至看到就会发出“这不就是传送门里面的XX吗”，独有的元件也不是特别让人眼前一亮，创意度不足，不过与时间逆转组合起来深度还是很可以的。
(2) 谜题设计。可以感觉出制作组在谜题设计方面经验很不足，70%-80%的谜题基本只利用了移动轨迹逆向这一点，并没有挖透时间逆转与动量之间的交互性，浪费了机制的好底子。同时由于谜题设计核心思路基本一致，导致熟悉之后基本上摸清楚关卡组成后就能快速找到破关思路，解开谜题也没什么成就感。部分元件出现后活跃了一会就被埋没了，后期谜题设计中基本都很少能见到这些被埋没的元件了，也是比较可惜的点。
(3) 难度曲线。前期难度曲线非常平，中期曲线稍微抖了一些，后期曲线又平了下来，这个曲线非常适合轻度玩家来体验，但对于有经验的玩家或硬核玩家，体验就是极其糟糕的。曲线平的主要原因还是在于谜题设计，谜题的核心破局思路基本上没变化，导致难度也没什么变化，也就只能在复杂度上稍微抬高一些。
二、游戏优化
也是很一般，主要有以下两个问题：①视角移动不够平滑，导致比较容易晕3D，②帧数不稳定，一些场景掉帧极其严重（也可能是我电脑不太行）
三、剧情、场景与演出
还不错，虽然没到震撼人心的水平，但是体验上还是很舒服的。
(1) 剧情。由于不剧透不多做评价，个人认为还可以。
(2) 场景。谜题区域场景做的都挺不错。无意义纯跑路场景个人感觉有点多了。后期有很多全空场景，怀疑是偷懒了。有部分场景建模没打磨好，会让主角卡死动不了，只能重开。
(3) 演出。前期挺一般的，中期引入战斗元素后好起来了，中后期演出水平又有所下滑，怀疑是赶工或者偷懒没打磨好，最后部分演出很可以。总体来说演出还不错。
四、音乐与美术
优秀水准。
(1) 音乐。体验还不错，在该舒缓的时候舒缓，在该紧张的时候能调动起紧张感。不过有些场景没有BGM，不清楚是不是我这边的bug。
(2) 美术。风格只能说很传送门，有利有弊吧，优点是看着很舒服，没有特别刺眼难受的表现。缺点是太像传送门画风导致没有独特的亮点。
 
塞德莎
488 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2023
Самый эпичный пазл в своём роде, после которого я стал носить шапочку из фольги.


Время прохождения на 100% - 9 часов.


✅ - ЭПИК.
Ты начинаешь с того, что идёшь по неоновой дорожке и наблюдаешь за тем, как взрывается планета Земля.

В игре постоянно что-то рушится, и это сделано качественно, куча мелких деталей.


✅ - СЮЖЕТ.
Он так реалистично написан, что ты начинаешь верить в то, что в 2012 году не было конца света, потому что планету отмотали назад.

Сюжет в этой игре - про группу учёных на луне, которая следят за состоянием Земли, и если что-то не так, они отматывают время.


✅ - АСТРА.
ИИ-помощник, который является говорящим оружием с характером.

ИИ в этой игр прописан человечнее, харизматичнее чем в 99% любых других игр.


✅ - ДРАМА.
Ну, куда же без неё.
12-13 главы вызывают мурашки от происходящего, насколько всё правдиво.


✅ - АНИМАЦИИ
Даже в 2023 году непривычно видеть в инди-играх от 1го лица взаимодейтсвие РУКАМИ.
Ты играешь не за камеру, а за полноценного функционирующего человека.


✅ - САУНДТРЕКИ.
Где нужно - это эмбиент.
Где нужно - угнетающие треки (привет 13 глава).


✅ - ДИАЛОГИ / ЗАПИСКИ.
Без научных терминов, рассказывают переживания учёных, кто-чего лишился.

Кто-то не сможет вернуться домой, потому что Землю отмотали слишком далеко, и появился дубликат этого человека, как он родился.


✅ - ПОСЫЛ.
Игра открыто показывает, что сами люди загрязняют планету, из-за чего происходят катаклизмы.


✅ - ГОЛОВОЛОМКИ.
Интересны и уникальны, каждая глава открывает 1 новую фишку, и это не значит, что к 10 главе будет 10 разных механик.
Механик в каждой главе не больше 4-ёх, какие-то используются лишь в 1 главе и это хорошо, что тебя не душат.

Основная механика - перемотка времени.

Уровни сделаны так, что один и тот же можно пройти разными способами, нету конкретного.

Cложность у меня была в моём мышлении - Я на фоне других подобных игр искал какие-то сложных схемы/
"Взять ящик в полёте его поставить на паузу, потом вернуться во времени, прыгнуть, сделать 2 сальто, зайти в меню поставить низкие текстуры, вернуться, перемотать время в будущее, поставить высокие текстуры, взять ящик".
А на деле просто нужно поставить ящик под определённым углом.


✅ - ОПТИМИЗАЦИЯ.
Стабильные 60 ФПС.



❌ -ЛОКАЦИИ.
В игре очень красивая графика, но крайне скудные локации.
Да, есть пляж и на этом всё.
Остальное время - ходи по однообразной лабораторией в окружении однообразных предметов.
Одни и те же папки, одни и те же декорации что на 1 главе что на 10.


❌ -ОЗВУЧКА ГГ.
Не понравилась, по сравнению с Астрой это небо и земля, актриса не вжилась в роль.

Говорит ей 27 лет, а по голосу лет 45, это сильно портит впечатления.


❌ -БАГИ.
Спустя год релиза - предметы падают в текстуры, кривые хит-боксы взрывов, смерть от того что стоишь на мосту, во время его восстановления (это надо по сюжету).


❌ -ЗВУКИ.
Прям не хватало баса от взрывов, чтобы уши аж закладывало.
Из-за этого взрывы это какие-то пуки.


❌ -УДОБСТВО.
1 - Нет фона у субтитров.

2 - Интерактивные предметы (компьютеры, кнопки, кубы) начинают подсвечиваться заранее, а чтобы с ними взаимодействовать нужно сделать ещё 2 шага.

3 - Нет возможности "Ускорить перемотку объекта".

4 - Пазлы с прыжками очень напрягают, т.к. персонаж в полёте крайне неуправляем.

5 - Нет возможности перемещать предметы ВПЕРЁД по времени, если ты вдруг на миллиметр объект переместил от того, куда нужно, то начинай с начала цепочку.

6 - После падения в пропасть ты загружаешься с КТ, лучше было бы если бы я появлялся в месте, где упал.
 
ɆxⱣɍømɨ

21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2023
《The Entropy Centre》是一款乍一看挺有意思，但实际上比较平庸的解谜游戏。

主角Aria从睡梦中醒来，发现自己身处已经空无一人的研究机构——The Entropy Centre当中，而且失去了有关自己如何来到这里的记忆。稍后，主角拿到了本作中用于解谜的主要工具——Handheld Entropy Device（手持式熵设备），并结识了附在设备上的AI助手Astra。主角需要使用这把设备，探索有关自己和The Entropy Centre的真相。

是的，这游戏在种种方面都非常像《传送门》。设定上，长眠中醒来的主角，废弃的科研机构，枪形的解谜工具，这些要素已经够相似了，在真的进入解谜之后，你会发现就连谜题中的要素（箱子、按钮、激光......）都主要受到了《传送门》的影响。当然，核心机制“回溯”和传送门还是很不一样的。

手持式熵设备——我简称为“回溯枪”——可以记录单个物体的运动轨迹，还可以对着一个物体启动回溯，这样，物体可以被回溯到先前运动轨迹中的任意一个位置。如果已经向前（过去）回溯一段，可以选择继续该物体的时间流动，也可以就让该物体暂时静止在某一时刻的状态上，还可以继续向更之前回溯，而唯一不能做的事是“反悔”，让物体返回回溯之前的状态，因为在时间上，这样是在朝未来的方向运动。

看着感觉挺烧脑的，但本作并没有用这个机制做出来什么巧妙的谜题。在几乎所有的谜题当中，都只用到这个机制的一种用法——“远程移动物体”。如果想远程操纵物体从A点移动到B点，玩家要做的就是先让物体到达B点，再将物体放到A点，之后再使用“回溯”移动即可。这确实是这个机制最基本的用法，出现频率最高在所难免，但问题在于，除了这个用法之外，在本作谜题中几乎没有见到还有什么别的用法，最多也就是物体可以静止在某一时刻的状态这一点还算比较有用。

或许是为了弥补对核心机制探索过浅的问题，本作几乎每一章都引入一个新的辅助机制，比如能让主角跳到高处的箱子、会发射激光的箱子......对，基本上就是各种各样的箱子，还有例如传送带、风扇一类可以移动主角和箱子的其它要素。本作最后一个新机制（变换器）倒还算有点新意，其它的真就有点太传统了。

而就算是这样，这些机制也并没有为这个游戏增色多少，因为本作对回溯这个核心机制的探索深度始终没有太大变化。解谜基本上就是一个思路：首先假设没有回溯枪，把整个谜题当传统谜题来解，考虑该让物体怎么走才能过关，然后只需要思维转一个弯——想让物体怎么走，就先让它照着这个路径反着走，这样在回溯时，移动轨迹就是想要的——谜题就基本上解完了。这其中“传统谜题”的部分也不难，只要观察完布局，在哪里需要什么物体基本一目了然，然后就是为最后的回溯创造一个轨迹。在某些谜题中，可能比较难的就是如何依次运用两、三个物体的回溯来完成最终回溯轨迹的构造，但这些也就是一开始出现多物体时有点意思，之后的思路都大差不差。在本作后期，为了增加难度，本作采取的方法是：将几个谜题拼在一个谜题当中，只不过里面每个小谜题的目标都从“到达终点”变成了“到达能获取一个物体的地点”而已。这种硬加复杂度而不增加趣味性的设计都拿出来了，可见实在是黔驴技穷了。

在游玩本作时，我几乎没有感受到任何的“Eureka”（顿悟），这在我看来是解谜游戏不可或缺的本质，也就是说，本作的谜题设计在我心目中是失败的。

同时，本作的游戏体验也不能说很好。为了营造紧张感，在谜题之间穿插一些动作桥段（战斗、追逐等），算是可以理解，但本作中的这些桥段我个人感觉不仅没什么创意，而且数量上还多了一些，甚至还犯了动作和解谜同时出现的问题（说的就是你，那几个“Room Lockdown”阶段），如果稍有不慎，还得重来，给玩家带来挫败感。而且，在很多的谜题中，都需要玩家作出比较准确的动作上的操作，比如跳跃，而一旦踩空，很可能就功亏一篑，因为回溯轨迹必须要重新构造。加上本作的关卡设计有时候感觉没有考虑到适当的容错，玩家摆放物体的位置或者玩家的操作稍微偏移一些，可能就会差一点没法跳过去，这就是纯纯的血压制造机了。

本作的剧情和对话写作，个人感觉还是欠了一些火候。玩到一半，知道人的记忆也可以被回溯之后，这个游戏剧情的走向差不多就可以猜到了，到最后果然如此，放在爆米花电影里估计也算是比较老套的剧情了。对话写作的话，我其实说不上有什么缺点，不过和《传送门》比那还是太难为本作了，不管是幽默的时候，还是紧张的时候，又或是煽情的时候，感觉都差点意思，不太能调动我的情绪。人物塑造就更不用说了，GLaDOS和Wheatley这种级别的角色，我本来也不奢求一个独立游戏就能迎头赶上。

本作为了延长自己寿命，也推出了关卡编辑器和在线分享，只不过不是通过Steam创意工坊。这方面我没有尝试，可能玩家们集思广益的结果会比主线中的谜题更好，就像《传送门2》的优质玩家自制内容也在一些方面超越了原作一样，但我目前没有尝试的想法。

总的来说，我不讨厌这款游戏，但我也实在没有推荐这款游戏的理由。和许多评测中提到的一样，本作确实证明了《传送门》不是那么好学的。如果想要知道更多《传送门》中做得很好，但本作却不幸掉坑的方面，可以看看我好友wynick27的评测。

你可能会知道一些其它的创意和谜题设计深度不甚匹配的解谜游戏，比如最近的《Viewfinder》，以及之前的《Superliminal》和《Storyteller》等。你可能也会知道，我虽然也意识到了这些游戏中谜题设计方面的问题，但还是都给这些游戏给出了推荐，那为什么到本作就给了不推荐呢？我个人想到的原因是，我是一个非常容易被创意打动的玩家，不管是玩法、机制上的，还是只是技术上、表面上的，《Viewfinder》和《Superliminal》就用技术巧妙实现了很特殊的视觉效果，《Storyteller》不说实现，起码思想上是有潜力的，但本作无论是哪个方面，都感觉更逊色了一些。当然，你也可以忽略这些，认为我就是双标，我也不会反驳什么。

结论：个人不推荐。
 
OldCaptainWZJ

I expected portal-like puzzle game. The game delivered what I expected.
No portals, but cubes and a time-rewinding gun.

It is not difficult, but it took a bit of time to start thinking with time-rewinding logic.

Recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2022
Ну нет, это, конечно, не портал. Настроение не то, персонажи другие, вообще всё другое. Общего с портал, да и с талос, и с другими подобными, тут только то, что это - головоломка от первого лица. И весьма неплохая головоломка, построенная на принципе отката времени для отдельных предметов. Да, мы уже видели подобные приёмчики в других играх, но здесь на этом построена вся механика и вся сюжетная история. Задачки несложные, больше времени отнимает прицельные прыжки по местным "панелям веры", компактным батутам. Я постоянно промахивался с приземлением и всё решение головоломки приходилось раз за разом повторять. В остальном - отличная игра на несколько вечеров. Любителям жанра точно можно рекомендовать к прохождению.
 
RG
1,505 produits enregistrés
0
61 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
22
Recommandé
31.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2023
A strange beast among puzzle games. They are a very specific type of games that usually seem to think that all the mental effort you have to put into playing them deserves an appropriate and immediate reward, that they are going out of their way to offer to you promptly, making you feel like a proper hero at the end and showering you with endless love and reverent affection for being so smart and doing your job so outstandingly. The Entropy Centre, though, is, oddly enough, a puzzle game with a grim and rather depressing story, there is no reward for saving the world to be had here, because there is literally no saving the world to be done in this game. The game also doesn’t care much about your ego and has no one singing you praises or cool songs (remember “Still Alive”?) at the end. Nevertheless, it seems to be very aware of the genre’s latest conventions and is telling said story with lots of charm, cuteness and lightheartedness, Portal-style (the many Steam reviews lovingly mentioning The Weighted Companion Cube eloquently attest to that), which only makes the carefully foreshadowed conclusion all the punchier.

Furthermore, not only is the game aware of the genre’s conventions, but it plays expertly with them and isn’t afraid to tell you early on exactly how it will end, knowing perfectly well that you won’t believe it and will still push forward, ever confident in your resolve and happily transported by the vision of glory that’s already beginning to take form inside your head. “Yeah, sure, game, do your thing, raise the stakes all you want, I’m sure I’ll overcome everything you throw at me in the end.” Will you?... Well, I’d like to tell you how it all plays out, it would make a fine ending for this review, but it could be considered spoilers, and I’ve been recently reprimanded for writing spoilery reviews, so allow me to end it by saying that Aria Adams, The Entropy Centre’s puzzle-solving protagonist might be the most deserving of a hug character I’ve ever encountered in a video game.
 
moreaboutcrows
1,758 produits enregistrés
24

Non recommandé
19.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 aout 2023
I would rather give this game a mixed than a negative review. Although the puzzles are nice and challenging, it still feels like a chore and "work" to progress through it. It is definetly not Portal. It has some similarities but liking Portal does not automatically make you like TEC. What killed the game in my opinion is the pixel-precision-fokkery of a frustrating jump-and-run game. More than once you feel that timing and exact jumping matters more than solving puzzles. At least one review here mentions the jump boxes as the main culprit and i tend to agree.
The story is between meh and alright, the voice acting of Aria (the person you are playing in this game) is pleasant and likeable. The jokes are stale and nowhere near the level of Glados or Wheatly for that matter (another Portal reference, sorry about that).
So in short, if you don't mind pixel-precision-millisecond jump and run action with some mind-bending puzzles (some are really hard in comparision to others. I guess it is because sometimes a clear path is missing and multiple solutions are possible) then this game is for you. Get it for a good discount. I would recommend spending 10-15 Euro on it, not more.
 
auststefan
0
26 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2022
Portal started something special 15 years ago and The Entropy Centre continues its legacy in its own way. It is a good puzzle game that borrows a few ideas and executes them well. The core element of rewinding objects through time has a decent learning curve and suitably harder challenges near the end. Detours through backrooms, and the external lush biome, serve as energizing breaks between the puzzle chambers. And the lively AI companion, ASTRA, helps to make saving the world a bit less lonely. Although it could have used a trim and polish, there is still eight hours of solid entertainment here. It is definitely worth playing The Entropy Centre, if you get time.

Read full review[www.newgamenetwork.com]
 
nutcrackr

Vi umas reviews da gringa e varia entre 5h a 13 pra zerar ( com 13 cap ) ainda estou a me desgustar desta obra...
O jogo no ultra e digno de ser deslumbrar
A historia e boa (caso queria ler nos computadores )

Recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Vidéo YouTube™: [Episode 1] Kaylee Plays: The Entropy Centre! 
Vues : 128
**THIS IS A VOD FROM MY TWITCH LIVESTREAM. There will be pauses, there will be moments where I'm reading chat, there will be pee breaks, and more.


My Opinion on The Entropy Centre

The Entropy Centre was a game that I didn't realize I needed in my life or an experience that I needed. I went into this game knowing that I am not the best at puzzles. I struggled immensely with the Portal series, but I still loved the series, regardless of my struggles. The Entropy Centre is very Portal-inspired, with exceptional level design and a huge mind f**k of an ending. Some levels left me dumbfounded and stumped, but I ended up loving the design once I cracked the puzzle. That being said, if you're someone who is not great at puzzles, please don't let this scare you into thinking you won't be able to beat this game! There is Google to help you if you ever get stuck, and don't feel bad or ashamed if you Google an answer. I will say that figuring out the puzzle yourself is the best feeling you'll ever have. So gratifying. I highly recommend this game to all people who enjoy the Portal series or even just a great puzzle solving game with a vastly realistic and intriguing storyline.

The Entropy Centre is a strikingly gorgeous game, and this was yet another game that I found myself taking countless screenshots throughout my entire playthrough just because everything was just so f***ing beautiful. I couldn't help myself. Take your time and enjoy the scenery. The characters introduced to you during the game are just so easily likeable and charming. I loved the main character, Aria, and your Entropy energy gun that you carry around through the game; an AI is attached to this gun (P.E.A.). Her name is Astra! She was possibly one of my favorite characters, as she reminded me so much of a nicer and friendlier GLaDOS with her quirky humor and snarky comebacks to everything. I found myself laughing recurrently at Aria and Astra's interactions with each other, and it was just the cherry on top of the whole game, in my opinion.

There are 27 achievements, and they seem not too difficult to achieve. So, this might be a great game for my fellow completionists out there who like to achievement hunt and 100% games, like myself. There was a sort of "collectible" to keep an eye out for, and this was basically lore or notes that you found on computers or terminals. There are 76 "intel" that you can find, and I actually really enjoyed trying to find every single one and reading all the entries! It will provide you with an abundance of information about the world and the research/projects being carried out at The Entropy Centre. I recommend looking for them and reading them if lore is something that you're into! I did not find all of them through my first playthrough; I believe I finished the game at around 56/76 intel, which is pretty good for a first run, and I felt like I scoured for them, so there must be lots of secret rooms that I just didn't find!

I never experienced anything related to framerate issues at all. I can recall one negative review towards this game, complaining about framerate that apparently made the game unplayable, but the game ran like butter for me. Maybe this person didn't have a great GPU, but I have no clue as they did not put their specs in the comments of their review, *even after the developer asked for these details as well to try and solve their problem*. The game feels very optimized, which is phenomenal for launch day! But again, this was my experience, and others' might be different, so read around for some other reviews! To follow with this, the only thing I didn't really enjoy about the game was the saving system. Sometimes you would die by mistake and it would load back up—not an annoying amount—but if you kept dying, you would have to walk to a puzzle room again and collect any intel you collected previously again, as it would reset anything you collected before death. Like I said, it wasn't too bad, but it wasn't something that I loved at the same time. This might make it hard to gather some of the intel (collectibles) through another playthrough because you won't be able to just load a chapter, gather the intel, save, and load another chapter. It will require another full playthrough (and this is okay). I love replayability!

All in all, The Entropy Centre was an amazing experience, and it will definitely give you food for thought; it is thought-provoking in more ways than one. I definitely recommend this game, especially at full price. You will fully enjoy the story it has to tell and fall in love with the concept. I hope you enjoy it as much as I did, and thank you so much for reading my review!

Rating: 9.5/10

⭐ While you're here, why don't you follow me on my Steam Curator page? 🥰
 
Kaykrisify

Recommandé
21.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

你说的对，但是《The Entropy Centre》是由Stubby Games自主研发的一款全新第一人称解谜游戏。游戏发生在一个被称作「熵中心」的幻想世界，在这里，被公司选中的人将被授予「手持式熵设备」，导引时间回溯之力‌​​​‌‌‌‌‌‌‌‌​​‌‌​‌‌‌​‌​。
你将扮演一位名为「亚丽雅」的神秘角色，在自由的旅行中邂逅形状各异、能力独特的箱子们，和他们一起解决谜题，产生熵能量——同时，逐步发掘「灾难性事件」的真相。


传送门不是那么好学的

万能模板还是很适合概括游戏内容的。本作是典型的Portal-like，虽然核心由空间变成了时间。但是首先是相对于空间连接机制，时间回溯本身不算新鲜了，从早期的Blinx，到后来的Braid，Gardens Between，再到去年的双人成行，时间回溯改变场景连通状态这个玩法出现更早而且更多游戏使用。本作的特色是可以储存，而且还能显示每个物体单独的时间线，这让游戏的玩法扩展有了很多可能。
但无论是空间连接还是时间回溯，独立存在的情况下玩法深度并不高，非常需要和地形以及各种互动物体机制结合。但本作在在互动机制上就没什么创新了，大部分机制都和传送门系列一致，或是换了个形式但是本质没变。

虽然机制类似，但因为核心不同这本身不是问题，重要的是《传送门》不是那么容易抄的游戏。 Elyot Grant在解谜游戏设计讲座上说过，要警惕互动媒介的诱惑。 主要包括物理元素，多状态，线性和情节驱动这四点。 因为解谜游戏实际上是关于Eureka Moment的，它是离散状态的，而物理元素是连续状态的。也就是说玩家不能很容易的判断是自己思路错了还是操作的问题。复杂的状态比较难推理，而情节驱动需要线性化，线性导致难度不容易控制，难度高了玩家卡关只能查攻略，难度低了会给玩家太多线索，降低Eureka Moment的冲击力。 传送门恰好是违反了这四条建议，但是又获得了极大成功，所以产生了很多模仿者，但这是因为Valve有资源进行更多测试，进行了大量的测试优化，对于独立游戏来说这就不那么容易了。


本作给我的感觉就是踩了很多这方面的坑，首先就是本作的核心，回溯每个物体时间线30秒。游戏中有多个物体，每个物体的位置在30秒时间内是个巨大的状态空间。 游戏里大部分是踏板式机关，但我觉得这样反而让各种状态更明确了。 问题出现在时间元素和空间元素不同，是需要长线规划路线的，但本作对地形的利用大多是高度差，依赖于平台跳跃元素或者其他精确控制的地方，导致游戏体验不是很好。
本身3d平台跳跃相比2d就不容易精确控制，一般都会给主角正下方设置一个影子帮助确定落点。但本作是第一人称，而且主角的身体是没有建模的，落点控制难度超级加倍。再加上长距离规划，可以说是中间某一部没跳好就要整体重来。 再加上主角溶于水，而且时间枪是只能回溯时间，是单向的，如果错了不能再返回之前的状态，所以不小心掉水里或者回溯过了一点都要重来。

之前也提到，如果选择线性关卡模式难度不容易控制，本作走的是简单路线， 整体难度很低，难度曲线也很平，还有不少hand-holding，甚至有的地方会画不同颜色的线框告诉玩家应该把什么东西摆在哪里。游戏一共有15章，几乎每个章节都会加一个新机制，而一个章节就四五关，前两关基本都是教学关，后面的也没多少难度。 和之前说的问题结合起来，玩的感觉就是观察一圈场景就大概知道应该怎么走，但实际执行起来经常出各种问题导致需要重来，相当于没有多少Eureka Moment，反而产生各种烦躁感，游戏只有个别谜题设计比较出色。而后两章游戏虽然提示说是高难关卡，但实际玩下来感觉比前面难度还低。 而本身这个核心是可以做的很有深度的，感觉游戏没有用好机制，而且每个机制大多只有一种用法，组合也比较少，有的机制过了当前章节就不怎么出现了，整体关卡设计水平不足。


游戏虽然有试玩版，但是试玩版内容和正式版不完全一样，是没有过渡的，只有谜题，而且由于是在前期，所以很多问题不会显现出来，毕竟游戏场景和设定都很不错。于是试玩版玩过后我非常期待成品。但看到结尾宣传片很多的动作成分就感觉有点担忧。事实证明我的担忧没有错， 游戏在章节之间确实穿插了不少动作要素，不过加入动作成分本身并不是问题，毕竟一直解谜容易疲劳，动作成分其实结合下演出能起到调节游戏节奏的作用。
这其中就包括逃生部分，可以说主角Aria走哪塌哪的本事让劳拉和德雷克都自叹不如，毕竟那两位都是走过以后建筑才塌，而本作是建筑永远在主角刚靠近的时候塌，要一边回溯时间一边逃生。


游戏中期开始就会出现怪物，形式就是小机器人，主角只有几种打怪方式，一是回溯子弹，二是直接走过去把敌人扔出去，还有就是后期扔爆炸方块。其实战斗这部分并没有多大意思，也对剧情没多大作用，还好大部分都是和解谜分开的。
但最糟糕的解谜中加战斗的情况还是出现了，有几个地方是无限刷怪的，主角不但要躲怪还要到处跑踩机关，一不小心就死了，体验非常差，属于是设计上极为失败的地方。

剧情方面我觉得包括演出对话，还有碎片收集叙事以及整体的首尾衔接都是很不错的，Astra很多对话都挺有趣。 收集品只有电脑中的邮件，在游戏设定下还算合理，也很好的补充了游戏的设定。不过我没有找齐，但是通关后也不显示收集进度，然后也不能单独重打章节补齐这点不是很好。 而且我不太满意的一点是收集品对结局没有影响，整个游戏只有单一结局。
虽然说结局也算正常，但是这时间循环结局主角干了半天结果实际没有意义这点我是不喜欢的。我觉得问题之一就是这个结局实际上中期就能看出来，但剧情还是按照预料这样发展，和谜题难度一样没有起伏。

虽然说了这么多缺点，但通关后看制作人员我才发现这个游戏居然是个人制作的（不算配音，本地化和发行）。尽管现在引擎技术比较成熟了，但一个人能做出这种体量的游戏也是相当不容易的。 总之，如果不是重度解谜玩家，又比较擅长平台跳跃的话，玩起来应该还是不错的。但并不推荐原价买，特别是现在建议售价已经涨了的情况下。

7/10
 
wynick27

15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2023
The Entropy Centre is a well-rounded, excellent, puzzle game. I really enjoyed playing it.

Gameplay
The puzzles are about moderate in difficulty. I generally finished each puzzle in 7 minutes or less. I prefer that. A variety of new puzzles with new elements is more fun to me than working on the same complex puzzle for an hour. The speed with which I completed each puzzle felt on pace with the urgency of the story. It is well balanced for my tastes.

As each mechanic is introduced, the game subtly guides you on how to solve the puzzle. The game does a fantastic job showing you what you cannot do (I put a lot of weight on this because it lets me quickly filter out bad ideas and "interesting techniques" so I can solve the puzzle correctly). While there is one objectively correct way to solve the puzzle, I always felt free to step through it the way I wanted.

If you know what it's like to set up a complex solution only to fail at the last step and have to set up everything again, then you know it gets old quick. That thought never crossed my mind while playing this game. The rare times when I did have to set up again, it wasn't a chore. The mechanics of the game are well implemented.

Somewhat unrelated side note: this game lets you jump whenever you want! I know it's a weird thing to point out but I always feel choked when games don't have or disable jumping. Thank you, Entropy Centre, for letting me jump!

Story & Characters
The story ties directly in with the main mechanic in the game. The story is unique and it explained why you're solving the puzzles. It's a "Sci-Fi" explanation, but it works perfectly; it doesn't feel like a cheesy justification.

There are three voices in the game's story: the player character, a companion, and a facility narrator (I guess you could call him a narrator? He gives status reports/updates as you progress). All three play well off of each other. The voice tone is lighthearted and witty, which generally compliments the game. However, it can feel a little calm during the action sequences. The voice lines fit with each other but don't necessarily portray what's actually on-screen. You could be in a fight for your life and your character sounds like 4% more afraid. This is honestly my only gripe with the game. It doesn't pull your focus away but it also doesn't draw you in as much as it could.

Conclusion
It's clear that this game took heavy inspiration from the Portal series. However, the "entropy" mechanic is executed so well that it doesn't feel like a Portal clone. It feels more like a successor.

The magic that made Portal fantastic is in The Entropy Centre: a fun and dynamic core mechanic, a story to drive progression, and some witty commentary.

10/10
 
Flux
0

13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante

Non recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
The game is fine. There are just a few problems from making it really worth playing

1. Every puzzle starts to feel the same. You place blocks on buttons in reverse order and then rewind.
2. Action portions are low stakes because you can instantly rewind any threat before it gets even slightly close to you
3. The main plot element that's meant to give you a sense of urgency happens in act 3 and there are 12 acts after it. By act 8 there wasn't any progress in the story and it had lost any pressure.
4. Every piece of lore I've had to go out of my way to find, really thinking outside of the box, have been mundane and uninteresting. Making it across an impossible chasm to open up a computer and be told "2 for 1 taco Tuesdays are cancelled until further notice."

nikita_zamaljutdinov
0
38 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juin 2023
When I bought this game, I was sure that I was going to enjoy it. On paper it has everything: it's basically a clone of Portal but with a new interesting concept, beautiful graphics, good sound design, and a new mystery to solve... What could go wrong? you might ask. Well... Spoilers: Everything. And since this game even doesn't hide that it is trying to replicate Portal, I'm going to compare them on some aspects.

Gameplay.
Honestly, I got bored even before I was halfway through the game, and the only thing that kept me going was the plot (but about it later). First of all, puzzles are very repetetive. At some point I even thought "wait, didn't I already go through this puzzle?" Also, there were only a few puzzles after after completing which I felt satisfied. In most cases you just immediately understand how to solve the puzzle but you have to reverse all the steps in your mind and spend a few minutes just moving cubes around. Secondly, The concept of puzzles with time rewinding sounds a lot more interesting in theory than it actually is in practice. The whole gameplay literally comes down to 3 things: walk (you can't even run), jump on jumping cubes (normal jump height is extremely low, so it's pointless) and press ONLY ONE BUTTON to rewind cubes to the buttons/laser receptors to open the door. I think I don't have to remind you that in Portal you ACTUALLY INTERACT with the world and physics... Hell, I'd really better spent this time jumping through the portals with no purpose.

Story.
As I said the story was one and only reason I finished this game. You start with a very intriguing question "where did everybody go? why everything is destroyed?", then you find your portal gun entropy gun and woman AI that tells you to complete puzzles (feels new to me :))
But okay, to be honest, first 70% of the story felt really good. The chatter between the protagonist (Aria) and AI (Astra) is probably one of the brightest parts of the game, although having some extremely stupid "What could that mean?" questions sometimes. And I was still going to praise the plot 1 or 2 hours before the completion. But that ending... it's just not the way to write a compelling story. It destroyed everything it was built on. Now there will be LITE spoilers to finish the topic (they literally tell you this in the middle of playthrough).
Obviously, You save the world in the end. But it doesn't matter. They saved it hundreds of times and at the end of the day humanity kills itself anyway. Although I like the moral message that's behind this and I think this plot may even work in a movie, it's totally inappropriate for a game where you have to feel a sense of victory, not just watch things happen without ability to change anything.

Level design.
Let's talk about the believability of the world. I mean, puzzle areas are puzzle areas, but if you want to show the world around them, it must feel real. Yes, I understand that they tried to integrate a certain challenge between the main puzzles themselves. But was it worth sacrificing the plausibility of the world for that? I'm not sure. I just kept catching myself thinking "I don't believe it". I dont believe that the safest and most convenient way to move between working stations (where regular staff work - not puzzle operatives) is to fly through the air over the void. I don't belive that to open the door on one level of living quarters you have to activate the button on another level (I wouldn't want to live here xD). These are only two examples, but there were a lot more... And I'm not even talking about destructions that conveniently happen to occur at exactly the right place and time so that you can overcome an obstacle. It feels more like a neverending contrived puzzle, rather than a real destructed facility.
Also, I want to mention that rooms and corridors between puzzle areas are bleak and boring. I'm an explorer type of player, and as usual I started to explore every possible corner for interesting details and information that I can discover... The game broke me pretty quickly. With few exceptions, there is nothing to explore. You have some PCs providing plot information, and that's all. There is a lot of objects lying around, but they're all repeating and you basically can't interact with them. At some point I was already so used to this emptiness that I even missed two achievements that game suddenly decided to add to ONE chapter.

Graphics.
Last and probably least, visuals. I see this game as a good example of the possibilities that Epic is providing with UnrealEngine. On first look, everything is stunning. Lights, shaders, effects and particles are extremely beautiful. And that's what most of the players will probably see. But I have a curse - I am a 3d artist myself. So I wasn't surprised to find out that this game was basically created by one man... (Huge respect to him anyway! bcs I know how hard it is to create a game more than most of the people out there) I don't want to dive deep into issues of textures and models, but I couldn't stop noticing them all the time as I played. You know, I replayed Portal 2 couple of months ago and my god it does still look beautiful. Yes, UE provides this modern shine and volume for everybody, but if you peel that layer off, you can see that visual quality of this game is not so far away from the game, released in 2011. It's crazy to think that one man nowadays can achieve similar results to a huge studio 10 years ago...

Yeah, I know this was a lot of text, but I just wanted to share my genuine thoughts and feelings about this game. Hope this was helpful or at least interesting to read. If so, I'd be happy to see your like :)
 
simplymaxx
42 produits enregistrés
0
43 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
15.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2023
... I'm pretty grudging about this recommendation, to be honest.

This game isn't bad enough for me to *not* recommend it, but ... boy, does it lack polish. And when I say "polish", I include some pretty fundamental things that unfortunately would require a lot more than a few minor updates to fix.

The single biggest problem, IMO, is the lack of consistency with the mechanics of the Entropy Device. Putting aside minor real-physics quibbles and suspension of disbelief questions regarding whether it's possible for *anything* a few humans can do on their own to generate enough of any kind of energy to materially affect an entire planet, even within the game's own setting the device isn't particularly consistent. One of the very first things the game tells you is to not point the device at anything living -- but shortly afterward we're also told that the entire purpose of the center is to periodically rewind the Earth, so what's the problem? I can imagine that the answer is more "it's a bad idea that can invoke nightmares if you do it wrong" but that should be *in the game*, not something I make up. Gameplay-wise, most things can be interacted with while being stopped or reversed, but cubes can't, purely because that would make some puzzles too easy -- and that sort of obvious game patch completely breaks immersion to me, especially since I think about it every puzzle. In fact, you can't really interact with cubes as physics objects at all -- can't climb on them, can't throw them, except the specially designated "Tall Cube" -- even though you can certainly bounce off the Jump Cube and pick up and throw the presumably-solid-metal security bots that are if anything *larger* than the cubes.

The game tries to hide the fact that you're stuck in a time loop, rewinding Earth again and again without any real hope of success or even progress, but... well, honestly, if you're paying attention it's obvious almost from the start. At no point does Aria even try to find a "path not taken", something she and only she could do since the abandonment of the Centre to try and save the world -- and since there's nobody else, of course it won't work. Of course you're just going to end up having to do it all over again. Even without the announcer telling me it's been something like ten million subjective years since the last time anyone bothered to update it, it was pretty obvious just from the fact that Aria had nothing really to contribute other than boneheaded dedication. (And as a side note, that sort of lifespan strains belief, the Centre looks like it's only been a hundred or less, and it can't just be because of the rewinds or it'd look brand new instead.) So from midway through the game, at the latest, you already can realize all your efforts will be in vain and the future will refuse to change, to borrow a quote, which really saps the motivation to keep solving all these puzzles.

Which brings me to my last point: Aria actually speaking introduces the major problem that she doesn't really speak enough. There's a reason games like this usually have silent protagonists: it's because otherwise, it's very easy to create dissonance between "what sort of person you think you're playing" and "the person the authors have written". Aria is written, at least to start, as a new puzzle operative, an unjaded employee; surely she should have a stronger reaction when the Earth appears as a molten ball of lava? She reacts appropriately to the explosion itself, but I certainly was very surprised when just a few minutes of gameplay later the entire thing has apparently molten. Similarly, at the end I was practically screaming at her to ask Astra if she was seeing the same "ghosts" and "hallucinations" she was seeing, but no dice there either.

... Anyway. It's a decent enough Portal clone with a few interesting puzzles and a plot that could theoretically have been fun. Don't buy it at full price, though. And if you're the sort that's more interested in lore than the game itself, probably don't bother at all.
 
linkhyrule5
3
37 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2022
The story was engaging enough that I wanted to keep going and see its conclusion, but the gameplay was painfully tedious.

You can solve the puzzles pretty quickly, but then you have to shuffle a bunch of boxes around and rewind time to actually execute your solution. The "ah-ha!" moment where you feel clever for solving a puzzle immediately turns to boredom as you sit there waiting for the springboard block to slowly rewind into position in front of the exit. And you better not mess up that jump, because you'll have to start over and move all the blocks again if you do. Tedious.

Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2023
Придя в себя в 385 тысячах километрах от Земли, в лунном Энтропийном Центре, Арья и не думала - что на ее плечи ляжет спасение 8 миллиардов человек!
Теперь она должна пройти безумную череду логических тестов и починить Энтропийный преобразователь, чтобы исправить Великую Катастрофу и узнать - как она оказалась в самом Центре Энтропии!

    Понравилось:
  • + Наличие достижений
  • + Поддержка геймпада
  • + Наличие облачных сохранений
  • + Локализация на несколько языков, в том числе и на русский
  • + Юмор
  • + Ретро-футуризм
  • + Интересные логические задачи
  • + Антуражный амбиент
  • + Глубокий сюжет
  • + Поддержка mod.io
  • + Поддержка пользовательских уровней
  • + Наличие редактора уровней
  • + Возможность прохождения уровней с помощью “альтернативных путей” не задуманных разработчиком

    Не понравилось:
  • - Проблемы с прыжками на платформы/движущиеся ленты конвейера
  • - Возможность застрять в текстурах/между объектами и невидимой стеной
    The Entropy Centre - Застревание в текстурах 
    Une vidéo de The Entropy Centre
    Par : Astaritus
    Во время прохождения 14 уровня - персонаж не удержался на кособокой ленте конвейера и.. Упала между лентой и скалой. Из-за чего дальнейшая игра была невозможна

  • - Исчезновение аксессуаров энтропийной пушки после перезагрузки уровня/смерти/загрузки сохранения
    Аксессуары для Астры 
    Création de la communauté pour The Entropy Centre
    Par : Astaritus
    В первое прохождение выбрал для Астры - соломенную шляпу. Во второй заход - решил, что пришло время солнцезащитных очков!

  • - Наличие тумана на уровнях
  • - Визуальный глитч табло энтропийной пушки, в случае если игрок остановит/взаимодействует с конвейером, а затем будет использовать другие объекты - что будет показывать “бесконечность” петли на всех предметах
  • - Возможность перемещаться по выступам некоторых стен/плит пола
    The Entropy Centre - Альтернативный путь 
    Une vidéo de The Entropy Centre
    Par : Astaritus
    В связи с разрушением Entropy Center - игрок может использовать выступы плит и стен для преодоления многих задач, в обход "логическому" решению разработчиков.

  • - Единая высота объектов при перемещении их в руках
  • - Высокий куб плохо различим на фоне окружающего мусора/трав
  • - Баг с плавающими кубами
    https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3114320172
    https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3114319750
  • - Отсутствие статистики по главам в графе “Выбор главы”, для сбора коллекционных предметов
  • - Отсутствие индикации авто сохранения игрового прогресса во время прохождения игры
  • - Наличие невидимых стен мешающих исследованию окружающего мира
  • - Визуальный глитч во время “Локдауна”, при котором игрок может взять в руки бота и выйти с ним из комнаты. При этом бот исчезнет, а надпись “Запустить” будет присутствовать до следующего уровня/смерти/загрузки игры
    https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3115807658
  • - Визуальный глитч во время побега от Ботов на 10 уровне, при котором один лифт - из которого должен появится Бот, является открытой. Но после того как игрок проходит триггер события, она оказывается закрытой, после чего открывается чтобы выпустить Бота
  • - Слабая проработка механики перемещения с помощью потоков воздуха вентиляторов
  • - Возможность выйти за пределы карты
    https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3116691204

Вывод:
“The Entropy Centre” - это игра в жанре платформер с элементами головоломок, разработанная компанией Stubby Games и выпущенная в 2022 году на платформах PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One и Xbox Series X/S.

Сюжет игры разворачивается вокруг главной героини, которая попадает в медленно разрушаемый Исследовательский Центр, полный сложных механизмов, роботов и тестовых камер. Игроку предстоит исследовать это место попутно разгадывая головоломки на своем пути и преодолевать препятствия - чтобы понять как исправить критическое событие, что и привело Энтропийный Центр к разрушению.

Графика в игре выполнена в стиле ретро-футуризма, с яркими и насыщенными цветами. Окружение и визуальные эффекты - детально проработаны, а анимация объектов - плавная и приятная для глаз.

Геймплей в “The Entropy Centre” состоит из решения множества головоломок, связанных с использованием различных кубов и устройств. Игрок должен использовать свою логику, умение быстро принимать решения и хорошую координацию движений, чтобы успешно проходить все поставленные перед ним задачи.

Некоторые из головоломок могут быть сложными и требовать от игрока использования разных стратегий и подходов. Однако стоит взглянуть на картину под “другим” углом - как решение приходит довольно быстро. Также игроки могут использовать некоторые глитчи, что были непреднамерно оставлены разработчиком и помогают проходить некоторые комнаты быстрее, чем “официальное” решение.

Одним из недостатков игры является то, что некоторые части головоломок имеют похожий паттерн решения, из-за чего у игроков может появится ощущение - что задачи повторятся.

Однако, в целом, “The Entropy Centre” представляет собой увлекательную и интересную игру, которая может прийтись по вкусу любителям головоломок и необычных сюжетов. Что помимо этого обладает качественной графикой, интуитивно понятным управлением и затягивающим игровым процессом.
 
Astaritus

I found Entropy Centre to be a great puzzle game.

There are very obvious similarities to Portal 2 in many ways but it is unique enough to be fresh and exciting. The story was exciting and the puzzles were generally exciting without being to difficult.

Many of the puzzles can be solved by just thinking through the steps backwards which made it start to feel a bit repetitive. Generally, replaying the steps backwards got more difficult to execute and identify the steps as the game progresses.

17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3
Non recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2023
Analyze rapide : un sous-Portal

Analyze détaillée : En jouant à ce jeu, on comprends exactement ce qui fait la force de Portal, et ce qui manque cruellement à The Entropy Center : Un gameplay logique, et un level design intéressant.

La base:
Dans les deux jeux, vous vous réveillez dans une base secrète et abandonnée, où une technologie révolutionnaire a été développé, et vous cherchez à sortir du complexe, accompagnée d'une IA qui vous soumet à des énigmes et commente vos actions. Un Portal-very like, donc.

Le gameplay :
Dans TEC, vous obtenez l'entropie gun, une arme qui permet de remonter le temps des objets, jusqu'à 30 secondes. Vous pouvez mettre en pause un objet, et quand vous le débloquerez, il reprendra sa course originelle. Ça, ce sont les règles de bases. Maintenant les exceptions :
- Pas tous les objets ne sont soumis à l'Entropy Gun, seulement les objets des salles de tests. Et les parties des murs qui s'écroulent. Mais pas ceux déjà écroulés. Et certains objets sépcifiques, comme les ballons. Mais pas les autres.
- Un objet mis en pause est immatériel, ils peuvent traverser d'autres objets et vous ne pouvez pas marcher dessus. Sauf les cubes de plateformes. Sauf les piliers qui s'écroulent. Sauf les parties de passerelles écroulés que vous devez rembobiner en restant dessus.
- Utiliser l'entropie gun pour résoudre des puzzles génère de la force entropique. Mais seulement dans les salles de test, jamais en dehors dans les couloirs ou les fondations.
- Les objets gardent leur mometum une fois "débloqué", un objet qui a chuté rechutera. Mais si vous déplacez avec et que vous le mettez en pause, une fois débloqué son momentum est nul. Et si vous refaite faire un saut en boucle à un objet (saut + rembobinage + saut), il ne retombe pas exactement de la même façon, qu'importe son momentum.

Voila. Les règles de ce jeu se contredisent sans cesse. Et là la comparaison avec Portal est primordial.
- Dans un jeu où on a une arme qui créer des portails de téléportation, le jeu nous explique qu'ils ne peuvent être mis que sur des surfaces spécifiques, couvertes de poussières de lune. Cela permettait au joueur de comprendre immédiatement les limites du gameplay.
- Dans un jeu où on a une arme qui peut rembobiner le temps, le jeu nous explique...rien. On ne peut pas rembobiner le vivant (alors que le centre rembobine en boucle l'humanité, mais on est plus à une incohérence prêt) ni un autre Entropique Gun, et c'est tout, rien d'autre.
Donc premier gros point négatif : le jeu ne fait aucun sens. On découvre encore des exceptions après plusieurs heures de jeu.

Le Level Design
- Dans Portal, au bout d'un moment, vous finissez par vous échapper de la suite de salle d'énigmes, ce qui vous permet de déambuler dans "l'envers du décor", en tentant de vous échapper des pièges tendus par l'IA
- Dans TEC, vous resterez bien sagement à faire toutes les énigmes du centre, parce que cela recharge l'énergie entropique du centre. Pour sauver le centre, et comme excuse pour le scénario, les devs n'ont rien trouvé de mieux que "quand on fais des énigmes ça recharge". Il y a littéralement tout un tas de mail à lire qui expliquent que la procédure c'est de se faire rembobiner soi même pour "redécouvrir les énigmes et pouvoir les refaire" ! Si c'est pour avoir ce niveau d'écriture, mieux vaut ne pas faire de scénario.
Vous allez donc déambuler d'énigme en énigme comme un gentil petit rat de laboratoire, avec 2-3 moments "stressants" pour vous tenir éveillé.
J'ai failli arrêter en plein milieu jusqu'à une séquence au 2/3 tiers de l'aventure qui change completement de level design et qui m'a fait dire : "Ah ok, enfin une nouvelle proposition, c'est chouette, enfin ça innove". Elle dure une dizaine de minutes, et ensuite le jeu te dit LITTÉRALEMENT QUE TU DOIS RETOURNER FAIRE DES ÉNIGMES. Mais sérieux ?!? Comment tuer le peu de fun que tu proposes à tes joueurs..

Et parlons en des énigmes : Vous avez compris qu'il fallait faire l'énigme à l'envers pour pouvoir rembobiner les objets dans le bon ordre ? Bien joué, vous connaissez la réponse à 95% des énigmes! Quelques unes un peu retords vont peut être vous demander de réfléchir sur la suite d'actions à rembobiner, mais sinon c'est tout. J'ai passé (beaucoup!) plus de temps à pester contre les sauts (de ♥♥♥♥♥) qu'à réfléchir aux énigmes.
Et c'est tellement dommage, y'avait un tel potentiel: Arrêter les objets dans le temps pour permettre de créer de nouveaux chemins (pas les trucs scriptés hein), avoir un objet en rembobinage et un autre en avance normal pour les faire rebondir l'un sur l'autre, reconstituer des objets dans des ennemis...

Bref: Une bonne idée mal amenée et un ennui progressif qui s'installe.. ça aurait pu être tellement mieux.
Et pour finir sur une note positive : les graphismes sont jolies et l'IA compagnon est rigolote.
 
Bergil
1
13 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
12.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2023
I'm giving this a positive review, but I'd really only give it a 6/10

There are many aspects that I thought were great, the visuals and atmosphere of the game are enthralling and the immediate story set-up and world-building was super interesting, discovering the implications of the entropy device through the terminals in the game was one of my favourite parts.

However, I found myself rapidly losing interest as the game went on.

Firstly, the puzzles are RIDICULOUSLY tedious. I reckon the large majority of the puzzles have the exact same solution one way or another (putting cubes in the final spot, then second last spot etc then reversing them). There were an incredibly small amount of "aha!" moments that make other similar games like Portal and The Talos Principle so engaging.

Secondly, the story really drops the ball towards the end. Like I said, the start was great, but you very quickly discover the situation through obvious clues (like that you can reverse yourself to lose memory, or that the cataclysm event is unfixable) and then eventually the fairly obvious 'twist' happens, but nothing comes from it? The ending is extremely unsatisfying because despite the journey you went on and what you discovered, literally nothing changed? You're given no extra information on what caused the cataclysm, and you're told repeatedly that you CANT stop it, yet your character makes the exact same decision and you're just forced to watch after spending 10 hours learning why this was the wrong decision. It all felt really pointless. The dialogue between the two characters was pretty cute and entertaining though at least.

Overall I don't regret buying this game, but I am pretty disappointed at how much more potential there was. If you're a big fan of games like Portal and The Talos Principle I still recommend you playing this, but just go in with reasonable expectations.
 
xXxDablord69xXx
107 produits enregistrés
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2023
The Entropy Centre is a First Person puzzle game where player character Aria must solve puzzles to generate energy needed to prevent a disaster on Earth.

Gameplay

• Your main puzzle solving tool is a gun which can rewind objects back through time. This will allow you to move things back to their previous location, repair broken items, and even defy gravity by lifting fallen objects.

• Each puzzle chamber contains obstacles such as locked doors, forcefields, moving platforms, elevators, and impassable gaps. You’ll need to bypass them by placing weighted cubes on pressure plates and using lasers to activate switches.

• You’ll usually need to use each item multiple times to solve a puzzle, which will require thinking ahead, placing it in every position that you’ll need it, and then using your gun to rewind it while you progress through a puzzle chamber.

• Later puzzles increase in complexity by including bounce pads, conveyor belts, light bridges, industrial strength fans, and transformers which let you change a cube into a different type of item.

• You can also rewind parts of the environment which have been destroyed, such as collapsed stone columns and fallen metal staircases. This can help remove debris which was blocking your path, or give you a ride up to a higher platform.

• The difficulty of puzzle games can be quite subjective, but I was able to identify most solutions fairly quickly. Any time my solution didn’t work, it was easy to understand why, which helped me think of another idea.

• The hardest part for me, especially on some later levels, was just putting my solution into action. Occasionally the physics could be a bit inconsistent, for example when I needed to catapult something through the air, it might bounce in an unexpected direction. And of course platforming in first person can sometimes result in misjudging jumps and under/overshooting platforms.

• There’s also some basic combat, as you’ll occasionally be attacked by security robots who fire energy projectiles at you. They’re not hard to defeat because you can rewind their projectiles back at them, although there are a couple of areas where they respawn infinitely until you activate some switches, which can be annoying.

Story

• Story is more detailed than most puzzle games. I don’t want to spoil too much, but it reminded me of a tv show called The Lazarus Project.

• Your gun contains a talking AI called Astra who explains what is happening in the story as well as having some amusing banter with Aria.

• Voice acting for both Aria and Astra is good.

• As you explore the levels you’ll find office PCs where you’ll get some more background details by reading emails from other people working at the facility.

Technical

• It took me 10 hours to complete, which is longer than most puzzle games.

• I didn’t have any problems with crashes, bugs or framerate.

• Controls are fully rebindable and work well with mouse and keyboard.

Recommendation

The Entropy Centre is a fun puzzle game which should be enjoyed by fans of similar games such as Portal, Talos Principle and ReThink.
 
G00N3R
516 produits enregistrés
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
9.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mai 2023
I really, really wanted to like this game, but after finishing it, I'm just disappointed. Perhaps the sunk cost fallacy entropy is the real entropy after all.

It is very similar game to portal, but without the extreme polish that comes from a major studio release (though they did release on schedule, not on valve time)

I really liked the environment design, some areas are gorgeous. The theming of everything is spot on, and I enjoyed the voice acting. The characters dialogue could be a shade dense at times. There's a point where something obvious is written on a wall and your character reads it then says "What could it mean?".

You have essentially 3 puzzle elements.
Cubes which press buttons/
Cubes which press buttons and also provide additional movement options.
Buttons which come in either the pressure plate variety that the player can stand on or place a cube on, or the laser "button" which are activated by the laser cube or static lasers in the environment.

Jump cubes can be a little irritating to land on at times. You can hit the edge and stop dead, requiring the whole solution to be rebuilt.

Minor irritations:
I don't like the lack of a crouch button. I see why it was excluded (so you cant go in the bot/cube holes but it doesn't make sense in the fiction.
I'm not keen that your character is water soluble, sometimes going ankle deep with instantly kill you.
Some of the checkpoints are a bit distant too, requiring several minutes of puzzle to be completed again because you slipped when exploring.

I don't know if I'm jaded by playing a lot of this type of game, but I did find the puzzles to be extremely repetitive. There are several puzzles which require the same actions in the same order, but the layout is different. Same solution though.

All puzzles are solved using the exact same formula: by placing all cubes where you need them last, then where you need them second to last, etc then rewinding them as required. Most puzzles I solved in 2-3 minutes, except the really long ones. A couple made me think, but not enough of the 50-ish this game contains.

I also found that the middle part of the game was really tedious because of this.

Mid game high level detail, not really a spoiler:

Acts 6-12 are frustrating because very little additional complexity was added, and at Act 6, a new urgent time sensitive threat is revealed, that you are reminded of constantly. Its not real-time, but nevertheless the various characters keep saying "Oh we really should hurry to solve this problem", but then we just take the only route through another act with another 5 puzzles.

Late game continuation spoilers:

Acts 14/15 do the same damn thing. There is an urgent thing to do, but lets make sure we mop up these last few puzzle areas first.
These final areas didn't provide much of a challenge, but one of the final areas just required a 30 second setup, a run through with a 30 second rewind, then the same again but this time with 2 cubes. Its very dull when you've figured out what to do and are just putting it into practice. If you make one mistake, it often means you have to completely reset everything which isn't a fun challenge.

Ending spoilers:

I was really disappointing by this ending. This disappointment is the reason I'm writing this review. Its written on the walls (not a metaphor) that there is nothing you can do to change the outcome of the game, but you keep playing thinking perhaps this time (i.e. on the story play through) it'll be different, perhaps that'll be the point of the story.

No, the point of the story is twofold:
1. Don't build a laser on the moon to rewind the planet (Don't play god).
2. This has all happened before and will all happen again. There's no point, everything is futile.

Another thing about the ending. The writing is on the wall (again not a metaphor) about this being a loop, also that the entropy device causes amnesia when used too frequently, also that Earth is in chaos. We also find out that cataclysms were coming thick and fast before the big-unrewindable one.
Could it be perhaps that the current cataclysm we are rewinding can't be effectively rewound because the people in charge of resolving it have had their brains tampered with one too many times? It's not a hard conclusion to form, and you can form it at about the halfway mark, then nothing in the game really surprises you.

The only surprise was that there was not surprise. No twist ending, no, its exactly what you expected, there's nothing you can do, same as the last 99999 times you tried. Perhaps that's the greatest surprise of them all.

All considered, I'm not mad, I'm just disappointed. I probably would have been happier overall if I'd never bought this game, or at least stopped about a third of the way in.
 
Andy
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
21.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2022
demo事前プレイ済み、ポータル？やったことないよ？な人による感想
クリアしたので追記と修正）

パズルの難易度）
時間戻しギミックがあるので解を反転させていく分ちょっとひねりがある。
詰まりはしても詰みはしない程度。
ある程度試行錯誤したらどうにかなるようにはなっている。

パズルのボリューム）
数は多い方ではあるが、10時間切る人もいれば17時間かかる人もいる。
というのも…
・解が見つかったからといっても巻き戻し限界時間があるので、無駄な操作挟んだだけでやりなおし
・アクト部分で操作が苦手な人はやり直しが多い
・所々挟まれるパズル以外の要素でやり直しが多い

シナリオ）
SFな世界観と可愛いロボたちとバディのアストラに癒される。
（途中から行動が可愛くないロボたちがめっちゃでてきたが）
結末は…（演出が悪いんで見落とした上誤解する羽目に。最後はちゃんと振り向いた方が良い）

総評）
個人的にはパズル外で挟まれるアクト要素にげんなりしてしまった。
demoがパズルオンリーだったので予想外であった。
ここら辺は得意な人は問題ないため、賛否は分かれそう。

任意のセーブがないので、オートセーブ前にやめたらまたパズルやり直しになったことも。
気楽に中断できないのは不親切。
エンディング見直したいのに、15のパズルまるまるやり直さないといけなかった。

初回セール2300円だが、値段相応かやや高い印象。
音楽は記憶に残らないレベル。
 
shimohana

21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Энтропийный пинг-понг настольный теннис? Неплохая попытка!
Мяч просто будет возвращаться на вашу сторону при обратной перемотке, что даст противнику очко!

А вообще одна из лучших игр, в которые довелось поиграть. Сначала впечатления после демо:
1. Даже после демо-уровня интересно играть. Расширили первую локацию, изменили многие места (есть тут те, кто больше одного раза прошел демо?)
2. Улучшена оптимизация. Огромное спасибо! Даже на средних ПК вы запустите игру на ультрах.
3. Спасибо за русскую локализацию, да и еще такую.. вовлеченную. Сильное погружение.
4. Реальный фикс багов в сравнении с недавней демо-версией. И добавили больше энтропийных вентиляторов!

Перемотать землю? Мы заняты поиском компов!
Отличный способ погружения в историю, помимо общения с Астрой. Настолько, что это порой интереснее, чем сама энтропия. Причем, понадобилось время, чтобы понять, а затем опровергнуть идею об энтропийном пинг-понге. И это всего-лишь одно сообщение в компе, которое погружает в долгие размышления и фантазии. Браво!

Все сравнивают с Portal?
Очевидно, что разработчик вдохновился этим. Причем в воплощении идеи (гениальной) он позаимствовал только лучшее у Aperture, добавив еще невероятный саундтрек, (который спустя время не надоедает) и тщательно проработав головоломки. Мое почтение! Это глоток свежего воздуха. Будто подарок игрокам за столько лет ожидания в отсутствии новых HL или Portal.

Эти проекты, грубо говоря, нельзя сравнивать. Принципиально разная механика, пусть и в очень похожей атмосфере. Это как сказать, что Battlefield слизан с Call of Duty. Смешно? Тут то же самое, просто мы не привыкли.

10 из 10. Если вдруг когда-нибудь будет продолжение сюжета в виде кооператива - этот проект станет легендарным!
 
kek
221 produits enregistrés
0

Un bon jeu dans l'ensemble.
L'histoire est sympa, Astra est très attachante, le gameplay est simple a comprendre et les énigmes ont une difficulté croissante bien dosé.
Un bon jeu sympa sans grosse prise de tête avec une petite durée de vie qui ressemble énormément à Portal. Si vous aimez ce dernier, foncez, le jeu vous plaira pour sûr :)

Non recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 décembre 2023
The game is pretty well polished, runs great, but the puzzles just aren't very interesting. The puzzles deal with setting up puzzle pieces and then you can rewind them along the path that they moved. Easily half of the puzzles have essentially the same solution where you move the single puzzle piece from position to position, in reverse order, and then rewind that puzzle piece step by step as you use it to get through the puzzle. I kept waiting for some ability or puzzle piece to be introduced that makes the game interesting, but it never happened.
 
soadrage7654
0
11 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
とりあえずエンディングまでプレイ
portalライクな一人称視点パズルプラットフォーマー
対象の時間を巻き戻せる銃を使って進んでいく

ストーリーはゲームシステムからも分かる通り『時間』をテーマにしたSFで、往年の似たような時間操作系ジャンルのサブカルチャーが好きな人には刺さるだろう
ただ、エンディングには賛否があるかもしれない、ゲームとしてクリアはしたがストーリー上の問題はまだまだ晴れていないのでぜひともDLCが欲しいところ（もしかしたら別EDがあって自分が見れていないだけかもしれない）

個人的には無機質な研究施設に植物が侵食しているような荒廃したビジュアルに、コロコロとした見た目のかわいいヘルパーロボット、喋る銃のアストラと施設内を歩いて眺めているだけでも楽しいゲームだった

肝心のパズルについては時間を巻き戻すシステムの特性上、ステージクリアできる状態から逆算してオブジェクトの配置を考えていく必要があり、マップの全貌が掴めないうちは何度か同じような操作をやり直す必要が有る
中には出口付近までいって初めて「あのブロック必要じゃん！」と分かり、ブロックの配置を考え直すステージもあるかもしれない
ただ、思ったより解法は素直なことが多く「どうせここからもう一段と考える必要があるんだろ？」と邪推してもそのままゴールの扉が開いてクリアと拍子抜けすることが何度かあった

全体を通して難易度はそこまで高くなく、portalの時間操作系のシステムが追加されたMODや、Braidのような時間をテーマにしたゲームをプレイしたことがある人には少し簡単すぎるかもしれない
チャプターは全部で16、自分のクリア時間は7時間ほどで少々短く感じるかもしれないが、サクサク進められるストーリーのあるパズルゲームと考えたら値段の安さも相まって十分満足

気になった点としては、オートセーブポイントがあまり親切でないため、一回死んだり、ゲームをやり直すとステージによっては結構前まで戻される場合がある

またゲームが起動できなかったり、プレイ中に崩れた柱を巻き戻して停止させた後、上にオブジェクトを配置したらスタックした後ゲームが落ちることがあった
どちらもローカルファイル内のEXEファイル「EntropyCentre.exe」｢EntropyCentre-Win64-Shipping.exe｣をWindows７互換で起動し直したら直ったので、同じ症状が出た人は参考程度に

総評して一人称視点パズルに飢えた自分にとっては良いゲームだった
アストラかわいいね　●◡●
 
EyEsya
442 produits enregistrés
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Дякую за найкращу головоломку за останні 5 років!
______________________________________________________________

Складність головоломок 8/10
(деякі механіки гри ви можете відчути себе овочем, але середній час проходження однієї головоломки приблизно 5 хвилин)

Гумор 10/10
(якщо вам не вистачало гумору як у Portal 2 то ця гра для вас)

Історія 9/10
(-1 бал за подачу 50-60% історії у вигляді щоденників. Якщо для вас це не мінус тоді 10/10)

Графіка 9/10
(-1 бал тому-що деякі об'єкти мають деформовані текстури, але це не критично так як це можливо помітити тільки якщо придивлятися)

Зовнішній вигляд персонажів 10/10
(окрема подяка за робота Е. Він дуже милий)

Оптимізація 9/10
(-1 бал за один краш гри і 2-3 гази застрягав у текстурах)


Проходження гри в мене зайняло 11 годин.
______________________________________________________________

Моя оцінка (9/10)
Ця гра вартує уваги усіх хто полюбляє головоломки

Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2022
한글패치 떡 돌리러 왔습니다.
배포처(데모에도 적용 가능)[justiqm.tistory.com]
적용법 가이드 보기

주관이 과다첨가된 명작 30선
"지적인 인공지능과 함께하는 지구 살리기 프로젝트"

만약 당신이

- 포탈과 비슷한 느낌의 게임을 원하신다면
- 색다른 느낌의 퍼즐 게임을 원하신다면
- 아무도 안 남은 달의 기지를 탐험하는 기분을 맛보고 싶으시다면
- 귀여운 인공지능과 함께 퍼즐을 풀고 싶으시다면

강력히 추천 합니다. 인생겜 또 생겼네요.

그러나 만약 당신이

- 플레이 타임이 10시간은 넘는 게임만 하신다면(대강 3~4에서 6~7이면 깹니다)
- 로봇 말고 사람을 보고 싶으신 분이시라면
- 피튀기는 싸움을 좋아하시는 분이시라면
- 늙어서 퍼즐을 잘 못푸신다면

추천 안 합니다. 세일해서 23400원은 그럭저럭이었는데 원가 26000원은 조오오금 애매하네요.
