Non recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2023
I thought I was going to like this game at first honestly. Decent graphics, solid easy to understand mechanics and concept, and and somewhat interesting plot. And for a while it went pretty smoothly.

But then the game makes the same exact mistake that every other game attempting to rip off portal does: It doesn't know when to STOP. There is no getting around the fact that if you keep trying to pad out the gameplay too long the puzzles get repetitive, then boring, then outright frustrating. I've only gotten through level 7 so far, I'm sick of the puzzles now and I want the plot to make some bloody progress...and apparently this isn't even the halfway point for the game.

And while the narrative isn't bad... we've all seen this kind of writing before. Sci-fi that messes with time loops and attempts to "think outside the box, you know like every other sci-fi puzzle game" and in doing so does exactly what you expect it to do as a result, with pretty predictable plot twists, etc.

I don't want to keep playing anymore. That's the review.
 
Sabaithal
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
14.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2022
The Entropy Centre is a puzzle game by Stubby Games that, despite having no portals, does feel a lot like the Portal games. I don't usually like to make comparisons this clear, but there were times where I felt like it was Portal 2, and overall it felt a lot like the Portal Mods I've played. Both the environment and quite a few puzzle elements were very similar, and I don't necessarily mean that as a bad thing. I guess many of the players interested in this game are people like me who are always trying to fill that portal-shaped hole when a new puzzle game releases anyway.

The Entropy Centre is still its own game with its own story and twist, and it is really well crafted. It ran smoothly and I didn't find any bugs, visuals are pleasing, the environments are nice and voice acting is good. The story is nothing spectacular and somewhat predictable but still good, really fits the theme and I enjoyed it. Overall, now that I finished it, I loved playing The Entropy Centre and would have liked for it to last a little longer.

There is really nothing I dislike about the game (other than the fact that I spent a lot of my playtime just walking around in fear of missing something and still didn't find all terminal messages! But that's on me). However, there are some aspects that I have some mixed feelings about.

First and foremost: the puzzles. To be more specific, the difficulty of the puzzles.
While I do like the concept of the mechanic, and of most of the puzzles, and while I was a bit afraid it would get veeery complicated at first, it fell a bit short in the first half. I felt like the difficulty remained pretty much the same for quite a while.
But just when I was starting to even feel a bit bored because I found the puzzles too easy, they got more interesting. That was also the point where I got really immersed in the game and didn't want to stop playing anymore – it was always „just one more puzzle“. They didn't really get any more challenging than that second stage of difficulty until the end though, at least for me. So overall it felt like beginner levels and intermediate levels, but not much more than that.
Now, I am not even sure I mean that as a bad thing. I still had fun. Maybe just a warning to the more experienced puzzle game players that you shouldn't expect that much of a challenge.
Many puzzles were still satisfying to solve. They just weren't as mind-bending as I had hoped (or feared, not sure). The protagonist says once or twice that her brain hurts, and mine didn't at any point. Since I do love puzzle games on the one hand, but am also quite impatient on the other, it might just as well be a good thing, as the game never got frustrating. There were only two puzzles that annoyed me, where I knew pretty early on what I had to do but still took about half an hour or more to finally solve because I just couldn't get the execution right. But it was just two of them and I can't say they affected my overall experience too much. So, in conclusion, puzzles are good, but a bit more of a challenge would have been nice. Take that with a grain of salt if you are (relatively) new to puzzle games though.

Then there are the action sequences. Whenever I encountered them I really didn't want to do them. They weren't really fun for me, but I also think it's important they are there. They create that feeling of urgency that would get completely lost otherwise, and that I do think is important for the story. Also, they usually don't last that long.

The last aspect I wasn't too happy about is that you can't save your game manually, but you also don't get any indication during the game as to where the checkpoints are. Most of the time it wasn't that much of a problem, but I had to redo some bits that I felt I shouldn't have had to redo considering where I died/stopped. Once or twice I quit to main menu, just to load the game again for a moment to make sure I would start where I intended to the next time I'd continue playing.

So, all in all, I was a bit sceptical in the beginning, but The Entropy Centre managed to draw me in eventually and I really enjoyed it. Especially considering it was to a large extent made by only one person as far as I can tell, it is an amazing game that definitely belongs among my favourite puzzle games that are not Portal, there aren't that many of them that I enjoyed this much. So if you like puzzles, portals (even though there aren't any here), cubes (there are quite many!) and the likes, I absolutely recommend The Entropy Centre. I also recommend it if you don't really know what I'm talking about here and it's your first or one of your first puzzle games because I think the difficulty allows for less experienced players to maybe have a harder time but eventually enjoy it too.
 
gedankenkind

A crazy good portal-like puzzle game. The puzzles are varied and challenging, and the plot and characters are very entertaining.

Game took me around 8 hours to complete. Some of the puzzles really had me stumped, especially towards the end. There's also some really cool moments between the puzzle rooms, including chases and combat.

Definitely a must buy for portal and puzzle fans.

299 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
11.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juillet 2023
I really really wish I could recommend this game, I've been waiting on it excitedly since it was announced, but there's one huge problem that I just can't get past. I rarely write reviews, but this one needs to be written.

I want to preface this by saying that Portal 2 is one of my all-time favorite games, I have almost 150 hours in it. Hopefully that provides some context for other parts of this review.

The Portal Inspiration
This isn't as much part of the review as it is something I really wanted to discuss (don't worry, the actual review is below). You can't look at The Entropy Centre and argue that it wasn't very heavily inspired by Portal. While some might see it as a blatant rip-off, I honestly love all of the references. The beginning of the game feels like a Portal 2 mod, and honestly I think it might be intentional.

Some of the first EC puzzles are essentially identical to the first P/P2 puzzles. The now iconic cube-and-button mechanic is ever present throughout the game. Virtually every mechanic Portal has (aside from the, you know, portals), EC has their own version of. From laser cubes to fans as tractor beams, or bridge cubes as hard light bridges to entropy bots as turrets, or even bounce cubes as repulsion gel and conveyor belts as propulsion gel, the inspiration is obvious. The talking gun is essentially a much nicer version of GlaDOS, and walking around feels like talking to PotatOS or holding Wheatley while the ever-present announcer talks in the background. There's too many little references to count, but I just really want to shout them out because I love them and think the devs did a great job. (Was the "nine nine nine nine nine..." sound bit pulled straight from P2?)

With all that said, in my opinion the EC is still very original, and the Portal references remain just that- references. The time travel mechanic is unique and the story is actually really engaging once you get into the later acts.

The Good
I really want to start the actual review portion of this review with what I liked about the game, because honestly there's a lot to love.
- As I discuss in detail above, the Portal references are really cute
- The soundtrack and overall sound design is incredible
- The talking gun is adorable and I found myself emotionally attached to her throughout the game, but she's still really funny
- The story is really engaging, and gets super interesting in the final third of the game- like wow that ending really makes it all worth it
- I appreciate the relatively regular introduction of new puzzle mechanics
- The runner levels and exploration levels are pretty fun
- The visuals are (mostly) beautiful

Why I Can't Recommend It - Bounce Cubes
There's a lot to love about this game, but one huge issue I can't get by: as small as it may seem, the bounce cubes are, without a doubt, the worst game mechanic I have ever experienced. Allow me to explain.

I know I discuss Portal a lot, but bear with me here. I'm not sure how common this knowledge is, but Portal uses something the devs called "funneling", which means that as you're falling into or flying towards a portal the physics engine cheats a little to guide you into it. In short, if you jump of a ledge into a portal, as long as you jumped near it you will fall through the portal if you don't touch any buttons while you're in the air. You get funneled towards it.

The bounce cubes are in desperate need of a funneling mechanic, and in all honesty if they had one I would be able to confidently recommend this game. Sure, I have other issues with it, which I discuss below, but this one is the only deal-breaker for me.

For context, the puzzles in this game aren't particularly difficult. I was able to mentally solve nearly every puzzle within a minute of entering the room, and then it was merely a matter of executing the solution. All you have to do is work backwards through the puzzle in your head and then move the cubes around so they can be rewound, it's not that hard.

But that's where the problems come in. In a puzzle game, the challenge should be figuring out what to do, not actually doing it. Portal doesn't require any significant gaming skill- you rarely need to aim precisely or think fast. When executing a puzzle solution it's difficult to mess up.

Unfortunately, in EC, it takes gaming skill to complete puzzles. If you're good at platforming it probably isn't hard but I'm not. One of the most frustrating experiences is to spend several minutes setting up a puzzle solution, only to need to make one more big jump to the exit door, and when you make the jump you fall right next to the bounce cube you were aiming for, requiring you to go back to the start and tediously set everything up again. It's not difficult, it's just really annoying (especially when you can't run and you walk at a snail's pace). I found myself putting on YouTube videos in the background while I attempted long, multi-step puzzles four or five times because I kept missing a bounce cube.

There are a few other minor things I'm not a huge fan of:
- The entropy robots are REALLY annoying. In Portal 2, you never have to worry about turrets really because they sit still. Entropy bots move around, and can only be destroyed by launching an explosive at them or by rewinding their pellets. It's really frustrating to be in a lockdown puzzle trying to find a button to unlock the door when a robot sneaks up behind you and nails you in the back with an energy pellet at the same time as his friend and you die. They're a pain in the butt and I don't like them. The runner levels are fine, but the combat/lockdown levels are endlessly annoying.
- This might be more of a bug, but occasionally you need to stand on a fallen walkway or whatever and rewind it to lift you up in the air. Well, it's really obnoxious when part of the walkway swings into place and crushes you. I wish it would just push you out of the way instead of killing you just because you didn't see it coming (turns out predicting how things will fall in reverse is hard!)
- The puzzles are REALLY repetitive. I know it's weird to say I want the game to be shorter, but they get old so fast. The new elements are nice, but it really feels like you aren't making any progress when every puzzle is essentially the same, and the only difficult part is the execution not the solution.
- The areas between the worlds really break suspension of disbelief sometimes. It feels too much like a game, like a puzzle, it doesn't feel real. Am I expected to believe that some quarters have bounce cubes in them, complete with a button to spawn a new one? And wow, how convenient that that walkway is not only destroyed, but rewindable!
- A lot of the animations are pretty janky. The launch things (EC equivalent of faith plates), for example, just bounce up. Compare that to Portal's intricately designed plates and it just feels sorta sad and empty. I'd love to see refinements on the animations. To the dev's credit, though, the destruction animations are solid.

TL;DR
Man, that was a big wall of text. Hopefully it's useful to some of you. Long story short:
- I love the game, very pretty, engaging, and a solid storyline with lovable characters
- The bounce cubes not funneling break the whole thing for me
- It still needs a little work in some areas
- If it weren't for the bounce cube issues, I could easily recommend this game
- Oh yeah, the puzzles are pretty easy, good for beginners
 
camdan.me
147 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 février 2023
The Entropy Centre ist ein First Person Puzzle Adventure, das in die Fußstapfen der Portal Reihe tritt.

Was ist die ungefähre Prämisse?
Du erwachst alleine in einer Mondbasis, bewaffnet mit "Astra", deiner sprechenden Portalgun ah, ne Entropieknarre? Mit Hilfe dieser kannst du Objekte zurückspulen, also in der Zeit rückwärts bewegen.
Nach einem kurzen Blick auf den wunderschönen blauen Planeten macht es bumm und er wird rot. Die Erde geht unter, deine Aufgabe ist es nun, die Erde zurückzuspulen.
Hierfür musst du nun Puzzle lösen, um Entropieenergie zu generieren, die für die Rettung der Erde benötigt wird.

Die Story ist soweit recht simpel und wird von starken Sprechern getragen. Begleitet wird diese lineare Storyerfahrung von optionalen Storyschnipseln in Form von Emails auf den Computern der Belegschaft dieser Raumstation. Diese optionalen Storys helfen dabei, der Raumstation Leben einzuhauchen und runden die Geschichte gut ab. Diese Kombination aus linearer Story und kleinen Hintergrundgeschichten runden die Puzzleerfahrung schön ab.

Kommen wir nun zum wichtigsten Teil, den tatsächlichen Puzzlen.
Am Anfang haben wir klassische Schalterrätsel. Platziere Block A auf Schalter B, um Tür C zu öffnen. Mit jedem Kapitel, welches in der Regel 5 Haupträume umfasst, kommt eine neue Mechanik hinzu, die zuerst erklärt und danach immer komplizierter angewandt wird. Dank der Rückspulmechanik werden auch simple Lichträtsel recht komplex.
Sobald die verschiedenen Rätselmechaniken dann kombiniert werden, was leider erst in der zweiten Hälfte des Spiels viel passiert, sind die Puzzleräume schön schwere Herausforderungen, bei denen manche grauen Gehirnzellen zu neuem Leben entfacht werden.

Zwischen den Rätselräumen gibt es oftmals etwas gerne gesehenen Leerlauf. Hier müssen wir uns durch den Rest der Mondstation bewegen, sei es durch Mitarbeiterquartiere, ein Museum oder Sandstrände. Natürlich müssen wir auch hier kleine Denkaufgaben bewältigen, da die Station etwas in Mitleidenschaft gezogen wurde.

Leider gibt es auch oftmals kleinere "Kampfarenen", in denen wir unter leichter Belästigung des Sicherheitssystems ein paar Schalter drücken müssen. Diese Räume sind aber eine Seltenheit, können dafür aber gerne frustieren.

Fazit
The Entropy Centre ist ein würdiger Nachfolger der Portalreihe, der durch überraschend komplexe Puzzles und eine guten Story punktet. Die Länge ist mit 5-7 Stunden sehr angenehm, kann aber durch das eigene Können auch deutlich länger oder kürzer ausfallen.
Eine absolute Kaufempfehlung für jeden Fan der Portalreihe.
Für unschlüssige Käufer kann ich die Demo nur empfehlen!
 
Kelk1ng
1,247 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juillet 2023
很明显是在学习传送门，包括环境叙事的手法、阿斯特拉和时间枪的设计、科技基地和解谜实验的设定、建筑和关卡的风格等。同时也作为一个活生生的例子，告诉玩家传送门并不是那么好模仿的
谜题难度中等偏低，数量还算丰富，核心的时间恢复机制潜力很高。但其他机制的引入比较生硬，且机制之间很少实现融合。难度曲线也很奇怪，第14、15章作为台词里“extremely hard”的部分，仅仅是将已有的机制重新组合，谜题设计没有新意、解题方式没有拓展，导致难度低、体验还不如前中期
要大骂特骂的是，全游戏最麻烦的不是谜题，而是tm的跳跳乐，制作组就不能把弹簧板做大一点、把光束桥做宽一点吗？弹簧板放什么位置总需要微调几次，特别是不规则的悬崖边难度更高；加速跳的关卡里要么踩不到弹簧板上，要么跳跃距离总是差一点点。制作组你tm在一个解谜游戏里把跳跳乐的距离和精度设计得如此极限，是要搞几把？你和你妈在床上都要玩的这么极限？
另外，除了谜题玩法外，制作组还缝了战斗和追逐关卡，但设计水平很一般，单纯是时间枪基础功能的重复使用，非常无聊。可以说，制作组只知道“做加法”，完全不懂“做减法”的重要性
只能说，核心的解谜部分没有大问题，属于能玩的水平；而和解谜无关的设计如此反人类，注定了这个游戏和传送门之间存在不可逾越的鸿沟。如果对跳跳乐的耐心比较足，且能容忍拖时长的设计，那等个折扣倒也能玩一玩
 
KOS-MOS
484 produits enregistrés

78 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
Игру правда проще всего сравнить с Порталом (ценители могут еще Принцип Талоса вспомнить, издающий такие же вайбы). Другое дело, что один человек физически не может конкурировать с большой корпорацией, поэтому проседания по мелочам встречаются и тут и там. Что не делает игру плохой, просто прямое сравнение с вылизанным со всех сторон продуктом выиграть очень сложно (да и не нужно, наверное). Просто за фуллпрайс может показаться дороговато. А так, где-то 8/10

У игры классный сюжет, который, правда, немного предсказуем и слегка перетянут слишком большим количеством загадок. Много крутых межуровневых вставок, где встречаются экшен, исследования лора, в целом какая-то разрядка и красивости. Достаточно милые маскоты. Правда, осознание сюжета игры способно ввести в нехилый такой тлен

Изъяны, которые немного портят впечатление от игры
- не очень интересное окружение (в какой-то момент наскучивает изучать каждый угол, почти все интересное находится в компах, которые часто как назло стоят экраном к стенам), нет каких-то секретов, ради поиска которых хочется перепройти игру (я пару раз умудрялся то мячик, то кубик утащить в следующую комнату, а у меня это стыдливо отнимали триггерами - Принцип Талоса, поощряющий ломание головоломок, невольно вспоминается с теплотой)
- максимально неинтуитивная система сохранений
- очень мало реально сложных головоломок (причем все сложные и вкусные где-то в районе 60-70% игры, ближе к концу они не столько сложные, сколько долгие), по ощущениям около половины можно выкинуть без особых потерь, они достаточно очевидны
- ключевая механика по отмотке времени объектов сама по себе недостаточно комплексная, чтобы вытянуть всю игру. Просто регулярно вводятся новые виды кубиков/окружения (и там почти всегда по одному шаблону: 1-2 простенькие вводные загадки, 2-3 уже посложнее, одна сложная, а потом и новый акт), но большинство загадок реально кажутся однотипными (комнату нужно пройти дважды: сначала задо-наперед, а потом обратная отмотка вперед)
- трамплины часто незаметные, успеваешь кучу времени побегать по паззлу в попытках понять, как это в принципе должно быть реально пройти
- мелкие баги в виде местами отсутствующих стен
- после пары приземлений рядом с прыгучими кубиками начинаешь скучать по воронках порталов
 
stsyn

Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
Overall - I liked this game. It gives some new ways to think about puzzles, has enjoyable Astra assistant, overall interesting, even if simple, story.

- Puzzles are easy for the most part, harder to the middle of the game and a bit easier towards the end - which is good, otherwise I would feel eshausted by the end.
- Some puzzles are a bit buggy. Some can be completed in an easier way than intended, ignoring half the puzzle room.
- Story is simple, mostly text driven, but I liked it. I was interested to see how it ends.
- Astra is cute. YEET.
- You HAVE to pet E. It's the rule.


Closest thing to Portal we can get right now. I really hope there will be a sequel with a bit more budget, story bits and polish.

Recommandé
13.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 décembre 2022
Is the game heavily inspired by a certain popular puzzle game? Yes

Is this game designed and published by Valve? No

Should you be reading any reviews or watching any videos before beating this gem of a game? Absolutely not

It's obvious by playing through this game that it is lovingly made by a very passionate team. The concept of entropy is fascinating and the way this game displays it is remarkable. If you enjoy the FPS puzzle games of yesteryear then this is a must. Be forewarned that I found no silly references or callbacks to other franchises. Do not go into this expecting a sing along with Microsoft Sam either

2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
The puzzles are relatively trivial, at least up to the 6th act (over 15?). As time puzzle go, Braid was way better. And as for the genre, Portal was more interesting.
The main letdown is that every puzzle feels exactly the same. Even trying to access the out-of-the-box areas is way too easy and doesn't really happen often. The only difficulty one may find is the inaccurate physics/collisions that may force you to redo a setup and move a piece a few centimeters away because a jump made you stick on a wall or something. It's not something that I find enjoyable.
I don't plan wasting more time on this anytime soon but it still may be nice for new players.
It's not bad, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Ихтиандр Златовласов
35 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 décembre 2022
This is a decent to good puzzle game. I had high hopes and this didn't get there, but it was still fun enough.

The good:
- some interesting puzzles with clever setups
- decent amount of variety in puzzle mechanics with different cubes
- pretty cool sci-fi story behind it

The bad:
- repeatedly setting up some puzzle solutions all over again due to one part not working right
- jump boxes. Probably 90% of my rework was from these
- takes a while to get to the more interesting puzzles, felt like a long tutorial
- some repetition in the puzzles
- the story could use more detail and the ending felt drawn out to get to the final conclusion
- rewinding time can be super slow and annoying if you go too far
- battling the robots gets old fast

Overall, it would've been a solidly good game with some more work. Jump boxes should be improved with larger hitzones, would be nice if you could scrub the timeline with a scrollwheel instead of just rewinding slowly, and shorten the ending by at least half.
 
ed.lewis
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mars 2023
Раздражающие вещи
:- Невозможно сохраняться вручную
- Невозможно перемещать предметы "вперёд" во времени (были бы сохранения, стало бы пофиг на это, но в совокупности оба фактора откровенно бесят)
- Невозможно перечитать найденную корреспонденцию (или как-либо ещё понять, какие терминалы ты нашёл, а какие - нет)
- Подгрузка уровней (ощущается слишком хорошо на не топовом железе)
- Коллизия убивает нередко даже там, где не должна этого делать
- Никакой индикации автосохранения (о расположении чекпоинтов можно только догадываться)

Непонравившиеся вещи
:- Концовка. В финальной четверти игры нам чуть ли не напрямую сообщают, что всё это - очень грустный сон не менее грустной собаки. Вернее, её из раза в раз повторяющаяся предсмертная агония с проматывающимися по кругу воспоминаниями последних событий. Да, это по-своему грустно, но будь всё по-настоящему - было бы в разы грустнее, а так это просто обесценивание пережитого опыта получается. Даже Дарк Соулс в своей "повести о конце света" с игроком честнее.
- Некоторые нарративные элементы, в частности дизайн (вдохновение Порталом заметно слишком сильно и местами смотрится крайне неуместно), объяснение некоторых весьма значимых вещей (одна только растительность на Луна чего стоит), а также с ходу бросающиеся в глаза игровые условности (нельзя приседать, серьёзно? и что это за прыжок на 10 сантиметров? почему гравитация в принципе земная, на Луне-то?)
- "Формула" всех пазлов чаще всего одна, и по мере игры они становятся лишь душнее
- Настройки ужасны с точки зрения UI/UX (как и главное меню в целом)

"Ни рыба, ни мясо" моменты
:- Дизайн пушки (клянусь, что-то подобное я уже точно где-то видел, только без дыры посередине)
- Ограничение на отматывание - 46 секунд. Почему не 60, например? Не ясно. Впрочем, припрёт это лишь в финальной главе
- В отличие от демки, главный сюжетный твист игра спойлерит тебе буквально сразу
- Стрекочущий рояль из стен кустов
- Местами сюжет в принципе выдаёт слишком уж клишированные сценки
- Также иной раз не очень понятно, для чего некоторые области существуют, почему они такие и находятся именно здесь
- Как связаны исследовательский центр и кошачья еда?
- Музыка иногда не очень уместна, но большую часть времени на неё не обращаешь внимание

Понравившиеся вещи
:- Сеттинг
- Дизайн окружения (не без вопросов, но всё же)
- Записочки (Кот.)
- Динамичные моменты
- Озвучка
- Видно, что пазлы тестировались (за исключением, может, одного), и это радует

Итог
:Рекомендовать к покупке могу только если вам скучно вечерком и совсем уж не во что поиграть (по скидке брать или нет - решайте сами). Игра определённо неплоха, в ней есть хорошие решения и запоминающиеся (позитивно) моменты, но индюшность прям сильно бросается в глаза, да и концовка может не всем прийтись по душе.
 
ProstoTen`

[SFW]Flyingfishball
0
21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
5.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
I love portal and this game was clearly heavily inspired by it but i find it hard to recommend because of some major issues. which is a shame cos i wanted to like this and was looking forward to it for a while.

for one this game feels a lot like a portal mod. everyone is here. cubes, faith plates, light bridges it all works just like portal the only difference being you rewind objects to move them instead of using portals. so if you have played portal dont expect many new mechanics. even the environments are similar to portal, there are test chambers like portal and there is a wisecracking companion following you the whole time. even the music is very portal like (although not as memorable in my opinion)

the puzzles themselves feel VERY similar. almost every solution is just place the thing in the last place you need it then the first place you need it and then rewind. also there is often arrows on the ground or outlines of where to put things so even working out where things go isnt a puzzle. at one point the wisecracking companion straight up told me the solution to a puzzle before i had the chance to even look around the room adding insult to injury. a lot of the puzzles can be broken in some way aswell sometimes needing to reload the level to fix hinting that this game wasnt tested very well although maybe they were left in for speedruns? annoying that i found them on a casual playthrough tho. also at one point it adds this stupid river mechanic to replace the excursion funnels in portal where you have to drop a cube in the river and pick it up again so that when you rewind you can leave it in the river to float down to you later. i assume this is the intended solution to these river puzzles cos i did a lot of them like this but dropping and picking up the things from the river is clunky and annoying it felt like i wasnt supposed to do it. and because i guess my character cant swim in 3 inches of water if you ever get to close to the river you die and have to play the whole level again. this was about the point i gave up on the game.

the story is interesting although im 5 hours in and it hasnt progressed at all if you have watched the trailer dont expect and more story until atleast the 5 hour mark. i cant say if there is more beyond that as my patience has been tested enough already.

the writing just isnt as good as in portal. many of the "jokes" just fell flat to me and with the story not actually moving along with you it mostly feels like filler. which brings me to my next point there is SO much walking around and just doing the same ♥♥♥♥ you have been doing in this game. i would say of the 5 hours i played about 40 minutes was actual new ideas being shown the rest was just walking around getting to the next area. they disguise this as set pieces that i think are supposed to feel tense or atleast like you are sneaking around the rat dens from portal but it basically comes down to walk, see a large pillar slowly fall towards you, rewind said pillar, continue walking.

as for the secrets in this game as a dev that was clearly inspired by portal they really missed the point of them. for one many times when i thought i was going to find a secret it was just a dead end (sometimes requiring to reload the level to get back) and the rest of the time it was just a PC with an email that added absolutely nothing to plot. for example early on there is an exact copy of the first puzzle in portal with the single cube and button that opens the door and in portal if you throw the cube through the door while on the button glados gives unique dialogue and opens the door in this you end up having to reload the game and nothing happens. there are many missed opportunities like this and the ones they do take are really not worth it.

so in short unless you are really sold on the concept enough to sit through a lot of waiting around or you just havent played any of the MANY similar games that are better than this i would not recommend it.
 
isthatjames123
1,333 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 décembre 2023
I was really looking forward to trying The Entropy Centre since I really like good puzzle games. Unfortunately, I do not think these are good puzzles. I’ve played almost 3 hours, and based on achievements have completed 2/3 of the levels and I’ve yet to feel like I needed to think for more than 2 seconds about any of the puzzles. They are all trivially easy to solve, while often re-using puzzle elements. Every single puzzle is just look at the order the buttons need to be pressed, press them in the reverse order, then rewind time. Most of the time, the correct order can be seen as soon as you enter the puzzle room, but sometimes you need to spend a few seconds walking around the room to see everything. It really felt like I spent at least 50% of my time walking between puzzle rooms, rather than actually solving puzzles, especially because this game has no sprint to allow quick movement between puzzle rooms while also having long walks between rooms.

I’m also not a fan of the inconsistencies surrounding the central mechanic of rewinding time. Some objects become ghosts when re-wound, meaning you cannot stand on them, yet other objects require you to jump or walk on them to solve the puzzles. Then there are things like movable power switches which cannot be rewound through time and instead “re-winding” them just turns them on. Then the game has enemies that shoot you, and rewinding their projectiles brings them back to the enemy that shot them instead of the location they were shot from. The game does a good job of showing what objects behave in what way, so I never felt stuck on a puzzle due to this inconsistent behaviour, but I did feel confused as to why the behaviour was so inconsistent.

If I’m writing a review anyways, I do also have to mention that the game forces on a ton of horrible effects that just make the game look unclear and bad. I do not understand why so many developers force these sorts of settings instead of allowing them to be turned off.

The game does have a story, and it does seem fairly interesting as well as some cool set pieces where the world collapses around you, but none of that is good enough to carry the game.

At this point I think I’ve given the game more than a fair chance. It’s way too easy and I don’t think I’ll spend more of my time solving more of these simple puzzles.
 
Sammy the Wizard
1,273 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2023
Highly recommend this game to anyone who likes puzzle games ESPECIALLY the Portal Series.

People may keep comparing this game to Portal and I can totally agree as to why but it is still a unique game nonetheless with its own tropes etc.

The commentary in this game (in my own personal opinion) was acceptable but i can see why some may find it a bit on the cringe side but honestly still gives character throughout the whole game.

The graphics in this game was perfectly fine and ran smoothly apart from the occasional drop for only a split second due to certain scenes with a lot of debris and dust.... but almost any PC* will possibly end up doing that anyway (*every device is different, can't say how your own PC will run with it but i would argue that this is somewhat a easily accessible game to play) and is usually near the end of the game so "one off" situation i guess. The art design too reminds me of a mixture of both Portal and Portal 2 and arguably the original Mirror's Edge (only a bit) but still stands out as unique game in other elements as well.

Overall for people who are more into ratings, here is my personal opinions down below but regardless of any of that, I would recommend getting this for anyone anyway :).

Game play: 9.5/10
Graphics: 8/10
Art style: 9/10
Music: 7/10
Audio/Sound effects: 9/10
Story: 7.5/10
Acting: 6/10
 
Mozz_Zm

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
퍼즐 자체는 뭐 나쁘지 않고 신선했는데 몇가지 치명적인 단점이 있었습니다.
1. 퍼즐이외 짜증남
중간에 전투도 나오고 긴장감 유발? 이런 의도는 알겠는데, 그냥 짜증100% 유발 요소였음
2. QC관리 미흡
맵에서 점프하다 게임 다시시작 9번 넘은듯?
3. 퍼즐 유닛설정이 허술함
퍼즐 정답을 알아도, 물리현상의 미세한 차이로 똑같은 여러번 반복해야 했음
4.불편한 편의성
기본적으로 루틴을 실행하는데, 한번 미스가 있거나 삑사리나면 첨부터 다시해야함
3번 문제 때문에 시간이 질질 끌림
5.단순한 풀이법
일단 마지막 열쇠 여는 방식이 똑같아서 결국 풀이과정이 다 비슷함
여러 참신한 요소는 있었는데 잘 살리질 못한것 같음

이렇게 말하면 매우 악평을 한것 같지만
퍼즐 게임 애호가라면 정가주고 사도 괜찮은 킬링타임 게임이긴 합니다

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2022
Okay, look... I really like the general setting of the game and the core concept as well. But solving puzzles in this game feels like doing chores. Too much of them feel like they're there just to fill the space and stretch the game time a bit. Many of them have quite repetitive core ideas, just applied on a different scale. It gets me bored and makes me engage with the story line at a far slower pace than I'd like to, given the apparent urgency of the situation at hand.

448 produits enregistrés

4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
21.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2023
Cuatro son las dimensiones del universo conocido hasta el momento; tres para el espacio y una para el tiempo. Portal, en sus dos entregas juega hábilmente ♥♥♥ las tres dimensiones del espacio, explotando al límite sus mecánicas de portales y consiguiendo ♥♥♥ ello unos puzles de una calidad sobresaliente. Mucho se podría escribir, y se ha escrito sobre Portal, sobre su propuesta innovadora o sobre la consistencia que demuestra su conjunto. Pero, hasta el momento no ha habido quien recoja el testigo de Portal, o al menos no de manera tan hábil como The Entropy Center, quien se atreve a jugar ♥♥♥ esa cuarta dimensión restante.

The Entropy Center no esconde en ningún momento sus influencias, sin embargo es justo eso lo que, en mi opinión, le termina pesando, y es que pasado el impacto de la espectacularidad del rifle de entropía, no podía evitar pensar, puzle tras puzle, que estos estaban mejor pensados y desarrollados en Portal. Sin embargo, me tomo un tiempo darme cuenta de que las ambiciones de The Entropy Center no iban por ahí, pues el apartado narrativo es sin duda su aspecto más sólido.

Es cierto que a primera vista podría parecer que es simplemente un juego de puzles como tantos otros, y que su historia no es más que una excusa para contextualizar los sucesos que allí ocurren; eso sentí al principio, no voy a mentir, pero a medida que avanza la historia te das cuenta de que el juego tiene un mensaje potente, pues quiere decir algo respecto a la responsabilidad de la humanidad ♥♥♥ la Tierra. Su historia nos recuerda el poder de cambio que tenemos, uno que lamentablemente muchas veces usamos para acciones deplorables: la contaminación, la extinción de especies, la destrucción de hábitats, son productos de la humanidad. The Entropy Center busca concientizar respecto a nuestro papel como agentes de cambio, sí, pero también nos habla de un sentimiento profundo, uno muy humano: el miedo a la nada, a desaparecer, y esto se refleja en la protagonista y su intento desesperado por salvar algo que, a todas luces, no tiene salvación.

The Entropy Center es un juego que, sin ser perfecto, tiene todos los ingredientes para ser una experiencia inolvidable, y que cumple ♥♥♥ un criterio que para mí es lo más importante en una obra de cualquier medio: plantear una reflexión.

Recomendadísimo.
 
achnann
191 produits enregistrés
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 décembre 2022
The Entropy Centre is a clear love letter to Portal that unfortunately has too many annoyances to be enjoyable.

I found the Portal-inspired storyline, humor, and level design to be great. However, I quickly became frustrated with the game as I got further and further into it.

The lack of an in-game manual save is a major annoyance. The game only saves at arbitrary checkpoints you can't control. If, for example, you played through the beginning of an action scene but failed the final jump, chances are you'll have to replay the whole scene from the very beginning.

The same goes for the puzzle solving. Due to the nature of the gameplay, you usually fully set up every test element with the solution in mind, and then execute the planned sequence of events. If you fail to execute correctly, you'll have to set up every element again, since you can't save after initial setup. And this means manually moving each element on the level in the same exact way as before, which is boring since you already figured out the solution in your head.

And you will fail to execute, since some parts of the gameplay are extremely finicky. One of those is the conveyor belt, which sometimes makes physics go haywire and launches your boxes all across the map. Another is the jump pad, which you will often miss because there's no course-correction like in Portal, and other times it will just decide not to preserve your momentum. These faults are completely out of your control and you will most likely have to replay the puzzle from the beginning when they occur, which is extremely frustrating.

The action/fighting scenes I also found to be quite boring. They help spice up the pacing a little, but they also suffer from gameplay issues. Enemy projectiles can sometimes travel through obstacles, and then you don't have enough time to react to them. On levels with rich foliage, you can sometimes just not notice the enemy until it's too late.

Overall, I really feel like there is a solid foundation for a good puzzle game, but the gameplay issues and frustrations make me unable to recommend it.
 
Lebbion

Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2023
Jedyna gra logiczna 3D, która geniuszem ociera się o poziom Portala 1 i 2! Wymaga naprawdę nieszablonowego myślenia, a do tego ma mega intrygującą fabułę. Błyskotliwe, zabawne dialogi i urocza relacja głównej bohaterki ze sztuczną inteligencją naprawdę umilają przechodzenie kolejnych etapów. Polecam też szukanie wszystkich ukrytych notatek w komputerach, bo zawierają mnóstwo smaczków pogłębiających wiedzę o świecie gry.

Ocena: 8,5/10

Évaluation publiée le 25 juillet 2023
This game was one of the best games I have play in a long while, the concept of the game was a very interesting and challenging, but when I got to act 3 I had the bass mechanic in my head.

The "puzzle elements" were very fun and were brought in one at a time which help me in the long run, something that I noticed was the museum area, I love it because it give a lot of lore, but the mean thing that was cool was that the game showed you all the puzzle elements that will find in the future, and when I saw the future puzzle elements I was like "oh s**t, this game get complex"

I won't say to much about the story but the ending was so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ cool, because by the end you know what is going to happen, the computers had a lot of lore on them, which was nice.

if you are going to play this game, please read all the computers, most of them are funny, but give a lot of insight into what happens at the entropy centre.

one more I would love a another game in this universe, nice work guys :)

Évaluation publiée le 7 novembre 2022
Можна кайфнуть з:
- милих персонажів :3
- з діалогів в дусі портал
- графончику
- сюжету. як загалом, так і в записах на компьютерах
- факту вирішення головоломок (не з процесу)
- вміру складних головоломок, що не затримують на довго на одному місці

Бісить:
- за рахунок концепції - усі головоломки складаються з того що потрібно робити по 2 рази одні й ті ж самі речі. Один раз у звичайному вигляді, другий - у зворотньому порядку. Спочатку ніби прикольно - потім лише дратує
- у моментах коли нібито для виживання в тебе обмаль часу, на тебе кричать з усіх боків що ось ось усе помре і треба квапитись - насправді, швидко розумієш що це не так і в тебе нескінченно часу, що псує поглиблення у гру

Все ж більше раджу спробувати, ніж ні
 
n'9TU_CAHTUMETPOBA_6Y/\ABA
243 produits enregistrés

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
18.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
・プレイ時間1時間ぐらいでの感想
長めのデモがあるので、プレイして気に入った人にはおすすめ。
物体の時間を巻き戻す装置を携え、植物に侵食された無人の施設内を巡り、人類を救うという壮大なミッションのためにパズルを解く。
装置に搭載されたAIが可愛らしく、クスッとさせるような流れが多い。
倒壊する柱を急いで巻き戻さないと潰されて死亡することもあり、覚えればいける範囲だと思うがアクション要素やスピードを求められるところもある。
生活感なく無機質な印象の建物内が草まみれになっている退廃美などビジュアルが良い。
主人公はアリアという女性で、記憶が混濁しており何故ただ一人だけで自分が施設にいるのか覚えていない。彼女の背景を知っていくというのもメインストーリーのようだ。
施設について知るためパソコン内のメモを拾い読むことができ、収集要素になっている。

・クリア後の感想
17時間ほどでクリア。死んだり迷ったりしたので、上手い人ならもっと早くにできそう。
クリア後はチャプターごとのやり直しができる。プレイ中はオートセーブのみ。
パズルもアクションもお話もキャラも良かったが、エンドは微妙。
もっと王道ハッピーエンドで良かったのに。ややバッドエンド寄り。特定条件を満たせばハッピーエンドにも行ける、というわけでもないらしい。「こうなってるのかな？」という予想通りのエンドではあった。
 
トロロアニマル

0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
32.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
«The Entropy Centre»
Один из ожидаемых проектов этого месяца крайне порадовал своим выходом в релиз, но к сожалению обошлось не без косяков. В первую очередь можно отдать должное довольно интересной механики перемотки взятую из других игр(Control) и придать вид взятый из всеми известного Portal. Уровни интересны, головоломки в меру сложны, но на уровень портала я пока не увидел и самое главное - ASTRA. ASTRA - крайне милое устройство которое не даст вам заскучать на протяжении всего прохождения и поведает множеством не нужной(в большинстве случаев), но забавной информации :)
Из минусов я бы назвал крайне простенькое меню игры которое не особо смотрится, а так же неизвестную систему сохранений которых мы даже не видим(кроме моментов погрузки глав).
Уверен, вам понравится данный продукт сделанный с душой и с хорошим вдохновением на так полюбившиеся нам игры прошлых лет.

your favorite //CYBER//pony

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2023
As a huge portal fan since I was about 13, I saw this game and instantly got portal vibes. A lot of the reviews said that it would "scratch" that portal "itch" so to speak and it definitely did. The puzzles are relatively challenging but the mechanics are a little clunky in my opinion. I find the jump plates very frustrating. If you are even slightly off in landing on the jump plate you may have to go back and set up the puzzle all over again which can get annoying. I also don't like that there will be some dialog and the screen won't lock you on to where you should be looking so I'm spinning around trying to find what the characters are addressing then a pillar falls on me because I didn't see it. That's probably just me though. Overall, I would recommend this game to anyone who was a fan of Portal (Though you may find yourself trying to solve some puzzles by using portals at the beginning like I did) or just anyone who likes a unique puzzle game. Pretty interesting story line as well with very cute characters.
 
PugslyGoo

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2023
Wait wait wait, a game where you wake up as the sole occupant of a facility and your memory is a little fuzzy, and you have a gun that breaks the laws of physics and the gun has an AI in it that compels you to complete test chambers using the gun to solve puzzles and cubes to trigger switches, and there are bots that try to kill you along the way, the moon is involved somehow, and you’re not entirely certain of the AI’s intentions? SWEET! I love that game! 🤣

All joking aside, it's a great game. Yes, it sounds a bit like Portal 2 if you're *trying* to make it sound that way, but the game mechanics work very differently from Portal, so it's a satisfying puzzler experience that is different enough to be its own thing. It has its own distinct personality/atmosphere, so doesn't feel like an imitation of the other.

I'm working my way through some other "Portal like" or "1st person platforming puzzler" games, but The Entropy Centre stood out and is the first of the lot I completed.

Why do I like it? The story is interesting, I like the dialog, the voice acting is great, and love the humor. I like the music. I love the "aha!" moment when I figure out how to solve a puzzle. Even though the puzzles are relatively easy, and usually simple to execute once you know the solution, I do appreciate that the solution is mainly based on figuring it out, and generally not based on tedious timing.

So far, this is my third favorite "Portal like" game, only behind The Talos Principle and of course the Portal series itself. All of which are highly recommended!

Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

Son teknoloji silahınızla nesneleri zamanda tersine çevirerek bulmacalar çözdüğünüz birinci şahıs oyun.

Devasa ve gizemli bir tesisin içerisinde karşınıza çıkan çeşitli zorluktaki bulmacayı çözmeli ve maceranızın devamlılığını sağlamalısınız. Bulmacaları çözerken en büyük rol zamanı tersine çeviren silahınıza düşüyor. Yıkılmış bir duvara bakıp onu ateşlediğinizde tüm parçalar tersine akıp en baştaki sağlam haline dönüyor. Bu özellik sadece duvar ve sütun gibi objelerle de sınırlı değil. Köşede duran ufak bir küpü elinize alıp sağa sola taşıdıktan sonra yere bırakır ve silahı kullanırsanız duvarda olduğu gibi tüm hareketler tersine çevriliyor. Yine bu da bulmacalarda yaratıcılığınızı ortaya çıkarmaya imkan tanıyan bir başka özellik. İlerlemek için tüm yük her ne kadar silahın omuzlarında görünse de, arka planda sizinle konuşan yapay zekayı da unutmamak gerekir. Oyun boyunca devamlı sizinle sohbet ediyor ve yerine göre bir rehber yerine göre de bir arkadaş oluyor.

Ben bu oyuna baktığımda çok kısa süre içerisinde bir Portal havası aldım. Devasa ortamı, kilit roldeki silah, bulmacalar, seslendirmeler derken bunu hemen siz de hissedebilirsiniz. Yalnız yine de teması ve detaylarıyla kendine has bir oynanış yaratmayı başarmış.
 
Doğaçlamacı
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mars 2023
逆熵是个谎言

最初在新品节上试玩本作的时候
第一印象是：满满的致敬传送门的味道
最开始从昏睡中醒来+解谜方块+枪+女主和人工智能
因此试玩时有下意识地将两作横向比较
也因此当初的游玩体验不是特别好
但这次入正以后决定放下成见好好看看游戏
结果意外地享受

本作的剧情是一大亮点
但我说的不是对白文本这部分写的太烂了
游戏的整体大背景相当有趣
月球上的逆熵中心拯救地球也存在现实上的合理性
游戏内的终端文本也有各种基于此设定衍生出来的有趣小故事
首尾呼应的演出也相当震撼
最初如果没有看过多数游戏内的终端消息的话可能不是很能了解结局的意思
建议跟一趟指南收集一遍
就能理解结局时女主的无力以及本作剧情的悲剧性了

游戏的视觉风格相当不错
开始时先让你一直处在室内展现实验室般死气沉沉的画面
后续揭露谜底后就一直在搭建各类梦幻的布景
在沙滩上眺望远处的地球
以及后续濒临倒塌摇摇欲坠的建筑
使得整体风格统一而不单调

最后是解谜部分
感觉制作组在这一部分上还是没有放太开
每一章都在不停地引进新元素的同时弃用旧元素
导致有的机制似乎还没被开发完全就被放弃了
最后几章更是因为要素过多导致眼花缭乱
但仔细分析之后关卡的复杂度也并不高
导致从中期开始关卡的解谜难度没有多少明显上升
本人对最终关卡尤其不满
仍旧处于元素的二维堆叠层面
没有实现多少精妙的关卡设计
导致关卡没有深度只有长度
因此强烈建议开放创意工坊（

本作白金难度不高
个人白金时长6H
只有收集全终端文本这一项需要刻意逛逛地图
其他基本跟流程都能完成
整体而言还是中规中矩的解谜游戏
推荐感兴趣的各位入8
 
RCWH
456 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
14.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2023
Игруля без сомнения зайдёт любителям головоломок. Её часто сравнивают с Portal. И не просто так. Ведь и там и там, по сути, одна задумка. Проходить уровни с головоломками, чтобы добраться до конца. Но знаете, The Entropy Centre мне зашла куда больше, чем обе части Portal.
Поясню.
Во-первых, сюжет тут имеет больше смысла и весьма более занятный, чем в Portal. Да, это, конечно, сложно назвать полноценным сюжетом, но блин, это головоломка, вы о чём?
Во-вторых, задумка с этим энтропийным аппаратом, который перематывает и останавливает время, показалась мне более интересной, чем создание порталов.
Ну и в-третьих, уровни. Не знаю, как вам, но мне в первой части Portal, ближе к концу игры, они наскучили. Про вторую часть молчу, ибо по сути, концепция та же, просто новые уровни, которые ничем таким не выделялись. Ну и да, вместо злостной картохи, был злостный шарик)
Тут же уровни разнообразнее, больше новых элементов. Да, как и в Portal, от небольших помещений, под конец игры, мы перемещались на громадные локации, где нужно было реально экспериментировать и думать. Но в The Entropy Centre нет, скажем так, жёсткого ограничения в виде определённых комнат. Где только стены, пол, потолок и элементы головоломок. Да, и в Portal были уровни, где не было такого, но тут, опять же, большинство уровней таких.
Также понравилось то, что не было жёсткого навязывания этих уровней. То есть было больше моментов, когда можно просто побегать и посмотреть, что и как. Да и сами переходы между головоломками не были такими душными.
Ну и последнее - это то, что на самих локациях с головоломками больше декора и второстепенных предметов, что делало их не такими унылыми, как в Portal.
Мне кажется, что игра стоит своих денег, к покупке рекомендуется. Ну, а если урвёте по скидончику, то вообще шоколадно

After playing portal knockoffs I am almost annoyed by the fps puzzle genre but this is a portal-inspired game that has redeemed my faith and for me actually stands in the same tier as the portal games. It's not better than them, of course, but by copying the format and structure only and bringing in a unique but intuitive puzzle mechanic as well as one of the best story sequences in recent memory this is a game I will bring up whenever portal is being discussed.

Отличная игра вдохновленная порталом. Милые маскоты, красивая графика, неплохая основная механика. Начало довольно затянутое, очень много слишком простых в понимании, долгих в реализации задачек, но...
 
Xopo
1,796 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2022
This game is kind of a slog. While some puzzles are very well desinged, this is only true for about a fifth of them. most of them are either way too easy or the solution is very fiddly, causing you to spend considerably more time on the execution than figuring out the solution. Also oftentimes, due to the nature of the rewinding mechanic, you can softlock yourself in puzzle chambers, and you have to kill yourself to restart the puzzle.

Adding to this is a frustrating saving system, that doesn't let you save manually and frequently restarts you 1 minute of walking away from the puzzle chamber. Also the puzzle quality drops dramatically towards the end.

After a while I was only playing the game to see the story finished. Needless to say, i was disappointed as well. Despite taking so many influences from portal, that it could be considered plagiarism, the developer didn't seem to think story was one of the elements people liked about portal, because there barely is any. The Hook is alright and by the 3 act a big development happens that really makes you interested how the story will progress. This however is the highpoint of Entropy centre's Story, as there is literally NOTHING happening up until the end in act 15. And the ending is really the most unsatisfying opvious ending that could have possibly been chosen. The story is really nothing to write home about.

Also a puzzle game doesn't need action sequences. Why the core gameplay is constantyl interrupted for mediocre action sequences is beyond me.

TLDR: The game is basically a glorifed portal 2 mod. The story is bad, the new mechanic is interesting but fiddly and annoying, there are constant physics bugs that can completly screw your sollutions up, and for a puzzle game there are too many action and story sequences. There are better portal 2 mods for free, this one is only for people who REALLY need another Portal-like game

1
Recommandé
1.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Portal и Control


Плюсы:

• Хорошая не тормозящая графика.
• Интересный сюжет сильно напоминающий знаменитый Portal.
• Всякие смешные шутки и юмор.
• Хорошее и легкое управление с минимальным количеством кнопок.
• Достижения Steam, из-за чего хочется все облазить, собрать и изучить.
• Нет ограничений по взбиранию по предметам. Можно изловчиться и забраться хоть под потолок.
• Можно говорить с своей пушкой и не чувствовать себя больным на голову.

Минусы:

• Нет автооптимизации видеокартой.
• Нет описание настройкам.
• Не понятно, когда игра сохраняется и можно выйти не потеряв пройденное.
• Не переведен текст плакатов и чего либо.
• GeForce Experience не показывает FPS.
• Нет приседания.
• Нет бега на Shift и вообще его (1 средний режим, в целом достаточный баланс).
• Не уметь плавать конечно.
• Субтитры голоса здания блочат пушку и мои. В итоге половина пропуск, треш...
• Мелко написаны номера комнат.
• Баги в комнатах. Иногда не надо ставить куб и так дверь открывается)

Заключение:

• Мне название лично напоминает игру Control, а так очень похожа на Portal, но все новое и смысл головоломок тоже новый.
• В начале игры вылетел какой то "Ё" из стенки... Думал сердце выйдет через задний проход от неожиданности)))
Подумал потом: Так вот где наш именитый "Ё Мобиль"... Полоумное создание с скоростью текста флеша. Ничего не понятно, но очень интересно) Пока больше не встречал.
• Думаю стоит дождаться Русификатора картинок и текста. Скорее всего появится. Игра интересная.

Оценка с итогом:

8.5 из 10, Очень печалит отсутствие Русской озвучки и понятия сохранения игры. А так рекомендую однозначно!

Equal parts funny and challenging, The Entropy Center is a worthy successor to Portal. Its inspirations are clear, with the puzzle room format being the same, both in terms of esthetic and structure, and a quirky, charming AI motivating players to move ever-forward. Excellent puzzles and an intriguing story make for a thoroughly enjoyable experience.
 
Itonami
379 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2022
This is an excellent portal-style game. The dialogue is cheeky, the puzzles are nice and tight, and the adventure is definitely worth it.
The game's main mechanic is a rewind mechanic that can rewind the path of an object. It is important to note that it does not take account the time it took to travel that path. If you have played games like The Talos Principle or Hourglass, this subtle difference is a huge departure of the rewind gimmick. Now your planning does not rely on waiting, but creating the correct path to solve a puzzle. There are a few other subtleties that make this rewind mechanic super dynamic, but I won't spoil them here.
The game adds many mechanics to it, and I mean many, such as time gates or jump cubes (basically portable springs), which all add a new level of complexity to the puzzles. There is one level early on where you have to figure out how to bring 2 jump cubes 2 floors up, but your only way to move upwards is with the jump cubes. It's an interesting problem with an even more interesting solution. That is just one example of the many different clever puzzles that are in this game.
At about an hour and a half, I reached Act 5, and I was worried the game was going to be way too short. The rest of the game took about 6 extra hours, so it wasn't actually a problem. The levels get far more complex once you reach Act 6 and onward. At this point, the game trusts you understand how to play and throws the training wheels off. If I had one gripe, it's that the first few acts had a few repeat puzzles, and you can see this in the demo. It got better as time went on, but it was definitely something worth pointing out.

Overall, the game's clever take on a rewind mechanic removes any annoying waiting and adds a more dynamic tool that is far more interesting to play around with. Even with my gripe with the beginning levels, this game is a 10/10 for me. What a fantastic experience this was!
 
dackid19

RON!N
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 février 2023
Points positifs (+) :
✅ Histoire : On incarne Aria, dernier espoir de l'humanité alors que le noyau de la Terre est sur le point d'exploser, en soit c'est loin d'être le scénario de l'année mais c'est gentillet, et surtout très bien amené ! Une histoire fort sympathique !
✅ Graphismes : Le moteur UE4 fait parfaitement le job ! C'est très beau et très propre, la DA est vraiment cool, tout fonctionne parfaitement bien ! Les divers effets sont très bons, c'est même parfois assez impressionnant (disons-le) ! c'est un sans-faute pour moi !
✅ Level design : Des environnements sympas et assez variés dans l'ensemble ! Le level design se prête parfaitement au gameplay ainsi qu'à l'histoire ! C'est un gros oui !
✅ Gameplay : On ne peut plus bateau, mais ça fonctionne tellement bien ! Les énigmes sont vachement sympas et certaines d'entre elles auront le mérite de vous faire fumer le cerveau ! Un plaisir de A à Z ! Concernant l'IA qui nous accompagne tout au long de l'aventure, on est très loin d'un GlaDOS qui marche à la moquerie et à l'humour noir les 3/4 du temps ! ASTRA est attachante, mais cette dernière est plus présente pour nous accompagner qu'autre chose, même si l'humour reste bien présent (à petite dose) ! Elle remplit parfaitement son rôle !
✅ Sound design : Les sons et les musiques sont vraiment très très cool sans être inutilement intrusifs/intrusives ! Tout se mélange parfaitement bien ! Un bon point pour l'immersion !
✅ Optimisation : RAS avec ma config (voir mon profil) ; 1440p/tout au max ! c'est parfaitement fluide ! Un régal !
✅ Durée de vie : Il m'aura fallu environ quasi 11h (10,5h exactement) pour platiner le jeu ! ce n’est pas foufou mais ce n’est pas dég*eulasse non plus !

Points négatifs (-) :
⛔ Gameplay/Level design : Il y a des bugs de collision... pas souvent, mais tout de même suffisants pour me faire mourir comme une m*rde ou me faire recommencer tout un puzzle du début un paquet de fois (c'est exaspérant surtout lors des derniers niveaux)...
⛔ Doublage : Pas de VF dommage... (sous-titres français uniquement)
⛔ Coop : Pas de coop dommage aussi...
⛔ Rejouabilité : Une fois terminé, à part s'atteler à se refaire l'histoire, c'est quand même assez limité... peut-être éventuellement faire du speedrun pour améliorer ses temps... Mais bon moi perso ça ne m'intéresse pas...

Conclusion (?) :
💬 The Entropy Center nous fait replonger dans cette ambiance puzzles/casse-tête pour le plus grand bonheur des amateurs du genre ! C'est vraiment un bon jeu de de réflexion et d'énigmes en 3D qui fait immédiatement penser à Portal ! Réussir à penser à l’envers est franchement satisfaisant ! La difficulté est progressive, et les nouveaux éléments nous seront présentés un par un donc pas d'inquiétude pour les novices. Si les premières énigmes seront très vite résolues, les dernières vous prendront beaucoup (beaucoup plus) de temps ! Et croyez-moi il y en a d'assez corsé ! Est-ce que TEC est le digne "successeur" de la franchise Portal ? Oui et non. Déjà je trouve qu'il est plus difficile que Portal, après que ce soit sur le fond ou sur la forme, on sent instantanément que les jeux de Valve ont été l'inspiration première et principale pour le dev de chez Stubby Games ! Un grand bravo à lui car je n'imagine même pas la quantité de travail à abattre pour en arriver à un jeu si cool et si bien fini tout seul ! Concernant le prix, c'est raisonnable mais sachez que le jeu est facilement trouvable sur le net à 13€ soit quasi -50% que sur le store officiel de Steam ! c'est clairement donné ! On passe un bon moment, donc n'hésitez pas ! Ce jeu est une petite pépite !
 
SaiyajinK
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 décembre 2022
The Entropy Centre is a very good first person puzzler. Using the central mechanic of rewinding objects, mostly cubes, in time, you go through a deserted moon facility, solve puzzles and make steady progress, all with the goal of reverting a cataclysm on earth. It is mostly well optimized and works flawlessly on the Steam Deck as well - it actually worked better there than on my PC.

The central mechanic of the game allows you to rewind a cube in time up to 30 seconds. This mechanic never changes, but the environment does. There will be laser cubes, spring cubes, bridges, conveyors etc. Thinking backwards is the name of the game here and it allows for some interesting and unique puzzle solving.

The puzzles never get too big or out of hand, which is good; though I do think that the game holds back a bit too much. Almost all of the puzzles are very easy as the solution essentially always boils down to "find the last thing you need to do and then work backwards". It gets a bit more complicated when several cubes or different cube types come into play, but it never explodes the brain. I think this game definitely has room for some small DLC campaigns that expand on the central mechanic and are overall harder, similar to what Q.U.B.E 2 and Relicta did for their DLC campaigns. I hope that will happen, as I think this mechanic has a LOT more potential for some truly hard brain teasers.

Overall, though, this is a moderately long puzzle game with some easy to moderate puzzles that anyone can solve their way through. The story is interesting enough and there are some optional terminals expanding the background story. It's all standard stuff, but it works and I had fun. Aside from some minor physics quirks in the very few puzzles that rely on it as well as some minor performance problems in debris-heavy areas, it was great. I hope to see more from this game in the future, but it's a definite recommendation!
 
Yarusenai

Évaluation publiée le 15 janvier 2023
玩完这款游戏，你也能成为3D平台跳跃大师
简要评价：谜题设计欠点火候。因为频繁地引入新机制并抛弃旧机制导致难度曲线成波浪线行进，也就最后两个章节搞了些融合谜题比较有水准。个人认为难度比传送门2略高 个人确实更擅长空间谜题，the talos principle里的时间解谜做的我头疼） 剧情演出非常不错。场景设计相当精彩（正好对上个人审美），感觉相比谜题，想要找齐所有邮件（收集物）更困难。几十封散落在场景的计算机中的邮件极大地丰富了游戏的世界观，很建议仔细阅读（有些确实蛮有趣的）。然而，正如评测第一句所言，这个跳跃装置的落点有些微妙，很容易因为落点偏移浪费时间，其他地方也有一些瑕疵。战斗解谜的部分感觉并没有其他评测说的那么严重，有战斗的地方解谜难度为0 基本上是开开关和回溯物体 ，只是会相当令人紧张。但是，瑕不掩瑜，本作仍然是一款吸引人并值得尝试的游戏，喜爱传送门的玩家应该可以在本作找到不少乐子 也推荐喜爱泰坦陨落2的玩家，你说是吧Astra

Recommandé
14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2023
Being a devoted enthusiast of entropy and puzzle games, delving into this one was a must for me.

The puzzles themselves are decent. Each new area introduces a fresh set of mechanics, with the difficulty steadily escalating through the total five levels.

The narrative revolves around the concept of loops, omnipresent and interwoven. Loops are the scholarly pursuit, and it seems every writer worldwide is fixated on infusing them into their creations.
While I initially enjoyed the theme, it became somewhat monotonous after encountering it repeatedly.

On the technical side, Unreal Engine 5 posed a challenge for my PC, struggling to keep up. Hoping for optimization in future updates, as the current state feels like a bit of a letdown from the developers.
 
Wriss

Recommandé
9.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2023
Veľmi sympatická logická puzzle hra. Jednotlivé puzzle sú pomerne pestré a preto hráč nemá pocit, že by sa opakovali tie isté veci. Kedže sa jedná o hru založenú na princípe vracania vecí v čase je až podivuhodné do akej miery sú puzzle kreatívne. Umelá inteligencia ako asistentka, ktorá vypĺňa hluché miesta je občas naozaj zábavná.
Nejaké tie neduhy sa našli aj pri tejto hre. Asi najväčším problémom sú pasáže, kde hráč sa Šmýka dole potrubím a pri nesprávnej voľbe smeru v ktorom vypadne z rúry sa dá zaseknúť mimo herný koridor. Zároveň som narazil na problém s vetrákom v Akte 15. Niekoľko násobné opakovanie začiatku aktu len preto lebo sa nespustil script.
Plusy hry:
- kreatívne puzzle
- nízka repetetívnosť
- puzzle vyžadujú občas kreatívne riešenie
- vtipný asistent je asi samozrejmosť
Mínusy hry:
- občasná nejasnosť prostredia
- miestami príliš citlivé bariery, ktoré ničia kocky
- jedno opakované zlyhanie skriptu

Recommandé
11.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 février 2023
!ratlov ed aroH.

-O jogo lembra um pouco Portal, só que ao invéis de criar portais você usa a arminha pra voltar objetos no tempo.
-A arminha tem rostinho e conversa com você! E ele é muito carismática. :))
-A interação da protagonista com a arminha é sempre divertida, eu sempre parava de andar só pra ouvir as conversas das duas.
-Existem vários puzzles e eles são bem criativos e as vezes demandam muita atenção.
-Conforme você vai avançado, entra em cena outros tipos de blocos com funções diferentes, o que amplia ainda mais a variedade de puzzles.
-Gostei dos gráficos e do enredo.
-Tem suporte ao português.

Notinha do random123:

[_] - Perfeitamente daora, né?
[X] - Muito daora, né?
[_] - Daora, né?
[_] - Não tão daora, né?
[_] - Nada daora, né?

Évaluation publiée le 21 novembre 2022
Insomma, alla fine della fiera non possiamo fare altro che congratularci ♥♥♥ The Entropy Centre. Una sola persona ♥♥♥ il suo studio Stubby Games è riuscita a sfidare i colossi del settore ♥♥♥ un prodotto assolutamente geniale, originale e tecnicamente valido. Gli enigmi rendono in modo veramente intrigante e restituiscono un vero senso di appagamento ogni volta che si riuscirà a “unire tutti i puntini”. Inoltre la trama in piccole dosi sci-fi, ♥♥♥ i suoi temi esistenziali, non può che elevare il titolo ancor di più. Sollevandolo sopra la soglia di “semplice” produzione indipendente, e facendolo puntare alle stelle ♥♥♥ coraggio. Non saranno certo alcune piccole distrazioni a penalizzare il titolo, che speriamo possa avere il riscontro che merita. Se una sola persona è riuscita a creare una tale macchina di riflessione, c’è ancora speranza per chiunque abbia abbastanza intraprendenza da mettersi letteralmente in gioco.
Voto: 9/10
Recensione completa su:
https://www.ilvideogioco.com/2022/11/15/the-entropy-centre-recensione-pc/

Recommandé
20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2022
The Entropy Centre is a really enjoyable first person puzzle game similar to Portal. There are a lot of similar mechanics such as jump pads, light bridge, pressure plates, etc. The main difference is instead of your gun creating portals and you have to use your momentum, your gun will rewind time for objects so they can move across a room without you necessarily carrying them. The story was interesting and the gun talks to you in a much more wholesome way than GlaDOS would talk to you.

The one thing I would recommend to the devs for future games is to give people a sort of "hard mode" option. The game itself is relatively easy. The tricky things have massive hints by having squares painted on the floor so you already know where to place certain cubes. That's fine and all but it would be cool if there was a "hard mode" where these painted squares are disabled so you don't have any hints in solving the puzzles.

Regardless of that, the puzzles are still fun to solve. I enjoyed solving them all. This is a solid game if you're interested in first person puzzle games.
 
Frankie Spankie
2,349 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Digne successeur de Portal 2, reprenant pas mal de ses codes, tout en rajoutant sa petite touche, The Entropy Center possède de très bonnes idées dans ses puzzles.

Si le début peut laisser l'impression d'une simple copie avec juste Astra, un pistolet qui fait remonter le temps à la place du Portal Gun, les multiples éléments qui s'ajoutent tout au long du jeu lui permettent de se démarquer de son modèle, et sont parfaitement introduits dans une courbe de progression où la difficulté est parfaitement dosée, que ce soit dans les "salles de test" ou les phases de plateforme.

Si vous avez aimé Portal 2, vous pouvez y aller les yeux fermés, c'est du tout bon !

401 produits enregistrés

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 novembre 2022
Дружба, одиночество и необратимость бытия
The Entropy Centre игра-головоломка с видом от третьего лица наподобие небезызвестной Portal, так же Q.U.B.E., The Talos Principle. Сравнивать с порталом смысла нет, так как игры разные, единственное, что их объединяет так это наличие кубика и вид от третьего лица. Головоломки крайне простые и часто повторяются. Качество проработки окружения не самое лучшее, множество уровней можно пройти не по правилам: где-то недопрыгнув до нужной точки, где-то при прыжке залезть туда, куда не нужно, кубик поставить криво или использовав баг с электрощитком. Есть места, где можно застрять, а единственный способ выбраться - перезапуск уровня.
При всех недостатках играть в это довольно весело. Завлекает сюжет, который лучше всего раскрывается с чтением писем с терминалов и наблюдением за взаимоотношениями главной героини и искусственного интеллекта "Астры" у которой прекрасный юмор при не менее прекрасной озвучке.
При полном прохождении остается множество вопросов, на которые вы не получите ответов, остается только гадать. Хотелось бы побольше комментариев от Арьи, шуточек от Астры и более проработанных и сложных уровней, а так, в целом я доволен прохождением.
 
eriks0n
577 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2022
Great game, enjoyed it a lot.
If judging it as a standalone game (not comparing it to Portal. or similar experiences), it's really cool, not sure how much time or money it took to develop it, but it's a solid 8-9 hours for one play through.
Puzzles are enjoyable, although maybe racking up in difficulty a bit too slow, since you really start to turn gears in your head more in about last third of the game. The variety of mechanics for puzzles was really appreciated and it didn't feel stale, with few somewhat original ideas (at least for me, but I didn't personally play a lot of puzzle games).
Story is fine, nothing too exciting, but I guess enough to justify the stuff happening in the game, although I didn't like ending too much, it was sort of underwhelming and predictable, and didn't really lead to anything.
Visuals are great in quality, but a bit lacking in visual style and design I'd say, and seems to be all over the places on some occasions.

If comparing it to Portal, I'd say it'd still hold up pretty good, but I feel like level storytelling, as well as narrative through visual design in general is lackluster. Almost everything has this overgrown post-apocalyptic look to it, as if it was untouched for hundreds of years, and it stays like that through whole game, with very little changes and mix-ups (the most notably probably being the beach/tropical zones and half-destroyed everything near the ending)

On technical side, had 1 crash and 1 game freeze (when I was switching windows) through whole playthrough so I'd say it's stable.
On R5 5600X, RX 6900XT, 16 GB of 3200MHz RAM and PCIe gen 4 SSD, game was running good, in 1440p had 120FPS locked on Ultra settings everything, only there were couple of stutters every time there was (I assume) level streaming, especially in the very beginning of the game, before any loading screens, but it wasn't anything game-breaking.

BadKarma
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 avril 2023
物体の時間を巻き戻す銃アストラを使いパズルを解いていく一人称パズルゲーム。ある物体をA地点からB地点へ移動したあとにその物体を撃つと、BからAへと時間を遡ってその物体が移動することを使い、スイッチや様々なオブジェクトを操作しながらゴール地点を目指す。

パズルの難易度はやや簡単。というのも、プレイヤーがやれることは（極端に言えば）時間を戻すことのみなので、パズルは全てゴールから逆順で考える必要があり、そのためパズルもゴールまでのルートが自然と明らかとなるような作りとせざるを得なくなっている為である。しかし逆説的にはプレイヤーが全ての答えを持ちあわせていなければ決してゴールすることはできず、その時出来ることをただやるだけのステップバイステップ戦法や、総当たりで弄っていたら偶然クリアできたといったパズルゲームにありがちな運に頼ることは出来ない。そのためプレイヤーが自力でゴールを勝ち取る気持ちよさや爽快感は強い。またパズルは立体的でギミックもシンプルながらプレイヤーの操作に従順で扱いやすく、パズルの解法に無理がなく、微妙な位置調整が必要なところはガイドがあるなどストレスを感じにくいパズルデザインとなっている。

ステージは全体で50以上あり、ギミックも徐々に追加されていくのでバリエーションもボリュームも十分（クリアまで7時間ほど）。一部ジャンプアクションを要求されるところでやや操作性に不満はあるが、一人称パズルゲームとしては全体的によくまとまっており初心者からでも十分に楽しめる良作。
 
cHeeSy
1,111 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
134.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
This game is immaculate. If you enjoyed Portal then stop reading the reviews and just play the game, I can guarantee that you will love it. All of the puzzles were rewarding (except for the tutorial levels, but thats somewhat expected) and even after 60 or so puzzles I still want more. I can only remember one puzzle in the entire game that I didn't enjoy, but even then that was more of my fault then the fault of the game. The mechanic of rewinding objects is utilized masterfully. The occasional points of running through the facility as it's falling apart and using the entropy gun to fix the surroundings as you go felt exhilerating.
 
Floop
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2022
Превосходная игрулька в стиле Portal. Та же атмосфера (в основном, сравнимо с Portal 2), та же задумка в основе головоломок: в самом мире объяснили, почему именно головоломки, и зачем это нужно. Спойлерить, конечно же, не буду.
Всё очень просто и распинаться тут нет особого смысла: мы проходим головоломки возрастающей сложности, параллельно нам рассказывают сюжет. В конце происходит концовка, и мы такие "ну... Неплохо", и удаляем игру. Головоломки основаны на перестановке кубиков туда-сюда: у нас есть нажимные плиты (или датчики, в которые нужно светить лазером), на них нужно поставить кубики, открывается выход, выходим с уровня. Кубики можно таскать в руках, бросать на прыгучие плиты и отматывать во времени назад. Приятно то, что из-за отмотки времени нужно думать сразу в две стороны: не только проецировать своё положение в будущее, но и проецировать положение объектов в прошлое.
К сожалению, мозголомная загадка за всю игру всего лишь одна, на ней я сидел 40 минут. Все остальные в первый раз требуют 1-5 минут для осознания решения и реализации задумки.

Проблемы у игры есть:
Очень длинная сюжетная часть. Залпом её проходить довольно тяжко: ближе к концу игры уже реально устаёшь переставлять кубики с места на место. Хочется сделать перерыв, но понимаешь, что вернувшись через неделю ты уже не будешь понимать, кто тут и что, зачем мы тут и вообще что происходит. Сюжет подталкивает проходить игру залпом, но она слишком длинная для этого. Хотелось бы, чтобы был основной сюжет и "бонусные комнаты".
Большая часть лора подаётся через "записки" -- стоящие тут и там мониторы, в которых можно почитать переписку и получить информацию о местной истории. Само по себе это не плохо, но я понимаю, что без собирания этих "записок" игрок будет постоянно задаваться вопросами "почему?" и "как это работает?".
Довольно плохая оптимизация. Для такой графики загрузки длинноваты, а FPS низковат.

Понятное дело, есть и шероховатости вроде довольно странной регистрации "придавливания" и отсутствия анимации смерти, но в остальном игра прекрасна. Приятная графика, отличный юмор, интересная задумка и неплохой сюжет. Всё плюс-минус предугадывается сильно заранее, и по итогу оказывается сильно проще, чем я накрутил у себя в голове, но приходить в концовочку интересно.
Лично для меня огромный плюс состоит в том, что нет ни единой загадки, основанной на скорости. Спешить нигде никуда не нужно.

В общем, рекомендую игру всем любителям всяких Portal, Q.U.B.E, Relicta и The Talos Principle, но сложности от неё не ждите.
 
Ice_Haron
0
