Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2023
The Entropy Centre ist der kleine Cousin von Portal. Es verfolgt einen ähnlichen Humor und wird ergänzt durch ein paar PvE Elemente + neue Rätsel-Mechanics. Die Rätsel sind bis dato noch nicht allzu anspruchsvoll, doch kann ich dem Spiel bereits jetzt eine positive Rezension geben, da diese Spielgenre in der Art seit Jahren nicht mehr bedient wurde und ich diese Art Game liebe! Das Spiel sieht wirklich gut aus. Für jeden Portal Fan ist dieses Game ein Must-Have.
 
data
203 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier 2023
Nice Puzzle Game. Cannot Deny it tries to be a Portal Clone with the humor and some of the atmosphere within the game. The story is good but not paced well. Basically you have to solve puzzles to generate some special sauce called entropy to save earth! It ties well with the current situation we are in but does not go too deep but there are a lot of messages scribbled across walls and computer messages if you would like to spend time there. SO coming to the meat of the game which is basically you solving puzzles involving a mechanic of reversing time. There are many puzzle elements from boxes,lasers,fans,switches.Nothing unique if you have been playing puzzle games. The time reversal mechanic I think might be the first time done in a 3d puzzle game. The puzzles are not difficult and just require some logical thinking once you get used to thinking about time going backwards! The only problems with the game are some puzzles very few do not obey what you have been taught throughout the game and also the physics is very janky which might lead to the need to repeat processes again as there are no quick saves. Other than that new puzzle elements are introduced at proper times but it does get a bit repetitive towards the last 30 percent of the game. Overall 15 chapters with about 4-5 puzzles each with the last half having some tedious puzzles which get frustrating due to the janky physics and no quick saves. There are a few action sequences which are passable but still fun. Still worth a buy as it is not a full prized game and if you like first person 3d puzzlers this is a must buy.

Just a note I did have some minor bugs which simply require you to load a previous save but there were hardly 3-5 in my entire playthrough. I did have some crashes but that might be down to my old laptop.
 
peacefultrance
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
So I normally don't write any reviews, which is actually a shame and I should start to write more, but this time I really wanted to write one.

The Entropy Centre is a puzzle solving game inspired by Portal which is a really really great thing. Even though it is inspired by Portal it has it's completely own charm and Story.

The puzzles were very great, the time mechanic is really really thought out and is fun to use. Puzzle elements get introduced in a very easy to understand way. I never was really stuck in a puzzle, though this could also be because I already have experience in puzzle games and harder ones, but this doesn't mean that I didn't have fun solving the puzzles. It was a very relaxing experience and the story is really really great. I wanted to read all the terminal messages because of how funny and informative they were! The Game has a really great setting and throws some hints here and there for the player to make him/her think about the story.

All in all I can really recommend this one for people looking for a game like portal, people who want to experience a nice puzzle game with a good story.

PS: I love E.
 
~Domi
413 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
I recently had the opportunity to play The Entropy Centre, and I have to say, it was absolutely amazing. A friend of mine recommended it to me because of my love for Portal. Starting the game I saw some similarities between The Entropy Centre and Portal but The Entropy Centre was unique and creative in its own ways. To start, the storyline of The Entropy Centre was fascinating, with a well-crafted plot that kept me looking for lore. I like the ideas they explored and felt rewarded when I went out of my way to look for more information. I loved the writing, characters and the voice acting was great! One of the things that really impressed me about The Entropy Centre was the level design. I found that the puzzles were challenging but not frustrating. The level design pushed users to think outside of the box to solve puzzles. Puzzle solving always felt good and I loved the way the game pushed me out of my comfort zone of thinking. I do not recommend beating the game in one sitting as you may rush and ruin the experience for yourself. You also might get frustrated, so try to take breaks! Overall, I highly recommend The Entropy Centre to anyone looking for a fun, engaging puzzle game.
 
Kawaii_Master_69
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2022
This is a frankly great game in its own right - although I think the story elements are a bit over-hyped and they're trying way too hard to make the AI assistant endearing - but its physics are not entirely up-to-snuff for what the game is demanding. Early stages with very basic puzzle-solving work fine, and I think most of the polish was put there since most players would be spending a solid chunk of their playtime getting used to thinking around the implications of the rewind function. Incorporating multiple rewinds, pausing objects in midair to solve puzzles, and getting timing juuuuust right feels great. What doesn't feel great is when you're getting into late-game puzzles more towards the end, some of the puzzles just break down and require either chance, in terms of moving objects, or happening across the actual way to solve the puzzle by accident due to how open the level layout winds up being from having the late-game puzzle tools. Player momentum/jumping, how an object falls, how an object interacts with its future path after being rewound, some clipping issues with the bridge cube, and unnecessary precision with things like the laser cube and conveyor timing make me feel like this was an egg which hatched too early.

Overall, great game that I wish I could love more, but it really can't live up to the expectations it sets for itself.
 
That festive jerk

PersieQ
109 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

A lot of people say that this feels like a Portal game, and I think they're right.

But even though this game is clearly Portal-inspired it acquires its own identity with its amazing story and unique mechanics. The puzzles were kinda easy for me but still very satisfying to complete. I loved that the game never took a break from introducing you to another puzzle mechanic or throwing one of many incredibly fun chase levels at you.

Combined with all these levels is a masterpiece of a story. It doesn't seem much at first but the way it escalates and presents itself is truly amazing. Besides the actual story cutscenes, many lore pieces are hidden all over the game and give you a fun insight on the world you explore.

In conclusion, the game is amazing and I can tell a lot of effort and love went into making it. I recommend it to any puzzle game fan.

8.5/10

Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2022
Jeśli ktoś lubi Portala, Talos Principle, Test Turinga, Witness i inne gry FPS polegające na rozwiązywaniu zagadek, będzie się tu czuł jak ryba w wodzie. Zagadki nie są co prawda zbyt trudne (najdłużej nad jedną spędziłem 20 minut), ale dzięki temu tempo gry nie siada. Ładna grafika, dobra muzyka, ciekawa i dająca do myślenia historia. Jak dla mnie spokojnie 8/10. Możliwe nawet, że znajdzie się wśród moich ulubionych gier roku 2022.
 
Ryslaw
853 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2022
Good game, I enjoyed it a lot, but there are parts that I really wish had been better crafted.

First, the puzzle. Without giving away too much hints, I feel like the puzzles have about the same difficulty level for the entire game, save maybe for a few ones. I also found some levels to be cheesable, not sure if those were intended (like Portal's time trial solutions), but there are quite a number of instances where you can access out of bound areas, which led me to believe that those cheeses are design oversights.

Second, the story. I really got intrigued by the plot, the build up towards the end was so good, however the climax was a bit underwhelming for me. I was hoping to see a grander ending, I really thought the idea has so much potential.

None of that is a major concern though, would definitely rewind myself back in time and play it again if I could :)
 
mynoodle
144 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
Great Portal like game. It is be best FPS puzzler since Portal, with charming character interactions and an interesting story. Rarely do I read story lore in a game, but I found myself reading every line I could in this game to find out more of what is happening. The puzzles start off way to easy, but they do get more challenging towards the later half of the game. Also the puzzles were never as tricky as what I saw in Portal 2, they were all very solvable even as they became more complex. Personally I am still not sure if that is a good thing or bad thing for the game, but I did really enjoy it and I hope for a follow up.

#DLGbump

Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
Как уже все отметили, это - Portal 3.
Главная фишка - перемотка предметов назад во времени.
Есть старые добрые кубы, вроде обычно и с лазеров, но есть и парочка новых: переносной трамплин, переносной световой мост, и вырастающий при перемотке.
Сюжет и окружение имеют нотки Portal и Control.
Оптимизация оставляет желать лучшего, особенно, во время перемотки больших объектов или во время появления большого количество частиц
 
DDontS
814 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
I want to love this game so badly. Portal 2 was lightning in a bottle; absolute perfection in my eyes back when I first played it and I have revisited that game so many times in the past for its writing, sense of humor, pacing, story telling, satisfying game play, lore, etc. It all just...worked so effortlessly.

The Entropy Centre clearly aspires to those same heights and nailed so many of them that I want to love it just for the clear amount of effort that went into this game.

However, it falls short. Maybe it's just because I can never have that same ignorant, wide-eyed sense of awe once it's experienced. But I think EC's shortcomings are really there.

(minor spoilers ahead)
First off, the good:
Entropy is just such a great game mechanic. It's (mostly) intuitive and its cube and button based testing (one of the MANY indirect references to the creators' love for Portal / Portal 2) is just super well done. They improved on a few puzzle elements that Portal created and lovingly expanded on them.
These enhancements weren't always successful (more on that later) but they were fun to mess around with for the most part.

The story is a fascinating take: a giant entropy reversal beam shot from the moon any time Earth experiences a catastrophe and the in-game emails about the blase` attitude workers (who are quite literally saving the world every day) have about it just works so well. It takes an out-of-this-world scifi concept and grounds it in the everyday bureaucratic nightmare that would surround such responsibility.

It all takes place in a wonderful environment that was obviously crafted with great love and attention to detail, not to mention the efforts to make such a clusterf*ck of a work environment feel lived in.

I still don't know how I feel about the protagonist having a voice (in contrast to Chell being silent in Portal); on the one hand, I love the characterization from the voice actor and the lines are well written enough for all the exposition that happens at the beginning.
On the other hand, after the first 20 minutes or so you know about 90% of the story and can easily guess what the twist is, they run out of useful things for Aria to say. Oh right, and she's talking to an AI interface named ASTRA, who is embedded in their version of the Portal gun, the entropy gun.
You have to be really invested in the story of Aria and ASTRA's relationship, their fun quips to each other, and Aria's agonizingly slow realization of what's happened in the facility.

The Bad:
I'll just say it: the puzzle elements get real repetitive, really quickly. Even as they introduce a ton of new aspects to them, when compared to Portal, they're not exactly memorable or particularly new. It can make it feel like the puzzles are trying to be unnecessarily complex rather than brain teasers that are fun to solve.
Most of the time, I know exactly what to do as soon as I walk into a puzzle room, it's just getting the sequencing right. I became focused on the monotonous ordering of my actions so they played in reverse correctly rather than having a challenge that took effort to solve.

F*ck those damn security robots. They're frustrating as hell when your character only walks. Being able to duck or sprint would've made it more of a fun combat scenario rather than making me feel like a turkey on Thanksgiving.

There's a few glitches as well. I rewound some elements that I thought I was supposed to stand on, instantly died, and thought I made a mistake. Nope, that's was what I was supposed to do, the game just glitched and killed me instead. This happened about 8-10 times. Not enough to be mad about it right after release but it was frustrating.

(big spoilers ahead)
Lastly, and perhaps most disappointingly, the ending. I saw this ending coming from miles away but expected them to subvert it somehow because accepting that you're just caught in a loop of forgetting everything and redoing it as the world is destroyed over and over again, essentially saying the world is doomed and you'll be stuck in a loop trying to fix it forever is so damn depressing.
The story I think tries to hint that somehow Aria makes it into a version of the universe where the world is saved but it's pretty vague from my view (I'm dense and unapologetic about it; explicit storytelling is needed when there's nothing but storytelling left after all the game play is done)

Overall, The Entropy Centre is an experience I am glad to have had. There's real love for the world and the story its trying to tell but the characters, storyline, and puzzle elements fall flat after a while. Yes, I found Aria and ASTRA's friendship genuine and chuckled once or twice but it was a little too...one note?

The game play, mechanics, characters, and concept deserved more humanity and a happier ending. It's a real gem of a game that I wish had had time to fully form into the rare diamond we so desperately need in today's world. Nevertheless, it's a good game and the developers should be proud.

Who knows? Maybe I'll come back and replay it in a few years and completely change my mind. I'm fickle.
 
techknowgeek_
0

Recommandé
7.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Overall I did enjoy my time and think the game is worth the price.

The puzzles didn't feel that great or hard to me. None of the puzzles felt as in depth as in some other puzzlers. Most of the time the puzzles had a first part of fetching more cubes and second part of opening the exit with said cubes. Mood of the impending doom isn't as immersive as in some other games, maybe because there isn't any real timers. Not gonna spoil anything so can't say everything, but the story is still fun and worth playing. The puzzles can be and are fun, but it can get a bit shallow and boring for the more experienced puzzle players.

Just minor bugs and things that the devs didn't think players would do. For example I was able to carry a jump pad into a scripted event and I jumped over the hazard and watched from exit as the now empty space was getting saved from the impending hazard. It was kinda funny but it doesn't help with the immersion.

Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2022
El juego es muy bueno a lo que llevo jugado
Los puzzles son bastante interesantes y divertidos, los gráficos son muy buenos, está bien optimizado, la química entre Aria (tú personaje) y Astra (dispositivo para regresar el tiempo) es bastante divertida y te sacará una sonrisa de vez en cuando

La historia también de momento es muy interesante, algo que no esperaría mucho realmente de un juego enfocado a puzzles, pero realmente te intriga a querer avanzar más

¿Has esperado por mucho tiempo por un "Portal 3"?
Creo que esto es lo más parecido que encontrarás en el mercado ahora mismo, 100% recomendado.

Recommandé
15.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 juillet 2023
Worthwhile.

The game is fun, the story is intriguing, the world is beautiful, the humor is good, and the puzzles are interesting. It's a hard genre to have a game in, but the developer did a good job.

While I really enjoyed the game and believe it is worth purchasing there are a few things to point out.

Compared to other puzzle games, this one is definitely on the easier end. Rarely did I find myself scratching my head to find a solution. That didn't take away from the novelty and fun though.

There were a lot of doors that you couldn't open throughout the game - you just weren't allowed to....so why even put them there. No apparent reason to have a lock on them if you can't open them anyway...

And of course one cannot help but mention the ending. It was a bit disappointing, and I'm guessing most people agree. I was interested and intrigued, which drove me to solve the puzzles, but I ended up being let down by the ending.

Shedar
7,542 produits enregistrés
0
10 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
5.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
This is one of the best puzzle games that I have ever played. It reminds me at games as Portal and Q.U.B.E.

The special gun you use could bring objects back in time. So, this is mostly how the puzzles work. Study how to make a route of items, place them in the right order and then try out with the gun.

There is also some action and fighting included. For example you need to run away from something, but the building is collapsing. So you need to use the gun to repair the building on time while you are running away. The game also has a fighting system. Until now the fights are pretty easy, but maybe that could be more intense further in the game.

So yes, I really could recommend this game. It is polished, the (many) puzzles are great and there is also some action included.

Here is some gameplay from me:
Vidéo YouTube™: The Entropy Centre Gameplay / Act 2 & 3 Walkthrough 
Vues : 50
More info about this game is available on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1730590/The_Entropy_Centre/ Think in reverse. Outsmart the impossible.

1
Non recommandé
8.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
I was really excited for this game as a massive Portal fan and I was honestly very disappointed. I really wanted to like this game but at the end of the day it just fell short of my expectations as it was sold to me as a game that is similar to Portal. I don't even think it's necessarily a bad game, it just wasn't for me. There wasn't much in the way of plot or world building and the puzzles got repetitive pretty quickly. There was a nifty twist but it wasn't given enough build up so it still fell a bit flat. There were also some integral puzzle elements that were buggy which made the puzzles more frustrating than intended. All in all not a terrible game but comparing it to Portal makes expectations too high for what is an okay game. If you're expecting Portal 3 prepare to be disappointed.

Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2023
Could be better.

Graphics are great, OST and voice acting are pretty good. The time rewind mechanic is very interesting, but the puzzles are too easy (ignore steam played time, I've actually completed all 15 stages). I had more fun with harder puzzles in other games such as The Spectrum Retreat, Relicta, etc. Also, the robots are obnoxious and unnecessary, the game would be better off without them; in escape sequences they're alright, but in lockdown/regular puzzle stages they're just annoying.

Finally, the plot concept is interesting, but the delivery falls flat in terms of atmosphere/environmental storytelling. Endless scribbles on walls and whiteboards with dumbed-down sentences like "Rewind earth??", or "Solve puzzles"... like, no ♥♥♥♥. It's like visiting a game studio and seeing a whiteboard with "Make game??". Also, the emails are pretty uninteresting too.

10.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2023
It's not a great game, but not a bad game either. The polish is there, but the potential in the rewinding is lost on confined puzzle mechanics where random destruction and physics based would have been far more interesting. The reuse of assets wears down the environment until it all blurs together and the story, like the mechanics, is not fully realized and instead feels shallow and unearned.

But, bottom line, if you like puzzle games it's worth a play through.
 
Tsul
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 décembre 2023
Short version:
Way too easy, WAY too tedious, ending just meh.

Longer version:
Of my playthrough I spent roughly 15% of the time figuring out the solution, 60% executing the solution and about 25% moving between the puzzle areas.

This time-split is, because the puzzles are mindnumbingly easy. Most of the time the solution is completely obvious once you moved through the puzzle area and have seen all elements. Actually doing the puzzle however takes a really annoying amount of time. Since a lot of the puzzle is about setting the elements on a path and then correctly rewinding them to be on the correct buttons, etc. when you need them to, you spent half the time in the puzzles just carrying stuff around to have the paths set up.
Now it might seem like that's just normal for a puzzle game "carry the elements to where you need them", it is just tedious in this game, because you essentially have to always carry everything twice. Once to set up the rewind path and once with the actual rewind itself. This is just made even worse by the fact that the character is moving about as fast as a snail (assuming the snail has a slow day).
Then we get to the time between puzzles. These just feel way to boring, because again the character is just crawling.
The devs also tried to set up some "tense" moments where you have to flee and stuff is collapsing around you. These just completely fall flat, because imho not a single bit of tension can actually build up if you are just moving like you are taking a leisurely walk in the park.

I pushed myself to still play to the end in hopes that the story is worth it (up 'til the end it does seem interesting enough) and maybe the puzzle would get interesting. Then the in-game companion announced "these upcoming puzzles are rated EXTREMELY DIFFICULT" and I rejoiced... only to be greeted by the same easy to solve, annoying to execute baby puzzles as before, they do get minimally more challenging, but if you have played almost literally any other puzzle game before, they will not stop you for long.
And as for the story... I don't want to spoil anything, but if the story is what interests you: Don't bother! The ending is one of the worst endings I've seen in a while.

All in all: Don't waste your time and money, there are notably better puzzle games out there.
 
Muramoth
324 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
36.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 novembre 2023
Super logicka hra, kde se skvele zabavite.
Hrajete za Ariu, ktera se probudi na mesici na testovaci zakladne. Nikdo tu neni a jen postupne sledujete jak vybuchuje planeta Zeme. Splnenim vsech mistnosti dobijete stroj, ktery zemi dokaze vratit v case a zachranit ji.
Kapitol je 15 po nejakych 5 mapach a v kazdem levelu prichazi nejaka novinka.
K reseni levelu pouzivate zbran, ktera dokaze vracet cas predmetum se kterymi se pohybovalo, takze hadanky resite od konce. Mimo to dokaze opravovat i rozpadajici se centrum.
Uroven obtiznosti zustava podobna, takze nehrozi vyraznejsi zaseknuti. Vetsinou akorat potom vice kombinujete to co uz umite. Je tu par levelu, kde se bojuje s neprateli.
Po dohrani je tu editor a uzivatelske levely.
Lze hledat terminaly se zpravama (dost jich je schovanych mimo hlavni cestu).
Pro fanousky portalu a logickych her jasna volba.
 
MichalosxCZ

Portal puzzle style + Time manipulation
 
neo
158 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2023
This is an easy game to recommend. I like the FPS puzzle genre and played probably most of them that were worth something. As the genre goes, this one is pretty good.

The game is about 6 hours long (though I got stuck on one puzzle for maybe 20 minutes).

Overall the story is there - it's kind of the same story as always. Whatever. Music is competent, sounds are memorable.

The structure is also the usual: do room puzzle, quips happen, you are in the next room, every now and then plot moves a bit, rinse and repeat. I don't mind the formula though, I am here for the puzzles.

The little problem I have with this game is that even if you figure out the solution step by step it still takes time to actually execute it. Luckily some care was taken to make sure you don't miss your jumps and there is quite a lot of leeway. It would be perfect if I could rewind the game a bit as well so I would not have to replay levels when I accidentally fall somewhere I did not want to. Also, the combat seemed unnecessary.

The puzzles themselves are a bit easy - and I say that after I have played a ton of similar games so I am probably pretty biased. For a newcomer to the genre I think the difficulty is pretty all right. It won't make you frustrated by being too hard. The game is very competently signposted so you don't get lost or lose track of what you were doing.

Ultimately I feel like there is a lot more potential - there are plenty of mechanics in the game so I would love to see a DLC that would showcase some harder levels. Perhaps the level editor will fill the steam workshop with interesting content.

 
euqil
974 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 avril 2023
스팀덱으로만 플래이.
팬 부분 제외 55~60 프레임 유지. 솔직히 글을 읽기 힘든 부분도 가만히 서 있으면 읽을 수 있음.

짧은 요약:
포탈2를 따라하고 싶었구나? 그치만 배낄려면 제대로 배꼈어야지. 이게 뭐니?


스토리:
전반적인 떡밥은 게임 밖 정보나 옵션, 텍스트 로그 없이 게임 플래이로 회수되어야 한다고 생각합니다. 근데 이 게임은 왜 시설이 그 꼴이 났는지, 그 그림자 사람은 어떻게 우리의 눈에 보이게 되는건지, E라는 로봇은 어떻게 혼자서 고장나지 않았는지, 플래이어가 무한의 굴레를 벗어날 수 있었는지에 대해 어떠한 답을 해 주지 않습니다. 그냥 포탈에 매우 심취해서 적당히 비슷한 세계관을 만들어 보자 하고 끝낸 느낌입니다. 떡밥 회수가 안되니 플래이 내내 불만 가득했습니다.

소리:
지하철 출퇴근 하며 무선 이어폰으로 들었던 지라 깊게 듣진 못했습니다. 하지만 확실한거로 플래이어가 사망할 때 내는 신음 소리는 '그래, 알아서 잘 해 봐라' 수준의 한숨이였습니다. '내가 죽었다' 라는 느낌이 부족하니 그냥 웃음만 나오더군요.

디자인:
중간정도 만들다 아이디어가 고갈된건가요? 포탈을 배끼다 시피한 도구들에 특징 없는 활용법... 맙소사... '강'이 퍼즐 요소라고? 심지어 그건 중간에 몇번 나오고 다시는 안나옵니다. '큰 큐브'는 이 큐브 부분의 아이디어가 완전히 고갈되어 퍼즐의 다양성도 급격히 사라집니다. 그리고 큐브가 전환되는 부분이 있으면 그 전환되는 효과라도 넣어주지, 그냥 바뀝니다. 게임 개발의 초보적인 부분을 그렇게 보이다뇨... :/
각 에셋들의 배치가 너무 일관성 없습니다. 오직 퍼즐들을 통해서만 접근 가능한 로비, 사무실이라던지, 퍼즐 한가운데에 있는 사무 데스크라던지... 그 자리로 배정받은 직원은 대체 무슨 죄일지...
그냥 준비된 퍼즐을 통해 엔트로피를 채워야 한다기 보다 무너져가는 시설을 해쳐나가는 것 자체가 퍼즐이였다면 더 낫지 않았을까 싶습니다.

퍼즐:
퍼즐들의 전반적인 난이도는 중하 입니다. 포탈2 협동 미술치료 보다는 쉬운 난이도를 가지고 있으니 천천히 생각해 보면 답이 나옵니다. 하지만 포탈2 대비 퍼즐 자체의 공간 낭비가 좀 심합니다. 오브젝트당 과거로 갈 수 있는 시간은 40초 정도지만 억지로 그 40초를 넘기게 만들려고 공간을 크게 만들어 버렸습니다.(근데 퍼즐들이 그 40초를 넘기는 경우는 별로 없습니다.) 차라리 되감기 시간을 30초 정도로 줄였다면 더 알찬 퍼즐이 되지 않았을까 싶더군요.
쉬운 퍼즐에 첨언을 하자면... 퍼즐이 다 비슷비슷 합니다. 비유하자면 처음 퍼즐은 오른쪽으로 몸을 틀었다면 다음 퍼즐은 왼쪽 오른쪽으로 틀어야 한다는 정도? 그건 그냥 같은거죠. :/
개발자들이 게임만 만들고 QA 쪽으로는 약간 신경을 덜 쓴 듯 합니다. 반 정도의 퍼즐은 우회가 가능합니다. 조금만 큐브를 틀어서 맵 밖으로 갔다가 외부 장식 프롭들을 이용해서 출구로 바로 넘어갈 수도 있고, 점프를 조금만 더 세밀하게 해서 말도안되는 위치에 큐브를 올려 퍼즐을 쉽게 풀 수 있습니다. 분명히 그렇게 풀리면 안되는 건데도 말이죠.

플래이는 뭐 괜찮습니다. 그치만 다른 퍼즐 플래이어에게 추천할만한 수준은 아닌것 같습니다.
 
James Karet

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2022
Ok, people, listen up. The comparisons to Portal are short-sighted and unfounded. TEC takes one puzzle mechanic from The Talos Principle and stretches it out into an entire game. It also uses the T.M.D. (Time Manipulation Device) from Singularity, another fantastic game. I have no complaints about these elements being borrowed from other games. I just think it's silly that every time a good first person puzzle game comes out, it is compared to Portal. Portal is great, but at least 15 incredible first person puzzle games have been released since then. TEC is a fantastic game. The science fiction portions are really exceptional. I love what it's about. The visuals are quite nice, though it does sometimes look like the color orange was all they had access to. Overall, a fantastic game.

Update at 5.2 hours: I'm on chapter 8/15 and this is shaping up to be my GOTY.

Update: Just finished chapter 12 and honestly, as amazing as this game is, I kind of think it goes on too long. I still have 3 more chapters and it keeps introducing new puzzle mechanics. It just introduced one and then barely used it and now it's back to puzzles that are honestly less complex than the ones I was doing in chapter 3. I don't understand. It was a 10/10, but now it just keeps going and going.

Final update: The game's only flaw is that it's...too long. I was fully satisfied after about chapter 12 but then it keeps going for 3 more chapters. Mechanics like the fan are introduced and then barely used, then completely left out of the final areas. It's a great game but it could have used some editing down. Comparisons to Portal are silly. Every science fiction first person puzzle game is like this. Just because you played Portal doesn't mean you have to reference it every time you play a first person puzzle game. TEC takes the T.M.D. (Time Manipulation Device) from Singularity and uses it to stretch the record/rewind mechanic from The Talos Principle and turns it into a full game with a great story. See how I did that? I described it more accurately without saying Portal. I also think the difficulty peaks mid-way and then the game gets easier. Great game, though. I recommend it.
 
Animal Mother
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
7.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 novembre 2022
I really like this game. FPP (First Person Puzzlers) have been having a difficult time finding their way recently with many titles feeling as though once all the elements of the puzzle are in play the solution is obvious. This is not the case in *The Entropy Centre*, and that may be the most ringing endorsement I can give.

The puzzles are varied, and at times I did feel like I came up with a unique solution, or performed a cool jump to save my bacon from having to redo the whole puzzle. This game is unlike many in the genre in many ways, and I personally would place it close to Portal 2 in quality, for me definitely above other indies such as QUBE(1,2,3) or RE:think (not to say those games are bad, but to give my subjective analysis). The dialogue and characters on display are also a standout in the genre, this is an element I personally think is best experienced by yourself, but for me the conversations between characters were never grating or awful. There is a bit of jank, especially with the damage system, or more awkward things like moving extremely large distances quickly. Sometimes you die and it's the game's fault, but it didn't happen too often. There is something to be said in that oftentimes the User Experience of FPP games is tied up in how quickly you can perform the puzzle solution once you've figured it out. IMO this game excels in this function, as it's definitely possible to speedrun these levels very quickly, with the game even giving you a timer at the end of each level telling you how long you took to finish the puzzle.

There are some minor gripes I have with the game, 1. If you collect a readable log, then die in a puzzle, the game doesn't keep track of the log file being read, there is an achivement tied to this that I believe I should have gotten, but because of this condition I will have to replay the game at some point if I want that sweet 100% completion. 2. It would be nice if you could mute the dialogue when you're replaying puzzles (given the theme of the game, it would almost be fitting for the game to pick from a pool of voicelines for each puzzle) while the writing is good, no writing survives ~5 listens when you're focusing on a puzzle solution.

Overall, If you are a FPP fan I would highly recommend you check this game out. IMO Standout title in this genre.
 
Tok

ShinyRai
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 novembre 2022
The Entropy Centre is a great first person puzzle game that involves spacial and temporal awareness, lateral thinking, and a lot of logic. It is right there on the sweet spot of games I like most, such as Portal 2, The Talos Principle, QUBE 2, etc. But ultimately, it lacked some polish and playtesting that would have placed it in the same category as those. This review might contain some small spoilers, but anything significant will be spoiler-tagged.

Gameplay: The gameplay is fluid and easy to get, and the controls are intuitive, and everything runs smoothly. I did miss a crouch feature, but that's mainly from me being used to it. The jump specifically felt rather short (I can't get on top of regular cubes, for example), but that might've been due to puzzle limitations. One thing that severely bothered me, however, was how often I'd get stuck on weird geometry, or how some boxes would clip through platforms, etc. Some more intensive work on playtesting would've been nice on that front, especially in areas where I could get physically stuck, or have a difficult time moving around in. I have also managed to very trivially access some areas the game clearly didn't want me getting close to, such as dead end corridors and little crevices in natural landscape. One other thing that became apparent as the game progressed was how often the game would use broken catwalks for navigation, to the point where any time the room would shake, I'd immediately go scavenge-hunting for the next catwalk to rewind.

Visuals: On the visuals side of the game, everything looked spectacular! Given the small team and budget, the game looks very polished and well thought out, with high quality assets and interesting level geometry and decoration. Some assets could have used some subtle texture variation, just so they wouldn't look so obviously copy-pasted (like all the lockers in the game being labeled "C4"). The early areas of the game look very believable and lived in, but as you progress through the campaign, you start to see more places where the visuals and level design were cut short. Near the end of the game, there were several, easily accessible offices (so not those far away ones you can barely see) that were completely empty, just a box with lights on the ceiling. There were also bizarre choices for prop placements at times, such as having those bulky tube monitors with logs sitting on top of a very modern flatscreen control panel (with a perfectly good office desk nearby where it could've been). Some puzzles had very, very extreme lighting and fog, to the point where everything looked white and opaque and difficult to comprehend and navigate.

Puzzles: The puzzles were amazing! Many of them had me thinking and planning for several minutes at a time, and the puzzle elements were very inventive! I especially like the departure from Portal 2 in that puzzle elements are primarily attached to puzzles, which meshes really well with the game's mechanic. Unlike in Portal 2, where you bend space to access fixed elements, in here you bend time to access mobile elements. Brilliant! Most of the puzzles were also very logical and easy to execute. As a puzzle designer and level designer myself, however, the main issue I had was readability. The early puzzles were fine in that regard, but late puzzles had the exit tucked away in hidden corners, had (mild spoiler for a late puzzle element)launch pads completely invisible in the equally grayscale floor surrounded by foliage, and later yet puzzles completely forewent having tracks for moving platforms to ride on (they would just float from point A to point B, clipping through anything in the path). Another major gripe for me was the time limit in the gun's time recording ability. A lot of puzzles - especially the late ones - involved a lot of steps, and having only 38.1 seconds at our disposal meant that, in some puzzles, I had to be extremely efficient with how I handled objects. I'd reset them at the start of their path, then make the most straightforward and linear moves towards their next destination, and would rewind them to correct for any idling in-between. And even then, in one particular puzzle, I had to solve it all over again twice because, despite all the optimization in timing, I still lost time!

Difficulty: This is where I'll probably disagree with most players. I'm already pretty accustomed to first person puzzle games, so the game was probably overall significantly easier for me than it was for most players. Especially up to chapter 6, I genuinely felt like I was solving the same puzzle over and over, with some very small variations. Once you inherently understand the way the time mechanic works, you can easily figure out those puzzles by playing them in reverse in your head. And since most of them are just about the order of execution, then the challenge became less about finding the catch and more about memorizing the actions you gotta do. I wish there were more elements like (mild spoiler for a late puzzle element)the folding cube, which is immune to time reversal in where it is in space. The late late puzzles, especially past chapter 10, significantly improved the challenge of the puzzles, and some of them really had me stumped for a while, but still, some of them just felt like "advanced" versions of the early puzzles, in that it was easy to solve but difficult to execute. I was also not very fond of the (mild story spoiler for late game)robot combat sections, as I felt like they completely detracted from puzzle solving and didn't fit the gameplay style at all.

Storytelling: I will be frank, the story isn't the strong suit of this game. It's an interesting premise, and has some compelling characters, but it overall wasn't too inventive or captivating. There wasn't much of a deeper meaning, or theme to explore, outside of the superficial ramifications of the setting itself. But, in all honesty, that didn't matter too much to me, since the story didn't really seem to be intended to be the main focus, but rather served as a platform to keep the game going and to justify the puzzles. I encountered several seeming loopholes and contradictions in the narrative - but I guess that's what happens when time travel shenanigans are involved - and at times it felt like the game tried to overexplain some details to its detriment (for example, when one email chain tried to explain déjà-vus with technobabble, when it could've given it an air of mystery and given more room for the player's imagination to fill in the blanks). But by far, the thing that bothered me the most was the way that reading emails and logs didn't really mean anything in the game. It just served as a "collectible" of sort, and while it did provide some funny jokes and gags, the exposition it gave didn't really seem to influence the gameplay. For example, prior to getting the entropy gun, I read an email that described it (even explaining what the "PEA" acronym meant). But when I did get the gun, my player character still questioned it like I hadn't literally just read about it less than a minute prior. I also wished that more of the story was told via audio logs, paper logs or just environmental storytelling. I don't want to just read about The Entropy Centre, show me more about it! Immerse me in the story!

In summary, my rating for this game would be a 7.5/10. Solid puzzle game, really enjoyable for the most part, and excellent overall production quality! Could have used some more playtesting and feedback. I would really like to be able to make puzzles for it myself, there is a lot of untapped potential here! I still recommend this game because, despite the nitpicks and issues, it's still a very enjoyable, very fun puzzling experience. If you can, buy it on a sale. Lengthier review: https://steamcommunity.com/app/1730590/discussions/0/3551679689864285761/
 
HugoBDesigner

Portal Not Portal

Yes, it’s essentially Portal but with time manipulation instead of dimensional holes. But it’s also a great game on its own, particularly if you’re good at puzzles.

See the full video review here:
Vidéo YouTube™: The Entropy Centre review: review Centre Entropy The. Think in reverse with a gun that rewinds time!

A review of Stubby Games' new time bending adventure puzzle game: The Entropy Centre Once upon a time I worked in video games and helped make some titles you've probably never played: ➡ Percy Jackson...

 
Zen Button Masher

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Ben
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
4.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2023
Would I recommend this? Well yeeess... kinda. I mean, it's a decent game. VERY thinly veiled clone of the Portal games - enough so that one would think the lawyers must be getting excited and breathless, but the one unique aspect here is, sadly, also literally the only mechanic - you can (for a limited duration, and on a limited and not-very-logical selection of objects) rewind time. That's pretty much it. OK, there's a couple of other interactive items lifted straight from Portal, too, but a lot less variety than you'll find there. Still, if you liked Portal, you'll probably like this. Voice acting and story are a bit trite and silly, but that's 95% of games, so no news there, and that's not what you're playing this for anyway, right? The puzzles are not bad; not too hard, mostly not too easy, though a few are of the annoying "easy to figure out, hard to implement" variety thanks to slightly jittery tracking of motion in the rewind, or the frustratingly fiddly placement of jumping plates. But the very limited set of mechanics means that they also get repetitive pretty quickly. So, decent game built around the time-rewind mechanic, but I found myself getting bored with it by the fourth level of puzzles, and nothing much changes after that either. If you want a much more engaging set of puzzles, try The Talos Principle (which also has a time-rewind mechanic, but a LOT more besides) or The Witness - now there is another game with just the one simple mechanic, but which manages to remain challenging, interesting and compelling right the way through. So I'd recommend this somewhat on its own merits, but I more strongly recommend you spend your coin on other two instead!
 
copelahe

"All your labor was in vain" is a TRASHY way to end a game and a big insult to your players.

535 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2023
攥写评测游戏时长大概在3小时左右（中间发了一个小时呆所以游戏时间有偏差）。

游戏有Portal的味道了，四处可见的风格致敬——无论是从美工上还是游戏元素上。这款游戏主打的是和给定“友情”方块（我串戏了）互动，然后利用回溯机制进行人物移动和关卡切换。游戏设计上面比较精巧，给的谜题也大多非常自洽，能够在合理的思考时间内进行。

但整个游戏给我的感觉是，我并不享受这个过程。
- 15个大关卡，每到一个新地方就给我一种新的可以互动的物体，给我一种新的机制真的会让我快乐吗？不，我只觉得记忆成本线性增加了。
- 游戏游玩体验中我感觉和Portal遇到的同样问题就是地图其实蛮大的，需要走走走走好远才能完成自己的一个动作。物理引擎有些微妙的时候我从高处跳下的落点不可知，导致了反反复复为了一个已知的解决方案要散上好久的步。
- 游戏里的战斗过程感觉可有可无。无论是抱起投掷还是回溯炸掉机器人，作为解密的一部分感觉非常多余。主人公复活以后机器人也会复活，但凡我选的是压力模式挨一下就死、它复活我是无所谓的；可是没有难度选择让我多此一举等待十几秒钟的意义何在？
- 游戏保存机制。我基本上都是在大关卡结束以后退出游戏的，只有在一次要操控电梯的章节中途退出过。后果就是一段游戏进度直接蒸发，我还要回顾一下女主和机器人的对话并且不能跳过。整个过程我感觉比起游玩，更像是走一个电影过场。

当然游戏可取之处也有很多：
- 画风画面能看出来还是非常用心的。
- 游戏关卡设计来说我觉得自洽就已经能完成这一类型游戏的合格分数了，更何况游戏形式来说回溯确实也算是比较新颖的（模拟人生那种不算）。
- 游戏体量和价钱比起来性价比已经算是不错的了。

总之来说并非是一个十恶不赦的感觉，但自己玩下来感觉有点累，可能在观望一小段时间就可能弃掉了。
 
RICX09-cXII
346 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2023
I'm at a loss for words.

To think I had this game collecting dust in my library for 10 months is unbelievable now. I'll start with the gameplay:

The whole game centers around time, so you need to think fourth dimensionally. It does an amazing job at towing the line between a satisfying challenge and mind-numbing difficulty.

The Story, however, is where the game really has its time to shine. The dynamic between Aria and Astra, her time gun, is always a joy to listen to, especially helping lighten the tone near the end of the game. I won't tell you much but I will say that every aspect of the story is well crafted and nothing seems to come out of left field, especially when you read the documents you can find on your journey.

All in all, this is a solid recommendation for me. Please give this game a shot if you're on the fence and I promise it won't let you down.

If you enjoyed any of the above mentioned games you'll enjoy this one.

Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2023
The Entropy Centre: The Best, Believe Me!

Let me tell you folks, The Entropy Centre is tremendous. A game like you've never seen before, just tremendous. They say it's like that Portal thing, but let me tell you, it's even better. People are talking about it, believe me. I know games, I've played them all, and let me tell you, this one's a winner.

You've got these puzzles, folks, these puzzles that are out of this world. They're saying it's about time and space, and let me tell you, I know all about time and space. These puzzles, they're smart, they're challenging, but you'll solve them, you will. And when you solve them, you'll feel like a winner, just like me.

Now, I hear they've got this AI, Astra they call her. She's a talker, let me tell you. Reminds me of myself, always speaking my mind. But she's funny, too. I like funny, and I like winning. So, you've got these puzzles and you've got this AI, what's not to like? Nothing, folks, nothing.

And the story, oh boy, the story is something else. World-saving, time-traveling, it's got it all. I've been there, I've done deals, and I know a good story when I see one. The Entropy Centre's got a story that'll make your head spin, and I promise you, it's worth it.

Now, some people are saying it's like Portal, and you know what I say? I say, if you're gonna be influenced, be influenced by the best. I've influenced a lot of people, believe me, and this game, it's influenced by greatness. It's got that Portal vibe, but it's got its own thing going on, too. Originality, folks, that's what I'm all about.

So, if you're looking for a game that's gonna challenge you, entertain you, and make you feel like a winner, then The Entropy Centre is the game for you. I've played it, I've seen it, and let me tell you, it's a winner. Get out there, grab it, and make gaming great again!
 
Bubble Tea Bunny
1,538 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2023
The Entropy Centre is a charming and funny game. While it at times reminds me of Portal, it definitely brings its own style of humor to the table.

The puzzles stay rather simple for a while, and at first that worried me, but now I realize that the purpose of those simple levels is to acclimatize the player to the rather counter-intuitive approach to puzzle solving that the Entropy Centre asks of you. Fear not, the Entropy Centre *does* get more difficult later on, but it never becomes unapproachable. Never did I encounter a puzzle that made me confused as to where to even start. Solving the more challenging puzzles is very satisfying, and several mechanics are introduced throughout to spice things up.

In terms of story, without spoilers, the Entropy Centre is intriguing and mind-bending at the best of times, and a bit silly at the worst. It's lowest points are never very low, and it's highest points had me shouting to my friend (who I was in a discord call with at the time). Rest assured, the ending of the Entropy Centre is well worth the journey (and its fun and charming writing style will keep you entertained along the way).

There's only two real characters in the Entropy Centre, but they're both handled quite well. While the character you play as is a little shallow and generic feeling at first, she does get fleshed out later on. Your companion, meanwhile, starts off a little quirky and cold feeling, but she will quickly draw you in and make you invested in her.

If you do decide to play the game, I encourage you to search out the optional readables. Some of them are hidden behind optional challenges, which can be quite fun to solve on their own, but the readables really add to the mystery and buildup of the story, and can make some revelations even more impactful. You don't need to exhaustively find every single one, but even just a few could make the whole experience stronger.
 
LonesomeTomb773
310 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 avril 2023
Decent voice acting and the world story is quite good. Big thing to remember about this game is the puzzles don't really scale up till like around level 6. The game keeps you engaged with plot elements till then however.

Still, kind of wish they introduced more elements to the time reversal gimmick. First few levels is basically move box over something, then movie it back, then over again, jump on platform and reset time. It really doesn't do a change up till around 5-6 when you have to worry about the environment. Kind of wish there was some sort of hard mode you can start in.

That said, unlike Portal or Portal 2, you feel like there are stakes and not like your walking in someone else's story. You even hessitate to kill the cute cleaning robots.

Non recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2023
On sent une grande inspiration des jeux Portal, c'est exactement ce qui m'a attiré vers le jeu de base, malheureusement je trouve que la trame scénaristique n'est pas très intéressante. A certains moment elle saura piquer votre curiosité mais sans plus, contrairement à portal ou le scénario était vraiment présent et une partie importante du jeu.

The Entropy center est très recentré sur les puzzles, un peu trop a mon gout, on ne fait qu'enchainer des puzzles avec l'excuses ' ca permet de générer de l'entropie qui est nécessaire ' mais c'est tout, ils ne servent pas de but scénaristique. C'est vraiment ça qui m'a déçu sur ce jeu, on fait des puzzles pour faire des puzzles et c'est tout.

Si vous aimez les puzzles bien compliqués vous allez adorer.
Si vous cherchez un puzzle game avec une bonne trame scénaristique, passez votre chemin.

Recommandé
12.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2023
I enjoyed this! I'm frequently annoyed by games with these kinds of mechanics, but this one is unique and actually tells a (pretty interesting!) story, so it was able to keep my attention. The gameplay works, the plot works, the environment works... overall, the game works!

My largest complaint is just that the game seems to leave SO MUCH POTENTIAL on the table. It doesn't really have any secret areas or particularly off-the-path areas, and it feels like there's lots of opportunities for additional lore and plot that just... weren't taken. I think another six months of tightening up the script and filling some of those opportunities would have taken this game from "good" to "great". Still, it's pretty good!
 
Alinsa
2,137 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2022
推薦給所有解迷遊戲之友

氣氛、美術等令人一看就會不自覺拿去和portal來比較(這當然是優點)
故事亦充分發揮出科幻解迷作品的優勢；本作中有輕鬆搞怪的橋段，有刺激的拯救世界的元素，但也有動人的"同伴"時刻
故事結尾採用了高概念科幻作品常有的半開放結局，為本作留下不少未解的困窘和結玩家幻想的餘韻。個人能理解這種結局的迷人之處，但對本人喜好而言，在經歷了前面探索真相和自我的劇情後主角在沒有太多解釋的情況下沒有反抗就安然接受了命定的結局這點實在不太令我滿足。

作為解迷遊戲的缺黠是早期關卡關卡設計很遜色。解答明顯，幾乎就是要看出關向出口的路線，觀察路線之間的障礙物，根據對應的障礙物構想動作順序，然後把可以互動的箱子照動作順序反過來搬一次後用逆熵槍照一照就到出口了；那一部分關卡的流程常常相當直觀，不用一分鐘就可以解出來。迷題本身完全不是差，能直觀看出解答這一點也側面反映出製作團隊對於視覺提示元素的把握，對於不是解迷遊戲的愛好者而言可能根本就沒有缺點，但是個人就覺得非常缺乏那一種當解出迷題後令人不自禁地呼叫"a ha!"的驚喜設定。
要到中、後期、靠著加入的大量新互動解迷要素才把關卡設計難度到達理想的解迷遊戲水平；部分後期關卡設計也有很優秀的設計，靠者兩個以上的解迷要素結合常常出現非常有趣的迷題，但是如果這個關卡質素也可以在前期發揮就會更好。

似乎是那種要找過所有收集要素才可以了解故事全貌的遊戲，一部分劇情有關的資訊都要在收集要素裡讀到。好消失是這作只有一種類型的收集要素；壞消息是這作對收集要素不太友善，你不清楚一章節裡到底有多少收集要素可以尋找，也沒有在遊戲中或遊戲後重溫收集要素的功能。通關一次後我在70多篇文章中只讀了50多篇，但是不知道在什麼章節裡錯過哪一篇文章，實在沒有動力再玩一次達成全收集。

總體而言這個很充實滿足的8小時遊戲時間，對於這個價格的遊戲正價買下來一玩也未嘗不可。
 
Toxic_Cola
310 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

I want to start this off by saying if ANYONE insults E I will get vengeance! This game gave such a good story, lovable characters, and well thought out puzzles. It's honestly a masterpiece that I dare say is of Portal quality for puzzle games.

Pros:
- Well made and great variety of puzzles
- The first time I have ever loved my gun in a game as much as this
- Managed to make a form of combat without it feeling combat focused.

♥♥♥♥:
- I did run into one glitch while playing that involved me having to reset to the last checkpoint
- Some of the puzzles can be cheesed if you are stubborn enough (Or too oblivious to see the obvious answer)
- Their is great lore found in the game via documents but gets kinda tedious to follow reading.

I love love loved this game. It gave me such good happy vibes even when it made me feel like I wasn't the smartest cookie. I really hope that this game picks up momentum because I think in 5 years we will be looking back at it as an absolute masterpiece of the 2020s. I give it 9/10 robots with sticky notes on their heads.

12.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 janvier 2023
the entropy center clearly is prepared to be compared to the portal series, but i don't think it was intended to, and i think that says a lot on its own. it is a very good first person puzzle platformer — each puzzle was interesting and fun to solve, and despite a few issues (conveyor belts my beloathed) it is very well polished.

the mechanics are satisfying to use, and still manage to be shaken up regularly without ruining the understanding. each new puzzle element added something to the puzzle, and they never overstayed their welcome.

the writing and voice acting is charming, and the interactions between the two main characters really has a palpable sense of progression as you move through the game. as for the plot... major spoilers ahead.

the plot has you stuck in a time loop. i don't think this is inherently a bad thing, and for what it's worth, it was foreshadowed quite nicely. however, the way that it's done, with astra never seeming to have actually understood, feels... off. every aspect of the ending is deserved, it's even explicit that astra's outlook is to never give up no matter what. but the messages she left for herself seem to be imploring her to think of another option.

i was expecting a reboot ending, similar to oneshot. you complete the game, it starts over, but this time you get the actual ending, instead of just a lead into the next playthrough. instead it simply ended, and i was left feeling like i had played half of a game.

tl;dr, it is a very good puzzle game, but the plot is only strong up until the ending. play it for the mechanics, the level design, the gorgeous imagery, the characterizations, and a lot of good jokes, but don't expect a strong resolution.
 
GammaBeta
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2023
Very similar to Portal except no portals! Instead you get a time gun that can turn back time for objects you aim it at. It's all a question of thinking backwards. Starts off very easy and ends up a little more taxing. It's all pretty easy, and there are unintended solutions.
There are one or two puzzles where you are chased, so you have limited time, and others where there are enemies in the same puzzle so it's difficult to concentrate! Mostly, though, there is no time limit to complete each puzzle.
All together a well executed game but what really stands out is the story, not the puzzles.
If you liked Portal and want more, then this is for you!
 
Pirate☠️Pocah

0
Non recommandé
18.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 juillet 2023
This game made me depressed – and not for the reason you think

This rant contains spoilers so proceed with caution. It'll also heavily mention entropy and other physical concepts but I'll try to keep timey wimey stuff as simple as possible.

Story

So the main character is an employee of the Entropy Center where people solve puzzles to generate “entropy energy” to send Earth back in time before major catastrophes and prevent them from ever happening. Then they get their memories erased to solve the same puzzles again to generate more entropy for the Centre since more energy is required for longer jumps to fix a more screwed-up timeline . After some time Aria realizes that Earth has been reset countless times but it always ends up destroyed. She is stuck in a loop where humanity keeps destroying itself no matter how much entropy she keeps on generating obsessively to try and save it. She is devastated but decides to continue solving those damn puzzles.

Aria is one of the good guys, right? Heroic and restless, she easily makes friends with her entropy gun and a cute robot (which you can pet!) and all she ever does is try her best to save humanity no matter what it takes. Man, Aria is the best… Right?

Wrong.

Science

According to the 2nd law of thermodynamics, entropy is the reason why time can only move forward. No matter what kind of work you do, some energy will be dissipated on generating heat, hence increasing entropy in the system. You can try and get that increase to a minimum but you can’t eradicate it completely. IRL you can’t get from a high-entropy state (future) to a low-entropy state (past) as entropy increase is inevitable, it just happens. That’s why one does not simply create an infinite engine, some energy will always be lost as that’s the nature of things around here.

If entropy grows and free energy of the Universe depletes each day, then there was a time when entropy was zero, and that’s what we call the Big Bang . There was some incredibly dense matter, really hot with almost infinite free energy. Then the Universe started expanding, stars and planets were born, life began to create even more entropy by spending free energy and doing work (you are here). But that’s the middle of the story that has to end someday. Everything has to end.

When free energy depletes completely (and that will happen because of the 2nd law), no work will be able to be done, matter will get so scattered across the Universe and so cold that nothing interesting will ever happen again. Scientists call this hypothetical event the heat death of the Universe or the Big Chill (the latter honestly sounds dope for an apocalyptic event).

All we ever do, from breathing to eating to dying to decaying, brings that event closer. It won’t happen for a really long time, so you can basically do whatever with your life since your input is miniscule compared to everything that ever happened. Unless you do massive amounts of work on a cosmic scale (like blowing up a supernova), all your life choices won’t really matter. Or you can send the Earth back in time 99999...99999 times , that’s also a fun way to bring the apocalypse closer!

Morals

You may ask, what’s so evil in increasing the Universe’s entropy when you get to prolong Earth’s lifespan? Humanity will be long gone when the Big Chill happens, so why shouldn’t we give them a little more time? And that’s where I really have a problem with the game. While we’re told by the devs that the root of our problems lies in our selfishness and the inability to protect our planet from our own harmful actions, the main character does exactly that: destroys the world for her own sake. We can’t be sure that intelligent life exists or that it will ever exist outside of Earth, but Aria keeps spending the non-renewable resource of free energy as she sees fit, taking the time away from other possible civilizations who might not get the chance to evolve as there’s not enough free energy to go around.

This rendition of the trolley problem would be much more valid if the Earth could actually be saved from the cataclysm after the game ended. Then it would be a Them v. Us problem, and Aria’s struggle would be so much more entrancing. But the game specifically tells us that humanity will always destroy itself sooner rather than later. You basically have these two tracks, the trolley can’t be diverted and will destroy the Earth anyway but you can send the second trolley to try and harm whatever is on the other track too. This is not just ignorant, this is pure cosmic evil with no purpose.

Nothing like a seemingly selfless protagonist turning into an obsessed destroyer of worlds without the game acknowledging that to invalidate your experience, am I right? It would be great if Aria could stop for a moment, really think about the consequences of her actions and still decide to go for it. That would show that she is really too far gone in her manic pursuit of salvation, not just running in a hamster wheel actively doing things worse. But we didn’t get that moment of clarity so the devs left us wondering whether she’s hopeful, insane or dumb, which makes it impossible to consider her a properly developed character.

Conclusion

I might be reaching too far. If you’re looking for 5-15 hours worth of adequately difficult puzzles in space with all the pretty particles and sparkles, you’ll probably like it. Just don’t expect any groundbreaking morals, the game is basically developed by one person after all. It’s one of those games where not searching for lore and focusing on the gameplay will result in a more enjoyable experience. The puzzles are tested pretty well, with a couple frustrating moments where I had to brute force the solution when “the right way” simply wasn’t working (looking at you, level 1002). The audio is great and the Portal references are everything, but unfortunately they aren’t enough to justify the depressing implications behind the story.

If you like exploring space and time loops, try Outer Wilds. Chances are you’ll get much more out of it for the same price.
 
strawberry shortcake

Recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 septembre 2023
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements in games.
Some gameplay spoilers ahead.

Description:
The Entropy Centre is a first person physics puzzle game, with some simple platforming gameplay in some chapters. The puzzles revolve around using objects and switches, while using your “gun” that can control the flow of time in specific objects and small structures.

I won’t spoil the story, so I’ll just say that I enjoyed it very much and found it very interesting and engaging. It has a very elaborate and well written world and time, with its specific lore and scientific (as in science fiction) explanations for the events taking place. The interactions between the main character and her partner are also entertaining, with some jokes and funny conversations between the two.

The graphics are very good (4K ultra settings), especially the environments and backgrounds, like when you look outside the window and see Earth, as well as the particle and light effects you see within the game. Only up close, some of the textures used seem to have a lower resolution, but it’s not very noticeable.
The OST helps set the tone of the game, with abstract and ominous futuristic sounds that you hear in the puzzle areas, but changes to a more exhilarating rhythm in some parts of the game. The voice narration is also very well done, for both the main character and the robotic companion, and, as mentioned, the conversations between them are interesting and fun to listen to.

The puzzles start very simple, mostly on the first levels and later in the first puzzle of the chapters where new objects are introduced, and there are a lot of them, but not all are used at the same time. Only later on, the puzzle start getting more complex, with a lot of different steps to do and objects to place, but you just need to remember to reverse the order of the steps and everything will fall into place when you reverse time. . It took me some time, but I managed to solve all the puzzles on my own without any help.

Unfortunately, there are some bugs regarding the achievements, I got one on chapter 7 and a friend got another on chapter 1. The chapters were concluded but the achievement didn’t pop… it might be related to the connection between Steam and the same itself, maybe not saving on the cloud might prevent this.


Achievements:
How many: 27 Achievements.
How much time: Around 10 hours, without any help.
Game difficulty: Easy, it might take time and a few tries but most players will be able to solve most puzzles without help, just look well at your surroundings.
Achievements’ Difficulty: Easy, but a bit time consuming without a guide for the collectibles: most are easy to spot but a few are very well hidden. Most of the other achievements are unmissable and only a few others require doing something special in specific locations that can be revisited after you finish the game.


Overall opinion:
The Entropy Centre is a physics puzzle game with very good ambience and fun and accessible puzzle solving. The world, story and the characters are also well written and interesting and you’ll be eager to find out how it will all end.


Join and follow my group Ribbon Hunters for more suggestions and reviews of easy indie games to get all the achievements.

Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2023
Fantastic puzzle game that is somewhat reminiscent of the portal games. It has some similar mechanics, but requires a lot of backwards thinking.

The introduction of new mechanics as you progress was pretty well done. Most of the puzzles are relatively easy once you grasp how the rewinding mechanics work. An occasional level would throw me off for a while, and I quite liked that balance.

I loved the concept of the story and thought it was very well put together. The voice lines were fantastic and gave me many laughs, massive props to scriptwriters/voice actors there.
If I wanted to be picky, there were times where you'd cut from one section to the next (such as through an elevator) and I'd notice things had moved/disappeared (such as a poster on the wall of the elevator missing) - Small things like that could help to be better immersed, but I was able to look past that as the world overall was built quite well, and I also loved some of the 'action' sequences where you had to think a bit quicker to avoid falling objects etc. I also enjoyed looking up at Earth as the story progressed to see how it changed, a great touch.

The achievements are generally okay, there are two that I'm not the biggest fan of as a bit of a completionist. I eventually got one done, but the final achievement involved reading all the computers (intel) throughout the game - While I enjoyed the concept and reading all of them to add to the story, the game doesn't appear to tell you which levels you have missed intel on, so I've put off replaying the whole game for that achievement for the time being (as I may still miss some anyway unless I follow a guide).

There is also a custom level editor which helps to keep interested in playing even more past the story. I haven't tried this much myself yet, but it's always a welcome addition.

I'd highly recommend this to fans of portal-like games who are looking for something a little different, but with a similar atmosphere - And be ready to have a bit of a laugh at some of the voice lines too.

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Я плачу. Концовка- настоящий тлен, Дед инсайды курят в сторонке от таких обстоятельств. Игра представляет из себя огромный парадокс, временная петля Мебиуса так сказать. Стилистически похожа на портал, да и автор сам вдохновлен серией игр, любителей Aperture здеся ждут. Задачки- офигенные, если есть мозг, то можно пройти без ютубов (энтропийная энергия должна быть выработана в соло как никак) . Аналог ГЛАДОС, (Per Aspera Ad Astra) гораздо прекрасней оригинала и внешне и по характеру, вечно будет нас поддерживать во всём. Второстепенный персонаж- робот что будет ломать всё и вся, что на удивление нам на руку...
Земли нет? Да и х** с ней за за пару часов гигантским скотчем восстановлю. Печально что скорее всего всё что добавят в итоге в игру это мастерскую, так как игра грёбанная временная петля, но надежа умирает последней так сказатб...
10 из 10 потому что Земля сама собой не воскреснет
В диске игры что то говорили про длс, так что ждёмс

Recommandé
90.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
A game built with the very obvious influence of Portal for the feel and charm and a strong hint of Control for the environments. But this game honours both of those influences well, the environments and puzzles are uniquely styled and game play has its own unique twist with time that separates it from Portal even with many of the similarities in process.

The start is very good at introducing concepts and getting you acquainted with game. There are some puzzles that certainly add challenge but nothing had me stuck for an extended amount of time. ~12mins at most. Some puzzles have hints within them for puzzle piece placement that I think subtracts from the idea of a puzzle game and outside of introduction missions shouldn't exist to add to the difficulty. So while it could be harder its still an enjoyable time and for people who normally struggle with them its a very solvable game.

The character and story adds a bit of enjoyment to the situations and keeps you entertained along the way, maybe it would be an annoyance if you had to listen to the quips time and time again for getting stuck or failing but for the time I played it added some fun.

Recommandé
30.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2023
Portal without portals. Aside from the blatant ripoff of the appearance and puzzle elements, it is a (usually) fun and challenging puzzler. All the puzzles had fair solutions and do not require cheesing, but figuring out the solution can really test your logic skills. Being able to think in reverse is a must throughout, as is three dimensional thinking. Just like the game series this was inspired from, it feels so rewarding when you have that a-ha! moment and figure out a tricky part that was causing a mental block. But I had these gripes with the game:
Constant music gets annoying during puzzles.
It ripped off Portal too much unnecessarily with the appearance. They could have used their imagination more and made the Entropy Centre look much different than Aperture Science.
No indication of when checkpoint/save occurs.
Too much pointless repeated clutter. Seriously, you see the same cleaning cart in every room and puzzle area.
Jumping often sucks. Jump cubes require more precision than seems necessary.

But if you have the itch to play a good puzzle game and you also were a fan of the Portal games, then yes you will enjoy this game. As long as you can forgive how much it copies from those games.

Save Earth from a calamity by rewinding objects through time on a moonbase of puzzle rooms. A worthy successor to the Portal lineage. While it takes a few hours for the puzzles to reach adequate brain teasing levels, the stellar writing and set pieces pulled me through with a smile on my face. An incredible achievement for a solo dev!

ItbeEternal
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2023
The Entropy Center

Je suis venu pour les puzzles, je suis resté pour les puzzles et l’histoire. The Entropy Center est un jeu de puzzles développé par Daniel Stubbington et sorti en 2022. La campagne vous prendra un peu moins d'une dizaine d'heures.

De prime abord, The Entropy Center débute de façon très similaire à Portal : Dans un endroit en ruine et qui ne semble pas avoir été habité depuis des années. De la même façon que Portal, très vite vous trouverez votre compagnon de voyage : Le fusil à rembobinage temporel. Et à partir de là, même si certains éléments viendront rappeler Portal nous commencerons à diverger de celui-ci.

Comme on peut s’y attendre, la gymnastique intellectuelle la plus demandée est donc d’être capable de visualiser les mécanismes à l’envers et d’agir en conséquence. Comme dans tout jeu de puzzle, il est donc fortement recommandé de prendre le temps d’observer le scénario complet. La difficulté des puzzles va crescendo, de très simple à plutôt compliqué. Et à chaque nouvel élément de puzzle ajouté, on aura un niveau relativement simple qui permet au joueur ou à la joueuse de s’adapter aux nouvelles mécaniques disponibles.

Ni trop durs ni trop faciles, il faut tout de même avouer qu’il est relativement simple de trouver la solution instantanément pour la plupart des puzzles. Certaines personnes pourraient trouver que le jeu devient répétitif et que certains puzzles donnent une impression de déjà vu. Personnellement, j’ai commencé à trouver les puzzles répétitifs juste à la fin donc je serais enclin à dire que le jeu s’arrête pile au bon moment. De plus, je trouve que le développeur a bien exploité les diverses mécaniques liées au rembobinage dans le temps.

Je trouve que la trame narrative est sympathique et que la VA est relativement bonne et même qu’on s’y attache. La trame narrative peut sembler faire écho à certaines théories du complot ou histoires sci-fi rocambolesques. Pour celles et ceux vraiment tatillon sur les aspects narratifs, il faudra vous armer de tolérance car beaucoup d’éléments vous feront tiquer. Mais je ne peux pas vraiment détailler sans spoil et je pense que ce n’est pas bien grave d’y faire abstraction. Je ne suis généralement pas fan des consommables par ci par là à récupérer, mais j’avoue que je me suis surpris à aimer tomber sur des éléments de lore et à essayer d’en trouver plus pour mieux cerner la situation.

Je recommande The Entropy Center, je trouve que l’expérience est bien et que les puzzles sont recherchés. L’histoire est un plus. Et il y a aussi un éditeur de niveau!

Vous pouvez suivre la page curateur ici : Sacrez'Art.
 
Sacrezar
1,086 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
Гра цікава та навіть із сюжетом краще більшості сучасних фільмів, трохи із поганого це те що розробник вирішив частину сюжету зробити у вигляді записок, але згадайте той же Control. Самі головоломки я би їх оцінив на 8 із 10 якщо брати під кінець гри(складність поступово зростає), але сама складність в тому що це "нові механіки" до логіки яких потрібно пристосуватися. Інколи головоломка займає 2-3 хвилини, а інша може вас залишити в кімнаті на півгодини, але приємно коли рішення знайдено самостійно "інакше не буде енергії для вашого ентропійного девайсу". З графікою все ок UE4, трохи специфічний фільтр картинки, але він не шкодить, а надає потрібної атмосфери. Мабуть з часів Portal 2 нічого подібного з таким високим рівнем опрацювання не виходило, тому це як ковток свіжого повітря. Місій усього 15 + фінал. Гра на 2-3 дні пограти після роботи(В кожній частині не одна головоломка). Ігрового часу мабуть 7-9 годин(steam рахує час на паузі). Astra портальна пушка Rewind time gun – цікаве рішення компаньйона у грі, подібне буле в багатьох в тому ж Cyberpunk, буде в High on Life, але там це скажені та навіжені AI то тут все по іншому. Останнє із поганого це не дуже зрозуміло як працює слот збереження бо там їх 3, а видаляти їх не можна. Після проходження відкриваються всі частини так що не критично, але якось не так як потрібно. Взагалі рекомендую тим у кого теплі спогади про Portal, Portal 2. Прикро що онлайн по статистиці steam в грі не великий, хоча гра гарна! Загальна оцінка 8/10 якщо зроблять продовження то взагалі 9 :) Хоча сюжет на мій погляд завершений!
 
TJ-ua

DrPlacebo
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
12.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 janvier 2023
장점

"특정한 물건의 시간을 되돌린다"는 창의적인 메카니즘이 돋보인다. 예를 들어 점프대가 있으면 점프대를 반복 사용하는게 강제되며, 이 상황에서 "어디서 시작해서 어떤 순서대로 진행해야 하는가"를 생각하는게 퍼즐의 키포인트다.

매 챕터마다 새로운 기믹이 등장하여 레벨이 구성된다. 이게 방법이 잘못되면 난이도만 올라가고 플레이어를 짜증나게 만들수 있으나, 여기서는 각 레벨을 날림으로 만들지 않고 공들여 만들었다는게 느껴질 정도로 완성도가 높다.

새로운 챕터에서 새로운 기믹이 등장하면 일종의 튜토리얼에 해당하는 레벨을 하나씩 두었고, 전체적인 난이도도 완만할 정도로 난이도 조절이 잘된 느낌이다.

이 게임을 할때마다 포탈 시리즈의 창의성과 레벨 디자인이 느껴졌는데, 포탈 시리즈를 개미있게 했다면 이 게임도 추천할만 하다.


단점

"특정한 물건의 시간을 되돌린다"는 특성상, 무조건 진행한 경로로만 되돌릴 수 있다. 그러다보니 생각한 내용과 다른 결과가 나오거나, 또는 중간에 실수를 하면 처음부터 다시 시작하는 경우가 많다.

거기에 미세한 차이로 인해 다른 결과가 나오는 기믹도 있어 시행착오가 필요한 상황이 나오기도 한다.

아마 긴장감을 유지하기 위해서...라고 추측은 되지만, 전투용도 아닌 장비를 가지고 로봇들과 싸움을 시키는 부분은 너무 끼워맞추기라고 생각된다.


한 가지 더

모든 게임에 해당하는 내용이지만, 가급적이면 스토리에 관련된 어떤 정보도 모르는 상태에서 플레이하는걸 추천한다.

등장인물이 2명뿐인 관계로, 배경과 스토리가 명확하게 드러나지 않는다. 적극적으로 컴퓨터를 찾아 글을 읽는걸 추천하며, 종종 등장하는 발표자료도 같이 읽어볼 것을 추천한다.
 
에닉스Enigs
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Perrox329
