14 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Non recommandé
19.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 février 2023
Fun, Fantastic Puzzles
Tons of meaty, fun and challenging puzzles to solve with no true hints of any kind. Lots and lots and lots and lots....
okay quite a few puzzles but the more the merrier, right?
lots and lots and lots
...okay cool it with the puzzles guys. this game took 3 or 4 sessions because of my lack of desire to open a door and see another flipping puzzle with something slightly different than before. I'm not saying the story was bad or the puzzles weren't GOOD, but it certainly was not engaging enough to play so many puzzles to beat the game, because only a few puzzles were truly satisfying to figure out. and the good feeling of realizing how to solve most the others was curbed because you had already figured out how to solve them, but now you have to wait for the cubes to rewind all the way through the cube changer and then on the laser button and off the laser button and on the elevator button and the door button to another cube and then back and then--Oh $H!%& I forgot the put the cube on the final button so I have to jump down and setup the whole thing again. NOW I can go through the exit! One of the times I quit was when I had to set up 5 times because my brain solved the puzzle 10 minutes before my hands figured out how to control in midair, causing me to miss the bridge and fall, meaning the 2 minutes of setting up and rewinding cubes was to be done all over again. Good Night. I didn't feel smart--I felt like the clumsiest circus trapeze clown in the tent with only myself to blame.

Spoilers Ahead
An ending so good, they pretty much put it the middle and the beginning too. The end was so painfully predictable that it was the reason I gave the whole game a thumbs down. The ending sequence was so slow, not climactic and out of the player's control (while still making you move around/press a button) that I was physically screaming and begging for something cooler to happen than what actually did, and I only finished the last of the puzzles because I was desperate to see it! Oh what, the main characters have actually been looping for a while now, and you may have finally looped to a timeline that fixed the problem, but we're gonna put you in the same dreamscape from the beginning of the game and end on a pseudo cliffhanger? Woah, broke new ground there.I REALLY wanted a more solid ending or maybe even an epilogue on how the Earth is doing now that you saved it (or didn't, WHATEVER). I also did not enjoy the characters' interactions with each other. I think they were voiced well, but they just kind of "clashed" with the theme the rest of the game was putting out. I know writing is incredibly difficult and I couldn't do any better so it didn't bother me too much, it's just the main character did not seem like someone who was in peril, running around from incredibly dangerous room to incredibly dangerous room. She would say something like, "wow. I can't believe the Earth has just exploded. There must be something we can do, Astra." Meanwhile, Astra's like,"don't worry! your survival rate is calculated to be at 69% percent. Nice! Yeet!" I still thought Astra was awesome but it became too human and non-logical way too quickly and it their feelings toward each other was not really earned. You can have Astra sacrifice itself, that's a good step but it meant nothing because you pretty much knew they'd both be fine. Fake-out deaths are a bit overused nowadays. Maybe the main character could have thrown herself in harms way to save astra instead? Except she pretty much did that, but it more like a "I need this super advanced weapon back if I want to get out of here" more than "I want to save my friend" Maybe instead of the main character weaponless the whole time Astra is gone, she finds a duplicate or prototype entropy device that doesn't have Astra on it, or at least, the same Astra. Boom. Now she has a choice, and decides to save her Astra even though she didn't need to. Simple stuff like that can go a long way. Neither of the characters really had a difficult choice to do anything that was done in the game.

In conclusion, if you like lots of challenging puzzles, you may like this game. Lord knows it took me a while. I sure hope some of my 19 hour playtime is me leaving the game on overnight or something because yikes.
 
Cuddly
0

Évaluation publiée le 9 novembre 2022
Приятный наследник Portal. Загадки иногда заставляют тупить, но потом резко вспоминаешь про перемотку))
Печально конечно что ограничение всего в 38 секунд перемотки, однако этого с головой хватает, даже если эксплойтить кубы.
Есть паззлы которые путают лишними элементами. Под конец вообще кажется что загадки проще чем к середине. Однако игра всё равно хорошо держит темп и почти не захлёбывается. Когда кажется что уже конец игры, приготовьтесь к крипоте, в 2 ночи для меня это было шоком.
Но к игре мало претензий, если только докопаться к оптимизации.
Суммарно 9/10, и то потому что не знаю к чему ещё докопаться, но кажется можно.

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
13.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 janvier 2023
Слишком лёгкие пазлы, из-за этого очень скучно, интереснее было ломать уровни и выходить за границу карты, уровней слишком много для такого слабого сюжета. Сам сюжет локациями слишком похож на портал, но при этом в нём в разы меньше юмора, много нелогичных моментов, которые не объясняются. Такие как: почему ГГ не может запрыгнуть на невысокий кубик, не умеет приседать и умирает в воде. Ещё в добавок места, где сценарист или геймдизайнер могли сделать круто тупо упущены. Например, в конце говориться, что сейчас всё рванёт через 20 секунд, ждёшь минуту ничего не происходит.
Сам сюжет казался интересным, только из-за него и проходил. Но Концовка пустая и ничего не объясняет, но и додумать ничего нельзя типа всё и так понятно (и было понятно за час до концовки) - ты в петле.

Лучше вместо этого пройти какой-нибудь бесплатный мод на портал или перепройти оригинал.
 
Salvador
2
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2022
Amazing world building, characters, story and voice acting. Not a bad looking game either.

But the puzzles are either too easy or more often, too repetitive.

And after placing another block on yet another square for the hundredth time, I just couldn't go on.

That's every puzzle in a nutshell. Find the block and rewind time until the block is on the square that opens the door to the next puzzle.

Time manipulation has the potential for so many innovative puzzle ideas. But after 2+ hours the game rarely ever shifts from moving blocks around.

Maybe the puzzles get more creative as the game goes on. I only made it to ACT 6.

But I wasn't having enough fun to continue. Not recommended.
 
Crossgen
5 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2022
They try to be a lot like Portal, but fail completely. Enviroments don't have their own identity, they pretty much just copied the test chamber design from Portal 2, except they literally call them "Puzzles" (It's like when they actually call zombies "zombies" in a zombie movie/game). The writing is super cringe. They do extremely worn out AI tropes, like the robot not understanding irony, and they do it in the most unimaginative way. The AI also sometimes does random insults to the player, because that's what Glados did right? Puzzle design is okay at best. Sometimes the puzzle mechanics feel really janky and they reuse puzzle ideas way too many times, just ever so slightly increasing complexity with each chamber. It's not really a bad game, especially for this price, but I can't recommend it. There are plenty of Portal 2 mods with way better puzzle design.

Такой Portal 3 нам нужен 👍

Красивая и интересная игра, в которой приятно было провести время. Старательно пытающаяся быть похожей на Портал, но при этом столь уникальна и необычна. Отличное звуковое сопровождение, неплохой сюжет, интересные загадки и приятные персонажи. Крайне рекомендую всем к ознакомлению.

716 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2022
Good puzzles, interesting plot, Astra (the gun) is the best companion, the voice acting is really good.

I thought the puzzles would get old, as other reviews state that they get repetitive, but on the contrary, they're paced very good and the difficulty peak happens at the middle of the game, then they hover on that difficulty, the puzzles are based on going backwards (backtracking, time puzzles duh) so you have to do them twice and if you get stuck then it can get tedious, but push on, completing a puzzle is rewarding.
The game introduces new puzzle every few stages, the chase sequences lack real challenge or punch and serve more as cinematic filler.

Was it all for nothing? are we stuck on a loop?
 
Salmon
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 juillet 2023
Overall Entropy Centre was enjoyable. There were a good mix of puzzles an the shift between puzzle chambers and traversal helps keep things engaging. The time rewinding mechanic means there is a big emphasis on sequencing, which was novel to me.

It is worth noting, that while similar to Portal, the puzzles in Entropy Centre are much slower. Because you need to first move boxes/objects through their different locations before you can rewind them, every puzzle involves some setup time before execution. I never found this too tedious, but on one or two puzzles when I made a mistake during the execution it felt slow to reset the components for the rewind.

Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier
Yet another game that starts you off by letting you solve interesting puzzles, then forces you into a jump-and-shoot test of your speed, agility, and reflexes. After, of course, it is too late to return it. (No, we did not play for 48 hours. Some kind of bug in Steam had it keep the game open after there were no visible Steam windows on my Windows 11 desktop.)

Buy this if you like running and jumping, not if you were looking for more Portal.

12.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juillet 2023
Must have for those who enjoyed Portal and The Talos Principle.

Pros:
- smooth gameplay
- fun puzzles
- engaging story
- absolutely fantastic soundtrack!

♥♥♥♥:
- I encountered a couple of bugs during the game - nothing game breaking, but reloading checkpoint was necessary

Message to Swiss Army Knife Developer who made this game almost entirely alone - if you do make a sequel (or DLC at least), it would be great to hide some easter eggs in places which are hard to reach as a reward, because there are plenty of places accessible with some out-of-the-box thinking in the game (it was already brought up in other reviews). It is not necessary to enjoy the game, but it would add a little bit more flavour and enjoyment, especially to puzzle lovers.

Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
so basically this game tries to based themselves with the game called portal and sadly they fail
what makes portal interesting is the characters and the very weird humor not just puzzles also a story about time travel can be very confusing and create a lot of doubts like it doesnt make sense tat you have to do puzzles that recharge a machine to go back in time. Like you have to sit me down and explain how that works before anything and that really can be boring as helll

look at this games:

in talos principle you do puzzles put each time you heard the narrator tal about philosophy and the puzzles are a way to relax

in portal you do puzzle to test the products you were given then they add the quirky characters and humor


and then

in this game you do puzzle to recharge a machine to rewind earth only to realize that you will forever do this puzzles and you will always forget. Which like what was the point? wont have been better to break the loop? to make something different than some generic tragic sci-fi story? apparently the dev team decided to play it safe

4/10

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2023
Worth a buy on deeply discounted sale if you like a puzzle game. However, it is nearly ruined by a cluttered world, fiddly mechanics, and utterly pointless combat sections.

Cluttered world: the go-to for conveying a decaying world is always Plants Growing Everywhere but there's a point where it's just so much visual noise. Worse, I more than once lost the low-profile "jump" pad and had to reset.

Fiddly mechanics: speaking of the jump pad, it is so easy to miss and land next to it with a deadening thud, three or four steps into your solution.

Pointless combat: why? WHY? We have a nice little puzzle game going here and then every section has to end with some half-baked "robots shooting at you from all directions" while you try to flip some switches. It really feels like somebody on the team just kept pitching "but combat!!!" until everybody else gave in and shoehorned this trash in. I think I'm on level 10 now, no idea how far to the end, but almost gave up the game after this last one, can't imagine I won't when it inevitably happens again.

 
ɳοξχιτ
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2023
It's a decent game but I'm not 100% on the recommendation. I'd give it a 6/10.

There are a few minor things that stack up a fair amount that stop me from giving it a higher score.
The main one for me is that something about the camera movement is just a little bit motion sickness triggering. I can't tell you what it is, and there are very few graphics settings to tweak to try and remove it. As such, I can only play for an hour or so at a time.
Another thing I don't like is that if you fall into water during a puzzle, the respawn point is too far back, maybe a minute of intro, exploring and walking to get back to the start of the puzzle. It can get pretty tedious.

One of the smaller things I don't like, but find myself butting up against every 10 minutes is the interact distance. The interact prompt pops up when you're a certain distance away from the object, but you have to be deceptively close to the object before the E button even does anything. Would be nice to see that extended, or at least the prompt distance decreased.

The puzzles themselves all use the same mechanic. Once you've done one of them, the rest are pretty straightforward. Explore level, put objects in the end state, move things to the start state, done. Not too challenging, but it would be nice to see some variety, personally.

The story is pretty nice. It's nothing too complex and if you read all the lore you find, then it's pretty obvious what's going on.

I was really hyped for this game before it came out, but now I have it I almost can't bring myself to finish it. At time of writing, I have about 5 hours of gameplay and I reckon there's a further 3ish hours left. I probably won't be replaying it.

This game is new so I'll give it some slack, but I think the state it's at now should probably be consdiered Early Access. It needs a lot more polish before I can recommend it -- but the foundation is definitely there.
 
TemporalFire
193 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 avril 2023
時間暫停系列一直都是男人想要的能力，但是這款遊戲更進化了，還可以時間逆轉(X
傳送門的解謎方式以及廢棄工業風+量子危機與時間賽跑的那種劇情，這款給我的第一印象就是這兩者


垃圾話時間
    我穿越時間，看了14000605個未來，地球又又又又被人類毀了
    我是誰?我在哪?怎麼剩下一堆方塊機器人以及一把滿滿爛笑話的時間逆轉槍(下稱A好了)，從A口中得知這要依靠不斷的解謎產生能量後利用這能量來逆轉過去我好像知道為什麼前幾次都會毀滅了，智商加值失敗，經歷各種腦細胞九九八十一難後終於了解了故事的劇情以及之前的疑惑，剩下的就留給其他玩家自行體驗吧我不幹了.jpg


分類:
    第一人稱劇情解謎(類Portal，甚至可以說8成像)


優點:
  1. 角色之間的互動讓過程沒那麼無聊，反而覺得比謎題有趣
  2. 關卡的設計個人覺得剛好，第一次玩思考加上動手不超過5分鐘
  3. 光影以及背景很棒，以這種非3A大作來說出乎意料的驚豔
  4. 劇情沒那麼晦澀，太晦澀的劇情有時候會讓玩家雲裡霧裡反正無法產生共鳴


缺點:
  1. 個人覺得主角(人)的情感沒那麼豐富，反倒是在吐槽的時候比較自然，有時候緊張的劇情卻沒有那種緊張的語調
  2. 存檔點的部分有些距離很遠有些距離很近，有點煩躁但不至於賭爛
  3. 萬一時間逆轉過頭是無法返回的，簡單來說只能單向(這部分起碼我沒有找到對應的按鍵)。也有可能是遊戲機制設定，但確實在後期比較複雜的關卡要重新來過


提醒:
  1. 有中文
  2. 沒有任何提示，如果卡關只能找攻略(我有卡一兩關XD)
  3. 製作組一定是貓奴，一堆貓糧以及跟貓相關的信件
  4. 小E很討喜，可惜出場時間幾乎都在後半段
  5. 成就不算太難解除，除了蒐集訊息的那個以外
  6. 倒數某一章節在斷掉的橋面?(很多機器人會攔下你的那邊)會掉幀

Un vídeo vale más que mil palabras.............................

Vidéo YouTube™: PUZZLES Y ACCION I The Entropy Centre I Gameplay Español Pc 
Vues : 243
Mi Twitch......https://www.twitch.tv/mariatxi https://store.steampowered.com/app/1730590/The_Entropy_Centre/ Mi Twiter.......https://twitter.com/Mariatxil SUSCRIBETE!!!! Dale Like, comenta y ........


Un joyita si te gustan los juegos de puzzles.
Buenos gráficos, buen historia y unas mecánicas de rebobinado a la que se le van añadiendo cada cierto tiempo nuevas mecánicas, lo que hace que de vez en cuando te debas estrujar un poco la cabeza.
La duración si no te enganchas mucho ronda las 8 horas.
Un juego a tener en cuenta
Tras acabar el juego, 7 horas y media, solo puedo decir que es una maravilla.
Si te gustan los juegos de puzzles, dale fuerte.
Un saludo

PRIMERAS IMPRESIONES
Vidéo YouTube™: EL HIJO DE "PORTAL" | The Entropy Centre Gameplay Español e Impresiones 
Vues : 160
Streamer en Twitch de Lunes a Jueves a las 15h https://www.twitch.tv/jinxovarrio Apóyame en PATREON https://www.patreon.com/jinxovarrio ¿Qué tal loquetes?


A mi personalmente me ha gustado, es muy estilo Portal, la historia parece muy interesante ya que vamos enterándonos de los sucesos que han acontecido poco a poco, los puzzles cada vez son más desafiantes y a veces hay momentos de "acción" que se agradecen para salir de la monotonia.

GLOBAL: 8
GRÁFICOS: 8,5
SONIDO: 7
JUGABILIDAD: 9

PROS
La trama es predecible pero bien construida.
Puzzles ingeniosos ♥♥♥ mucha variedad
Se nota la inspiración a PORTAL


CONTRAS
Los momentos de acción podrian ser más variados.
Al igual que ser un PRO, para muchos que se parezca a Portal puede ser una Contra.

Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Fantastic game, clever mechanics, beautiful visuals and a gorgeous soundtrack.

Being compared to Portal is a massive compliment, but The Entropy Centre clearly defines itself with its quirky time rewind mechanic and interesting story. I would find myself thinking about the game at work and wanting to get home to play more!

A brilliant first release from the solo developer at Stubby Games – cannot wait to see a sequel!!

An absolute 10/10 must-have for me.

the puzzles try too hard to be portal-esque. in reality they are tedious choring. Go back and forth setting up stuff so you can just go back and rewind it. it needs a Back and forward function for the entropy gun. tbh, it is a good idea, but execution in the main play mechanic is sloppy.
Puzzles feel like they are difficult but in reality they are just "now do everything backwards"
 
TheRaccoonicorn
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
10.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2022
meh

Головоломки очень душные. Они простые и однообразные. Удалил игру когда увидел количество оставшихся актов в ачивках. "Сюжет" подаётся слишком неспешно чтобы терпеть ради него очередную комнату в кторой надо протащить один куб по кнопкам в правильном порядке. Изначально идея манипуляции временем звучала интересно, но реализация здесь оказалась скучной. По факту игра даёт вам перемотать один-три предмета на локации на 30 секунд и сами головоломки в половине случаев сводятся к протаскиванию одного куба по локации в правильном порядке в пределах этих самых 30 секунд. Самое креативное применение перемотке в игре это - починить под вами сложившийся мост/строительные леса и подняться на них вверх. Но даже тут разработчики не смогли в постоянство потому что те же правила не применяются к кубам, которые мало того что становятся чуть ли не неосязаемыми в процессе перемотки, просто лёжа на полу они по ощущениям используют физическую модель сферы, что не позволяет на них встать. Игра ощущается растянутой абсолютно не креативными головоломками. Головоломки своей духотой в какой-то момент заёбывают даже протагонистку, на что компаньон в диалоге ей отвечает что-то вроде "у нас нет нормальных коридоров, так ближе, пиздуй таскать кубы".

хотите головоломку с более креативными механиками манипуляции временем, затрагивающими всю сцену, а не только один чудо куб и то на пол шишечки - braid

хотите 3D головоломку с интересными механиками даже по мнению людей избалованных порталом, более динамичным сюжетом и головоломками которые не кажутся лишними - поиграйте в lightmatter

__дополнено после допрохождения__

в целом
во второй половине ригра выправляется
но выше описаны эмоции от прохождения первых ~7-8 глав и с этим ничего не поделать.
вторую половину проходить было не так больно, но осадочек остался.
сбжет разочаровал своим практически полным отсутствием :(
 
anrex

Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2023
FOV Report: Good

Has a slider that goes up to 120, but I suspect it isn't really 120. It's playable, and a lot better than most of the games in it's class (Not even portal has a slider that goes to 120!), but it definitely feels a little tight to me.

I'm on a field of view crusade. We live in a world where raytracing is common, but a basic quality of life field of view slider is not. There is no excuse other than lazy developers to not include one. If you agree, and want to see more accessible, comfortable gaming for everyone, join me on my crusade and start encouraging devs everywhere to include FOV support.
 
FOV Crusader
409 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
5.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2022
We have another attempt at the first person puzzle game with humor but Entropy Center commits some puzzle game sins I just can't excuse. It reminds me of Relicta in the fact that you will know a puzzle solution in a room and then have to spend 5-10 extra minutes fighting the physics and the mechanics of the game to actually solve it. As you get deeper in the game some of the puzzles are very intricate to setup up the solutions. You go just a touch too far back in time or you don't land just right on a jump pad and you are resetting the whole puzzle to do it again. This ends up pushing this away from the realm of a great puzzle game like Portal 2 and Talos Principle into the realm of the tedious games like Relicta. The action sections of Portal 2 were amazing fun but this game gets them wrong as well. You end up in rooms with robots chasing after you while you are also trying to deal with the wonky physics. It is really too bad. This could have been a solid puzzle game with some polish but the final package is just another D tier attempt at being Portal 2. I would even put Turing Test ahead of this game in puzzle room and story quality.
 
aagstn

Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2022
It wants to be Portal SO badly, and it was a decent attempt, but just kinda fell flat for me. The puzzles were mostly obvious and felt more like annoying obstacles than things I actually had to solve, and the ending was drawn out and disappointing. I think it would've benefitted from a game designer fine tuning the core gameplay; it was graphically very pretty, but the mechanics were inconsistently applied and the level design was lacking. I would've actually preferred if it was half its length but the levels they did include were better designed.

4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2023
While this game is HEAVILY inspired/a copy of portal without portals, I still think this game can be overhated. There's plenty of reused things from portal they copied over here, but that doesn't make this game inherently bad. The puzzles are well thought out, and the overall feel of the game is fun to play. Just because this game ripped assets from portal, doesn't make it a bad one.

There's a few things I don't like such as how the throw mechanic is introduced early but you can't use it until way later in the game, and I wish instead of reusing portal objects in their own name they'd stick with more original things to use, though, it doesn't take away much from the experience. I'd say to buy this game once it's on sale, It's got hours worth of gameplay, and a good story to boot. It's 100% overhated for being classed as a portal copy, even if it reuses assets.
 
Sivlare
68 produits enregistrés

Non recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
Не слушайте восторженные вопли: "О боже, портал 3!..", ибо от портала тут только сворованные идеи, но не более. Игра в отрыве от сюжета местами неплоха, но как целостное произведение - максимально душная, нудная и скучная. Темп игры - рваный и в основном медленный, не соответствующий нарративу. В плане повествования игра задает много вопросов, но практически ни на один не отвечает, будь то причина катаклизма, сумасшествие роботов... Да и вообще - при чем тут кошка? Отношения главных героинь пресные. В них нет химии, в отличии от Челл и ГЛеДОС, где последняя вообще вытянула на себе все, в то время как первая была немой. Но этого более чем хватило. А тут - ни подколок, ни веселых шутеек. НИ-ЧЕ-ГО. После Портала сюда заходить не рекомендую.

Tabula Rasa
458 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2023
Не Portal, але страшенно близько!
(11.5 год. на момент рецензування) The Entropy Centre - перша гра за довгий час, яка занурила мене з головою у свій сеттінг. Світ, представлений у грі, влаштований справді цікаво, від чого я просто із захопленням читав усі заховані повідомлення та чіплявся за кожну дрібницю. Візуал і загальна науково-фантастична атмосфера з постапокаліптичним відтінком (аналогічні Portal) просто зачарували мене, як і наша компаньйонозброя Astra. Astra фактично є аналогом картопляної Glados з Portal, але при цьому зроблена більш по дитячому пустотливою і менш саркастичною, від чого її компанія радує протягом усієї гри, і ти дійсно встигаєш до неї прив'язатися. Що стосується сюжету, хоч він і виявився дещо заloopним, загалом, я залишився задоволений. Саундтрек гри також вартує окремої згадки, він чудово доповнює атмосферу та ефектно підкреслює настрій у відповідних моментах. Однак, що стосується основи гри – головоломок, то тут є певний потенціал для росту. Хоч вони і виконані добре, це все ще не рівень Portal, де гравці мали можливість вирішувати головоломки неймовірно креативними способами, які не передбачалися розробниками. Тут ми маємо лише одне конкретне рішення, до якого потрібно дійти. Проте завдяки механіці відкату грати з цим все одно цікаво. На відміну від екшен-моментів, вони звичайно потрібні, щоб гравець міг відпочити від нескінченних головоломок, але місцева бойовка аж надто примітивно-крива. В цілому, гра є гідним пазлом з не менш гідним світом і сюжетом, що заслуговує на свої ентропійні 8 з 10!
 
AniDen
172 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
6.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2022
It's a shame I can't leave a 2.5-star review, because I'm really on the fence about this. The game starts out like a fun homage to Portal, but some of the changes really make the experience feel more like a slog. In particular, the narrative tension in the story is a mess, and you constantly feel like there's something more important you should be doing than solving puzzles. The plot is very high tension early on, but once you realize it waits for you to perform actions before doing any scripted events, it kind of reduces the threat level to zero while still expecting you to be invested and maintain that same level of tension for literal hours. It really made me appreciate the fact that Portal's main motivation was the puzzles and not some external threat that would theoretically ruin everything if you don't do puzzles fast enough.
The entropy gun mechanic is cool, but not as versatile as the portal gun. It felt like 80% of the early puzzles were just "Do the obvious steps in reverse order so that the time reversal gun can lead you through the level properly." It didn't feel like there were any clever solutions coming in until half a dozen new mechanics were added to support the main gameplay element. That being said, once they *do* actually introduce enough mechanics to support it, the puzzles can get some very clever solutions going on (even if I'm pretty sure I accidentally cheesed a few). Too bad each object has an arbitrary time limit attached to it which will screw you over at the very end of a level if you moved an object too much while preparing to solve the puzzle. When that happens, you have to start that entire object's time path over (and probably every other object too since you were probably rewinding them the whole time as well)
EDIT: Now that I've finished the game, I feel that I should add one final complaint that the ending explained basically nothing. There was no satisfying conclusion to any of the questions raised in gameplay. Maybe the answers were buried in the random email logs floating around the world, but considering 95% of those were useless and the other 5% were basically impossible to miss and gave very little info anyway, I stopped bothering to seek them out.

Non recommandé
21.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2023
The game is a generally fun puzzle game for the first couple hours. Then the game fails to understand narrative pacing. The game hits it's climax, and then continues. Then hits it's climax, then continues. The pacing is bad and the game continues on for far too long.

Next major issue, about halfway through the game's overarching plot becomes abundantly clear. The game then becomes pointless to complete. Especially due to the game itself calling it out. This contrasts with elements of the game's design. Based on this, plot wise, the game should be in a well staffed facility with little to no damage and no garbage all around it.

The game is very ok, but I wouldn't recommend it to people.
 
HereticalPie
501 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2023
I Generally like this game. it a nice Portal clone so far. it manages to set the atmosphere well.
Can't speak to the story yet as I haven't gotten that far.

A lot of Half-life/Portal vibes in this game.

Some very, very first impressions from a short session:

While there's physics in the game your character doesn't seem to interact with everything in the world. you don't affect water for example.

The visual story telling seems to be lacking. "Entropy" seems to mean everything has vegetation on it even though you are inside a closed facility. some objects stand out since they appear to not be affected by the state of the rest of the environment in a way that doesn't make sense.

In short, they game sets the atmosphere of mystery well, the soundtrack does a great job of amplifying that sensation but the visual story telling falls short.

Personally this game didn't holdup for me in terms of interest but it's something you should checkout if you liked portal and would like a light puzzle solving game.

Dislike: no indication of when the game is saved

10.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 novembre 2022
Oh god. another puzzle room. I have puzzle room ptsd. I really want to like this game. i really do. what portal did that this doesnt seem to get is that after a certain point, the puzzle rooms stop and now you use what you've learned to navigate the actual environment. ya its still sorta a puzzle room in a sense, but you arent confined to it. the story doesnt just stop dead because of it. The problem with this is you keep getting stuck in new puzzle rooms right up until the very end of the game almost. there were certain times when, like i said , the puzzle rooms were seemingly done and now you are navigating the environment. but sure enough BAM! 5 go***mned more puzzle rooms. And if you're sick of me saying puzzle rooms, imagine how sick you'll be of them when you keep getting stuck in one over and over and over again.

Non recommandé
6.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 octobre 2023
Эта игра не то чем кажется! Посмотрев трейлер, я подумал, что нашёл годную индюшатину. И первые часа 2 был крайне доволен игрой. Интересная завязка сюжета, прикольный робот и атмосфера как в portal 2 очень зашли. Но геймплей достаточно быстро надоедает. Все появляющиеся по мере прохождения нововведения сводятся к "Вот новый куб, который повторяет механику из Portal, но теперь его можно двигать". Да и сама основная механика перемотки, кажущаяся поначалу необычной и интересной, по факту просто даёт двигать кубики туда-сюда, из-за чего приходится таскать их дважды, чтобы записать перемещение. Это делает комнаты ещё более нудными. Подобная механика с гораздо более разнообразными головоломками есть в моде portal:thinking with time machine, где она реализована интереснее. Его я проходил неоднократно. А эту игру я в итоге бросил, так и не дойдя до конца

Итак прошел я эту игру и то ли я старый то ли:

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 mars 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

I recommend this game only because of its excellent puzzle mechanics and a couple of superbly designed levels which will make your head hurt until you solve them.

If you like Portal-like games, you will absolutely enjoy the puzzle-solving gameplay of The Entropy Centre.

With that said, here's what I don't like:

- The world-building and story are really poor and uninspired. There's almost nothing to immerse me in the world of the game properly, and the writing is awful.
- The game's world design and visuals are washed out, repetitive and boring. The game looks ugly and outdated but not in a retro way, it simply doesn't have good-quality visuals.
 
Sawovsky
1,228 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 janvier 2023
The puzzles are hard, which is good, but tedious, which is very bad and turns the difficulty into a negative. Exploration is haphazard, with no proper clues to whether your careful parkouring will lead to lore or just a softlock or invisible wall. Touching water reloads the entire level. A failed jump can mean careful arrangement over minutes is wasted. There's basically too many rough edges when it comes to time sinks, like playtesters were told to shut up about being bored and frustrated to avoid putting any polish into that part.

I would probably have been satisfied if I got the ending after chapter 6 (and the game cost less), but apparently there's 15 total chapters, which is just too much of this.

Évaluation publiée le 8 avril 2023
Поначалу игра кажется интересной, достойным клоном дилогии Portal, но быстро становятся видны недостатки. Это и очевидная вторичность идей, и неуместно весёлая ГГ, и не до конца понятная концовка. Головоломки отдельный ужас, ни одной сложной, но 8 из 10 кошмарно душные, вынуждающие выполнять одни и те же действия с самого начала просто потому, что ты изначально не видишь все кнопки/переключатели/кубы и просто не можешь сразу составить маршрут.
Лично я для себя вообще ничего не вынес из игры, ни мыслей, ни удовольствия.
 
Uo
380 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Non recommandé
7.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2022
I wanted to like this game, but I spent way too much time being frustrated to give it a thumbs up. I'm about two thirds of the way through the game, judging by chapter numbers, and I just can't make myself play any more.

First problem, the physics are janky. You'll really, really come to hate the jump pad, which is a key puzzle element that makes you try to hit a postage stamp from great heights, and then spend a couple minutes resetting all the components EVERY SINGLE TIME when you invariably miss it 10 times in a row. Oh, and I should mention that the devs like the rule of threes a lot, so you'll find yourself trying to hit that postage stamp three times in a row. (This could be solved if the devs just made you land where your cursor points.)

Second problem, the saves are not generous enough. I rage quit after the third time I had to do a double postage stamp puzzle, and then died later in the level, requiring me to repeat those postage stamps. I'm guessing it was 30 or 40 total postage stamp attempts by the time I finally successfully executed all the components of the level. There really, really needs to be save on demand, just to save the (sometimes) minutes it takes to re-setup your components if you miss that postage stamp.

Third problem, it's too easy to die, and there are areas that look accessible but aren't, killing you. There are some bonus content pieces that require you to be precisely positioned in order to execute them, so get prepared to die six or seven or more times in order to successfully execute the trick. (As to why dying is bad, one big reason is there are collectibles that don't get saved across deaths, so it's easy to miss a collectible if you die and forget to grab it again.)

Fourth problem, lockdowns. I'm trying to be spoiler-free, but imagine having to do puzzles while having tennis balls lobbed at your head. Oh, and two tennis ball hits kill you. I *hated* lockdowns.

Fifth problem, chase sequences. This is kind of a spoiler, but there are sections where you run while interacting with the game's main mechanic. As I mentioned before, the physics are janky. If you press the button, there's no guarantee that the game mechanic will kick in, and so you stand there a couple seconds wondering why nothing is happening. I've had to hit the button three or four times before the mechanic kicks in. Now add a timer to that. I really hated the chase sequences as well.

Sixth problem, it's too dark in too many places and you don't get a flashlight. Not much more to add to that.

Cumulatively, these six annoyances made the last half of my seven hours invested in this game a chore rather than fun. So I'm gonna recommend skipping it unless you have a high threshold for jank.
 
Synnoc

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Összességében én nem nevezném nagyszerű játéknak a The Entropy Centre-t, de az biztos, hogy a fejtörős részekben, amik miatt végül is létrehozták, abban egész szépen tündököl. Esténként 1-2 órára könnyen el lehet merülni benne, de a narratíva kiforratlansága miatt igazából akkor sem vesztünk semmit, ha csak hetente 1-2 alkalommal indítjuk el. A különböző fejtörőkkel kellemesen el lehet szórakozni, és véleményem szerint a Stubby Gamesznek, így az első próbálkozása után egyáltalán nincs mitől szégyenkeznie.

A teljes cikket itt [www.adventuregames.hu] tudod elolvasni.

Non recommandé
12.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 novembre 2022
This review contains spoilers. You have been notified.
I should probably start off by saying I hate games with downer endings. The kind of ending where, after you spend hours playing the game, you find your choices made zero impact on the story. There really should be a tag for 'Downer Ending' so I would know not to be too excited about a title.
While the premise of the game is good, the execution is somewhat flat. The puzzles, while not terribly difficult, started to turn into a real slog about 2/3 of the way through the game. By hour 10, I was thinking, "Alright. Finally getting to the climax!" only to be presented with ANOTHER track of puzzles. Games like The Turing Test and SOMA managed to at least break up the constant stream of puzzles with story and world building. Entropy Centre just repeats, "Hurry up! You're running out of time!" (Except that no, you aren't. Even when you're told there's a 20-second countdown, you don't need to rush. Finish the game in a 10 hour casual playthrough or a 1.5 hour speedrun. No difference.)
Speaking of story and world building, the vast majority of the logs you can find are rather mundane and explain very little about what is happening. Yes, some can be put together into a coherent timeline, but the vast majority of them are superfluous "day in the life" bits that made me wonder why I went so far out of my way to find it.
And the layout of the EC itself is, frankly, infuriating! You complete a particular puzzle track and while en route to the next, the floor falls out from under you and you fall hundreds of feet... Directly to the next track.
I love the puzzle mechanics a lot (heck, I even started to like Astra's company), but the game really needed a better story to go around it.
 
Pickles
672 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 octobre 2023
I actually enjoyed this game for most of my playtime, but having beaten it, it's a soft not recommend. I don't think the positive reviews are wrong, but for me, I wasn't a huge fan for a few reasons.

First of all, the puzzles. All of them were pretty easy for me and other reviewers seem to agree. The main gimmick is rewinding which requires you to think backwards, but most puzzle room games already require you to think backwards to get out of the room, so it isn't too special. Still neat though I guess. I did get tired of them by the end though and just wanted to finish the game.

Secondly, there are a surprising amount of action sequences for a puzzle game, in that I had expected zero. There're not necessarily bad but they're not hard either though. And they don't add much narratively that couldn't have been done in cut scene or some backdrop. I just don't know why they're there.

As for the plot, it's alright, but I got kind of annoyed. Without any spoilers, you come across some notes really early on which directly tells you the main character's plan isn't going to work, at least not long term, but the character doesn't respond to that, because players might miss or not read the notes. So you're stuck controlling a character who should know what they're doing is pointless, unless there's some grand revelation later in the game. And there is a reveal later on, but it was kind of obvious and really unsatisfying for me.

However, I think the game's biggest problem is mood. The set-up and story are pretty dark but then the game gives you a cheerful companion who exchange quips and jokes with the main character for the majority of the adventure as they cheer you on to victory. I feel like I would have enjoyed the game way more if they stuck to making it dark and introspective about the fate of everything (Entropy) or an upbeat adventure to beat the odds. As it is right now, the ending really doesn't work with either of those. If they changed the ending or change the mood of the game throughout, this would be an easy recommend.
 
Gary Glover
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
9.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 novembre 2022
Of note, you can get portal 1 and 2 for less than this game costs, and I would recomend both of those before recomending this as they both have more interesting gameplay and fun to them.

SPOILER WARNING:

Having just finished the game I must say I found it very lacking. All stackes are completely scripted until you do a thing which completely falls apart once you get close to the end where they will mention incredibly low times, like "catastrophic colision in 20 seconds" only for the walk you need to go taking more than that and nothing happened. This really should not have been the case, firstly. If the time you claim is less than a minute you better make sure what you are claiming actually happens. and secondly. The fact that you can't even get to where you need in the given time is really bad imo.

There is also a few pewes i have, one being the placement of some items the the games more broken down sections. This game has areal fate plates. Its very obvious they arent suposed to be where you find them yet they happen to line up perfectly with the next part you have to reach every time. It just makes no sense and does bring me out of the game with how incredibly gamey it feels. The game even had a great option to replace them which would have been way less obvious. The bridge cubes which while still gamey would have been way less so since you in this case place them to make your own path.

This game is no portal, It wants to be but it just is not. The puzzles are way to easy 99% of the times, and starts to very quickly feel like chores instead of something fun to do. If anything this game has given me a reneved appreciation for portal.

Despite my complaints tho I do not think its a bad game, just a very mid one. 4-5/10 buy it if it gets a sale for 50% off.
 
TrixyTrixter
806 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
15.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier 2023
If you're sad that Valve will never make another portal, and Croteam do not hurry with Talos Principle's sequel, then this is the game for you. I've stumbled upon it by accident on Twitter - i guess it was a Christmas miracle.

GAMEPLAY:

The game revolves about rewinding objects in time. Once you grasp the mechanics it's all pretty straightforward. Game offers you a variety of puzzles, but since it keeps introducing new elements constantly, even in the later parts some of the puzzles feel like a tutorial. Overall, I wouldn't call this game too difficult, although I've spent quite some time on the puzzles in the last three levels. I'll give the developers credit - they could've introduced a lot more timed mechanics, but thankfully didn't. You can go in your own pace, and not worry that you should rearrange the puzzle pieces too quickly, or else the platform you're supposed to stand on will move away, and you will fall to certain death.

One aspect I didn't like was the lack of quick save/quick load feature. If you die you start from the beginning of the test chamber. It doesn't send you that much back in time, but I wish I could save the game before a tricky jump. Speaking of jumps, some of them require some precision, which I'm not good at. But I guess, it's a personal preference.

Another fun element is your ability to fight the enemies. The game gives you a nice array of tools to fend off the hostile bots swarming the facility without turning into an outright FPS. Can be a nice change of pace, but a bit repetitive.

STORY:

The story throughly enjoyable. You're an employee in the eponymous Entropy Centre. You have amnesia and the rest of the staff is gone. You find and entropy devise called Asta, which talks to you for the rest of the game. Astra reminds PotatOS from Portal 2 - in a way that it's a sentient being strapped to your puzzle-solving weapon. Unlike GladOS, Astra is cheerful and friendly. Bickering between Aria (the main character) and her companion can be funny and quirky, but may feel out of place. Astra, despite understanding the gravity of the situation the characters are in, still act foolish in the later stages of the game. I understand that it was probably done to lighten up the mood, but for me it comes off as tacky. She's not an idiot, she's an AI! Also, just like in Portal games, the gun itself is a much bigger deal in-universe that a freaking sentient robot. Of course, the ability to rewind the objects through time is amazing, but shouldn't we also mention that somehow we've also been able to create an AI companion to it?!

Story is mostly told through environmental lore (reading the emails on the PCs scattered through the facility) and automated centre's PSAs. The goal of the facility is to rewind Earth in case something bad happens to it. The game has a strong pro-environmental message, which can be off-puting to some, but I didn't care.

Some questions are answered and some aren't. There's a haunting scene closer to the end that is done masterfully, and will pretty much tell you all you need to know. You will understand when you'll get there.

GRAPHICS:

Eh, they're nice. Not something I particularly care about.

MUSIC:

Atmospheric and sometimes almost haunting, the music is a big part of the game's overall feel. Nothing else to add here.

OVERALL:

I would recommend this game to anyone who wants to play a first-person puzzle game. Hopefully, there will be a DLC/sequel/mods.
 
Hook
0

Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2023
Fantastic game, I fully recommend it if you love puzzles. As people say, it's Portal's worthy spiritual successor. But I have to give it a No for two very painful reasons:

- Bad platforming. Please, Devs, implement automatic fall correction so that you always land on the jump cube if you'd fall near it. All good platforming games implement generous invisible landing surfaces to avoid frustration.

- The ending. It looks like the protagonist is dumb or just ignoring all the clues she's seeing about what's about to come. Even if she keeps her final decision, some more elaboration on the dilemma would have been appreciated. It looks like she is completely blind to what the player is seeing from chapters 12 to 15.

0.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 novembre 2022
Produit remboursé

I wasn't captivated by this idea, I played the first few minutes of the game but unlike Portal where every surface felt like a new opportunity, once I realised that nothing could be interacted with I felt kind of like a prop in a very pretty and atmospheric world.

I didn't play very deeply into the game so it's entirely possible that the gameplay improves, but I felt like it would have worked better if it didn't tie itself so closely to Portal and instead focused on a different way of using the time rewinding mechanic.

The puzzles didn't feel very inspired in the first few rooms and the random broken scenery felt like a weird show-off of a mechanic that didn't interest me.

Évaluation publiée le 4 avril 2023
While it is a shameless rip-off of Portal in almost every way, it's still a lot of fun and has it's own, slightly friendlier vibe compared to Portal. And since the replay value of puzzle games is somewhat limited, fans of portal will probably be happy to find a little bit "more of the same".

It's an easy recommendation for anyone who likes Portal, and anyone who wants to see just how far you can take copying almost every single idea from another game. If you have no shame.

Recommandé
7.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2022
I really enjoy games like Portal, and this one is really close near it. However, as much as I enjoy the mechanics and the actual level design, the gameplay however is kinda tedious. There is a nice story to discover and lots of interesting conversation mails to be found, however, it feels like they added a bit too many puzzles and not enough story to enjoy. Puzzle after puzzle after puzzle, a lil bit story, a lil bit run away from the cute killerbots and then puzzle puzzle puzzle puzzlesss, it keeps on going and they keep on going with more new "features".

And again, all mechanics are great, it's getting a chore to complete them. It's a great game to enjoy who loves puzzling like games such as portal, but for those who enjoy a tad more story, feels a bit lacking. The cute conversations between your weapon and the hero you're playing, its all nice and well, not enough imo.

I think i'm about halfway through and it's feeling like a chore to complete the puzzles, rather enjoy the mechanics, story and level design. Unlike the portal games, it feels like the puzzles have been injected into the gameplay instead of building around it.

I will recommend this game, but I do have mixed feelings about this. Great voice acting, interesting story to discover, great portalesque gameplay mechanics, but tedious puzzles and there is no real joy to get after finishing the puzzles. Because the puzzling never ends and sure it might be nice for those who really enjoy solving these puzzles, but for the casual player, it will not lol.
 
Lawie
3,206 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
TL;DR Indie games are amazing, and this game was made with love. If you liked Portal, you should definitely check this game out.

Right off, the game's opening sequence is visually stunning and phenomenal. The overall aesthetic of the Entropy Centre reminded me a lot of Aperture Science labs and, surprisingly, Mass Effect's Noveria.

The main story, as well as the overall narrative construction of this game, are spot on. They're well crafted, very finely structured and they never get boring. I never found neither Astra, nor Aria behaving out of character. However, I find their humor to be highly inspired by Portal. Otherwise, it's these little quirky moments, like Astra saying "yeet", a friendly robot called "E" and the game's apparent obsession with beans. But I can also appreciate the message the game tries to deliver. The story doesn't revolve around the said message, which is quite good, but it also makes it a necessary part.

The sound design. Good heavens, is it amazing. The work the sound team did on this game made it very immersive. The sound effects are clean and fitting for everything. The entropy device sounds pretty much how you would expect it to sound. The environment sounds are very realistic. The soundtrack, however, could've used a bit of variety. There are some moments when the same music plays for a few levels and it can get quite repetitive. At some point, I discovered that the music can stop playing at all.

The puzzle aspect of this game is highly inspired by cubes and buttons of Portal games. But that's not a bad thing. The rewinding gimmick was very interesting, I loved every moment of constructing the right order of cube placement and I also appreciate that, in some cases, there were multiple ways of solving a puzzle.

Another thing I have to complement is the programming aspect of this game. On my whole journey, I only encountered a single bug, and it was the aforementioned music bug. Now, you can get soft-locked in some areas, it happened to me twice, but not once have I fallen through a terrain, not once was I unintentionally launched into the air, not once have I encountered an issue caused by failed rendering. All the bugs that are characteristic for games made with Unreal Engine are non-existent in this game.

Indie games are the future of gaming, and games like Entropy Centre, games that were made with love and sincere dedication, are the solid proof of it.
 
chron
123 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2022
"The Entropy Centre" est un jeu de résolution d'énigmes très plaisant, enrichi de quelques mécaniques novatrices.

Il est indéniable que le jeu "Portal" a eu une influence majeure sur les développeurs. On y retrouve l'humour caractéristique de "Portal", un "gun" qui nous assiste dans la résolution des énigmes, un "sidekick" rigolo en la personne d'Astra, des cubes de voyage, un centre de test, des ponts de lumière tangible, des plaques de foi aériennes, et bien d'autres éléments... Bref, l'empreinte de "Portal" est omniprésente, au point que le jeu semble perdre sa propre identité à force de vouloir lui ressembler.

Chaque acte du jeu introduit une nouvelle mécanique, avec une première salle de test toujours très simple pour permettre au joueur de comprendre le fonctionnement de cette mécanique. Et Astra, notre "sidekick", offre des explications intradiégétiques détaillées, créant ainsi un tutoriel qui reste cohérent avec l'univers du jeu, sans briser le quatrième mur. Cette approche s'avère très bien pensée.
Au fur et à mesure que l'on progresse dans les salles de test, les mécaniques se combinent de manière de plus en plus complexe, rendant les énigmes de plus en plus "difficiles".
Les énigmes sont réellement captivantes, même si les dix premiers actes sont indiscutablement trop simples, les cinq derniers ajoutent une dose de réflexion supplémentaire.
Il est à noter que certaines salles offrent plusieurs méthodes pour les résoudre : la voie officielle ou une approche non conventionnelle.

Les mécaniques originales sont à la fois innovantes et divertissantes, en particulier celle qui consiste à rembobiner un objet dans le passé à l'aide de ce que j'appelle le "Time Gun". C'est une idée vraiment bien pensée qui ajoute un aspect ludique.
La bande originale, basée sur la musique électronique douce et l'ambient, s'harmonise parfaitement avec les divers thèmes du jeu.

"The Entropy Centre" offre une expérience fluide, facile à prendre en main et simple à appréhender, bien que l'inertie lors de l'utilisation du rembobinage puisse être assez agaçante.
En ce qui concerne la durée de vie, il m'a fallu environ neuf heures pour le terminer, en explorant méticuleusement chaque recoin à la recherche d'informations supplémentaires.
L'humour présent dans le jeu peut provoquer un sourire, bien que l'on soit loin d'atteindre l'excellence du niveau d'humour de "Portal", cela fonctionne tout de même de manière plutôt convaincante.
L'histoire ne sert que de prétexte pour résoudre les énigmes, mais on s'y laisse aisément prendre.

Si un développeur potentiel venait à lire cet avis (on ne sait jamais), je tiens à exprimer mon souhait de voir la difficulté augmentée dans un éventuel DLC, que je serais prêt à acheter sans la moindre hésitation. L'objectif serait de mettre nos cerveaux à l'épreuve de la même manière que le DLC "Road To Gehenna" du remarquable jeu "The Talos Principle".
 
𝗟'𝗘𝗻𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗲́

1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 novembre 2022
I waited this game with impatience but I'm dissapointed.
The world and the concept around entropy is enjoyable but it brings nothing interesting in puzzle.
Comparing this to portal, because the game seems to take a bit of inspiration from that, the main tool, the entropy gun, is boring.

In portal the simple portal gun allow a lot of possibilities and a lot of play with gravity / momemtum and object interaction.
Here all puzzles feels the same, it's all about positionning object in certain order and rewind them to activate some mecanisms in certain order to progress or to pick them after you use them.
It's so boring and nothing challenging where I actually have to use my brain.

I would rather have more interaction with objects without the entropy gun and just some cool story / lore on the theme of entropy with more interesting puzzle like the game talos principle.
I guess it depends on your expectation, maybe this game is trying to bring more players by being more "accessible"so it's just not for me ?

Recommandé
9.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
a good 8.5 hour of brain and hand exercise, but the easter eggs were somewhat time consuming. after spending time collecting 40 intels, i found it boring and gave up to focus on the puzzles.

the puzzles were pretty decent without exploiting the glitches even there were some that can negatively affect the game experience. anyways, the developer does a very good job at somehow introducing the idea of entropy through the scope of a fun puzzle game, but it could've been better if it can go a bit more philosophical and scientific. also, i think there can be more checkpoints because it's frustrating to start a big part all over again due to some mechanical errors, but that might be a me issue as i'm not good with the movement mechanisms. there were parts that should take 5 minutes to execute, but i took 10-15 mins because of some stupid mechanical mistakes.

regardless, im eager to see more puzzle games from the dev.

my score:

concept: 9/10
puzzle ingenuity: 8.5/10
puzzle complexity: 7.5/10
graphics (on best): 9/10
storyline: 5/10
sound effect: 7/10

worth it? yes if storyline is ignored. maybe not if taken into account.

also, if it's possible to reverse the player's entropy, that would be fun.
 
OrderedChaos
78 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
This was one of my most anticipated games of 2022 after seeing it in the Playstation Showcase in June. It looked like it had the spirit of Portal with an abandoned facility, mysterious premise and cute robots. I enjoyed the Demo and decided to get the full game on release date. I enjoyed the whole experience, I would often smile at some of the writing and loved Astra the robot companion. The mechanic of rewind objects is a very cool concept and gives me vibes of the FStop footage from the scrapped sequel of Portal that would eventually become Portal 2. The presentation was very good and was well optimized from the Demo. The Demo had severe lag spikes when loading different puzzle rooms and that was rectified in the final game. I only had a few bugs, nothing game breaking, but sometimes cubes would clip or I would get stuck, but perfectly playable. The puzzles are challenging sometimes, but nothing stumped me. It’s a lot of cubes which is to be expected since you need to rewind an object. There are a lot of systems you would expect and are slowly introduced and there’s always something to look forward to. I normally get disappointed by the story in these games, but I was pleasantly surprised. The reveals while exploring the facility are exciting and made solving the puzzles have a definitive end goal. The final nail was that this was written and developed by one guy. This blew me away cause this is a content rich indie game that feels high quality and provided me with 10 hours of gameplay for only $20. I would recommend this to any Portal fan and puzzle fan it was quite the treat.

Edit: I forgot to mention, but the music was fantastic. Please put it on Spotify!

8/10

Non recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 janvier 2023
The core rewind idea is interesting and the writing is generally good, but the puzzles are far too repetitive. Nearly all of the puzzles I saw in 90 minutes of playtime were solved by putting two blocks on the same switch, bringing one of them across a hazard and back, then bringing the first block back and rewinding the second to catch up to me. It was very cool the first time I did it, but much less so after the sixth time in a row without substantial changes. Other reviews from people who played further suggest that this doesn't get better - I wasn't interested enough to let the refund window lapse in order to find out.
 
Allthegoodnamestaken
1,643 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 novembre 2022
i just beat the game a few minutes ago. without spoiling anything i'd say i have a mixed opinion on this game. on one hand, it strongly (and i mean STRONGLY) reminds me of several game dev ideas ive had previously; but executed better than i was able to in my attempts...it truly is the game i tried to make on multiple occasions but failed. It also has a really gripping story, absolutely beautiful art direction, and mostly good gameplay...but thats when there are some problems. there were a few sequences that felt hair-rippingly difficult for no reason and out of place for a puzzle game which i feel could have been avoided entirely; and there are a couple puzzles where i admittedly had to exploit bugs to get past (though i am sure there was a more legit way, i couldnt find it.) in regards to bugs, there were a couple that also prevented further progress but the game fixed itself after quitting to the main menu and re-entering. its also extremely frustrating in a few places where i kept dying or otherwise failing and the checkpoints were sometimes pretty lousy, meaning i had to redo stuff i had already struggled through just to get back to where i died.

Story wise, i was dissapointed at the end to find that i had already theorized correctly what it was going to be from a very early point in the game; though that does tend to happen with me because i am very good at inferring stuff from subtle clues.

the final issue is that there was one story sequence in the game that kindof bothered me.. ive never been somebody who likes horror and it got a little too horror-esque for my comfort in one part, so new players should be cautious if they are sensitive to certain topics, such as insanity .

overall however, i still recommend this game simply because of my aforementioned point that it reminds me a lot of my own work. even if im a bit sad i didnt execute the idea first, im still glad it exists and sombody else made it happen in this case. i will certainly be making fan tributes in some form soon!
 
Blue
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
还没玩完，姑且说几句。
整个游戏都能感受到很浓郁的传送门气息，令人怀念，这一点其实见仁见智，但对我来说是完完全全的加分项。
画面还行，优化……大概一般？渣机，感受不出来。
游戏性是不错的，解谜的话，前面有一点枯燥，但后面挺有意思的（虽然一半都没玩完吧）；因为判定比传送门范围大（传送门打在哪开在哪，还需要瞄，这个只要目标对了就能回溯上，而且不必一直瞄着），所以可以做更多更加即时性（像传送门2里和Wheatley一起逃跑）的解谜，刺激感更强，而且综合预告片的内容和目前的体验，后面这类场景估计也不会少。
没有任何传送的操作，虽然也有跳板，但感觉应该也不会老在空中飞来飞去的，对3D眩晕症患者应该比较友好；但既不能传送也不能跑，有时候行动可能会略感缓慢。
剧情方面，设定感觉比较模糊，回溯操纵的自由感也不强，但因为题材原因也可以理解；详细剧情的话，没玩完，后面再补，但感觉应该还可以，阿斯特拉的性格有一点撕裂感，不过毕竟是AI，也说的通。
总体来说，还不错。

Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2023
So imagine Portal except the writing is cringe, the levels are poorly designed, the puzzles are almost all identical and uninspired, and the music is annoying. This may be the most creatively bankrupt, uninspired game I have ever played. Anything it has that's good is ripped for Portal (they literally have certain puzzles and even jokes ripped straight from portal) and everything else is garbage. Almost every puzzle is 'put box on Pad A, then Pad B, then reverse box to Pad A' it's abysmal. It's humor is stolen, its mechanics are stolen, and it's all thrown together in an uncreative fashion by a passionless team. I mean, the developers couldn't even be bothered to change the color scheme from Portal - these people do not deserve your money. I wanted a Portal-like game, not a bad Portal ripoff.

blAde
720 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 aout 2023
7/10
Honestly I was considering returning this game as I managed to beat it in a day, but I decided ♥♥♥♥ it I got it on sale, so Ima keep it. However I did start to drag my feet at the end and want it to be over, I DO NOT recommend powering through it as it can get painfully tedious as Ill discuss later. However if you're looking for another portal, look elsewhere. This is definitely inspired by portal, more specifically Portal 2 (Sometimes a bit too much) but this game is its own thing, from the humor to the tone to the puzzles, which at first were pretty good. I thought it was a neat concept and that it had some potential, and it did. Overall I enjoyed my time with the game.

Now onto my issues. As I said it tried too much to be like Portal 2. It gives you an AI companion Astra who is a cute character, she has some moments I enjoyed, but overall she felt very... Flat? A lot of her jokes were dry or just weren't funny. She had a few good moments where her bluntness worked like during an elevator crash when the elevator says "Welcome to Level four" And opens to a wall and she states "That is not level four. That is a wall" before falling was good! I liked that, and her writing got better in the later acts, however most of the time they tried to make her sarcastic or witty which just... didnt pan out? Like when I completed a supposedly hard puzzle in 20 seconds that I read articles that said some users took 2 days and she said I was sub-optimal in time... It just felt, out of place? Like they wanted to make a Wheatly but didnt want to make it too samey leading to Astra feeling overall like a not interesting character for the first half of the game.

Next on to gameplay. Game was solid, most of the puzzles made you think but werent brain scramblers (Other than act 10...♥♥♥♥ act 10, most puzzles were 10-20 minutes of pain), however when playing them in sequence, they all became very... formulaic? Most puzzles became doing the same things 2-3 times as set up before the final time where all the pieces are in place, and they all function some what similar where you set one or two blocks to move to different points before pressing a button at the very end. And worst was if you messed up once, or got a block stuck, often youd have to start a 3-5 minute puzzle over from the beginning, especially with the tiny bounce pads they love using, which basically operate like Bloo Goo in Portal 2, except the box is so tiny its easy to miss falling, or not have enough momentum to make it over a gap. Overall there were lots of cool elements, but often they ended up as 1 trick ponies with the same loop, take your time or youll burn out on them.

Finally story... Oh boy SPOILERS AHEAD.
I... have mixed emotions on the story. In a nut shell you are the last worker on a moon base thats designed to rewind earth should a world ending threat happen. Through the first few acts the game builds up to the world ending, and it does, earth goes boom, not enough power. Most of the rest of the game is trying to get to the reactor to fix and power it up so we can rewind earth, through it we find out bits and bobs how this cataclysm hasnt been able to be stopped despite over 2000 rewinds of it alone, and it builds a lot of intrigue that got me going, However as the story early on talks about rewinding puzzle users who generate entropy energy (Mcguffin that rewinds the earth) so they can blindly repeat puzzles, the twist is kinda spoiled, especially when they all but spell it out. Youve done this loop a few million times where you save the earth and get sent back to the start. Later on you find out that everyone fled the station but you, thats why youre alone, and then you fix the reactor and loose Astra due to her sacrifice, Well crap, no more gun. Really cool segment about using the generator that "Auto repairs" By rewinding time to prevent damage and you go through a pretty scary section of limbo seeing reflections and insanity of your past about how many times youve been here... and how youve lost astra so many times, makes you think shes gone right? Maybe thats why you cant solve the problem? I did, so lo and behold not even 5 minutes after you get here back and things go back to normal, and then things kinda just... end? You get sent back to the start with nothing changed or different or any more clues, forced to continue after seeing your infinite tries that have and yet to happen... Its... bitter sweet and a bit unsatisfying to be honest, but I like what they did, however I would have liked a little more player freedom to maybe learn more considering how satisfying and pretty the world is, and how much I enjoyed the non puzzle sections more than the puzzle ones.

Oh and for some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ reason you're allergic to water and cant wade through a 3 foot deep puddle
 
Tavarish DeGroot

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier
I don't know why I thought I'd enjoy this. The puzzles are doable enough, but the robot is just so insipid, please add an option to remove the AI from the gun. (Edit: I should note, while I dislike the lines, the robots voice is nice, give the actress her spot on IMDB, it doesn't appear there. For those who want to know, her name is "Kasey Miracle")

Seriously, even when you work out puzzles really quickly, the AI tells you that you were really slow. I know it's a pre-recorded voice line, but it still sucks to hear. I want to be happy with my progress, not brought back to the reality that I'm an idiot.

The game overall is... okay, the story is very dark and depressing, and also a cat dies. Don't kill cats, thanks.

I have monstrously bad depression and playing a game about the inevitable death of earth and a robot occasionally calling me an idiot... Just isn't helping. I was hoping it was going to be a light, fun, puzzle game... But the story around it really ruins it for me.

Another big issue is autosaving... You cannot manually save. So if you die to something stupid, or fall off of something, you have to go back, quite far. This basically means that large chunks of the game will very quickly become VERY repetitive. I could understand if there was no quicksave feature due to a technical limitation with the gun's memory for rewinds... But honestly, even if that is the reason, it's still a major downer for a game.

Ultimately, if you're of good mental health and don't mind the massive autosave annoyance, then I hope you love the game.
But this is my review, my recommendation, and based on my own experiences... I just can't recommend the game.
Sorry about that. It's well made... it just wasn't for me.



You might potentially count this next bit as a SPOILER:
I watched a friend stream this game, and the ending was just... bad. I hated it... it was insanely disappointing.
Definitely SPOILER here:

No, really, SPOILING here:

The ending made the entire game pointless, rewinding you back to the beginning without any memory of what happened throughout. Basically like when a tv show is like "It was all a dream!"... Such a let down after everything else within the game.

The game repeatedly hammers into you that the earth is going to be destroyed and there's nothing you can do to save it. Then you get to the end, your character says they know what to do now.... And then you're sent back to the beginning of the game without any memory. I hate it.

Non recommandé
4.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 décembre 2022
An okay game. Visually feels like an asset flip with the same bush and vine copy pasted a million times. Portal and it's followers had a feeling of starting in a clean research center and later breaking into a backstage with creepy corridors. Here you start in a backstage, killing the vibe of breaking the rules and exploring something you shouldn't. Base mechanic is boring - it's not about actual time rewind - it's about rewinding certain objects on their path... until it's not. 90% of the puzzle rooms are: place the box on plates in reverse order, then fire your gun. Puzzles are extremely, like 1 y.o. toddler level easy - every new room takes you 15 seconds to figure out which cubes do you have, then 15 seconds to solve the puzzle in your mind, and another 3 minutes to actually do it because the rewind function is so slow, The gun really needs an option to hold another button to speed up the process to at least x3 speed. Also after the introduction of bridge cube you can skip about 70% of the remaining puzzles just by placing it on some slope and building yourself a staircase to the exit. And I'm not like a speedrunner or bug hunter, these game breaking moments are obvious and so easy to do. This is just bad level design. And for some reason there are so much action sequences which are, again, boring and slow.
