nexen
6
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 septembre 2023
Давайте сразу уясним. Вот почему-то среди больших влиятельных дядек обзорщиков принято говорить, что эта игра сделана более менее, но это точно не Portal, который они так хотели почувствовать в этой игре. Вообще многие люди считают эту игру клоном Portal, но я с этим категорически не согласен.

The Entropy Centre полностью самостоятельный проект, он не пытается казаться Portal, он создаёт свою историю, свой геймплей, свои фишки. По всей игре вы не найдёте ни единой отсылки на Portal, ни одной похожей головоломки. И вот только попробуйте сказать мне, что кубов и кнопок не существовало до Portal, это просто база.

Каждая локация в The Entropy Centre уникальная. Всё начинается с более освещенных тестовых камер, позже вы попадёте в сектор заросших камер, в которых постоянно идёт дождь. Ещё позднее головоломки будут проходить на пляже с видом на бескрайний космос. Локаций действительно много, а то, что я назвал, лишь одна пятая от общего их количества.

Элементов головоломок также много, за всю игру вы встретите их около двадцати, если не больше. Самый главный элемент - это ваша временная пушка, которая запоминает местоположение любого предмета во времени, после чего может переместить этот предмет на любое нужное вам место на данном временном отрезке. Так что головоломки придётся решать в обратном порядке, начиная с конца и перематывая время в самое начало.

К этой пушке добавляется многообразие кубов, например куб-батут, куб с лазером, куб меняющий свой размер, куб-мост. Их много, все выделяются особым цветом, запомнить легко.

С кубами можно будет взаимодействовать с помощью конвейеров, вентиляторов, прыжковых панелей. Как именно? Можно перемотать вентилятор во времени, чтобы он не сдувал предмет, а притягивал к себе. Так же работает и конвейер, который можно перемотать для доставки предмета в другую сторону.
Благодаря всем этим механикам разработчики создали очень много головоломок, причём каждая новая не похожа на предыдущую.

В игре присутствует глубокий и интересный сюжет. Он гораздо глобальнее сюжета Portal, да и персонажи раскрываются гораздо лучше. В них веришь, за них переживаешь.

Сама игра невероятно красивая. Скажу честно, я никогда не делал так много скриншотов! Буквально почти каждый момент поражает уровнем проработки всего, начиная от освещения и заканчивая расположением предметов в кадре.

Я считаю, что игра стоит каждого вложенного в неё цента, покупайте и проходите с удовольствием!
 
WrierBrake
139 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
14.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 février 2023
I got this because it was from the creators of Portal and looked to be in the same vein. It was an okay game in it's own right, but it was not as good as portal was. The puzzles were fine, some had mildly creative solutions. Keep reading for more detailed description, but ultimately if you like Portal only for the puzzles you might enjoy this. But if you liked Portal because of the story, and the hidden eastereggs and the witty comments, wait for a good sale to get this one. (Honestly, just wait for a sale no matter what)

I see 2 major flaws in the game.

The Entropy gun is only able to work on specific aspects of the puzzle area (specific elements meant to solve the puzzle with, or the occasional broken wall ect.) and this means you have very clear pieces right away. And it's not hard to find what you can use as they all glow with an orange highlight when you aim at them making them easy to spot. This means solving the puzzles is always pretty easy. I never had to look up a solution and the only puzzle that took longer than 3-5 minutes was more or less because I has a hard time making a well placed jump or fall. A solution to this is give free reign over shooting the gun. You can already repair parts of the facility so, let us repair everything. Shoot the grass and nature? It revers grows and its gone. Allow the entire building to be fixed (and give an achievement for it!) Make more thing like the fans that interact with the gun in small meaningless ways but at least give the feel of freedom. And get rid of the orange highlight. This means you can do more with unofficial puzzle solving outside of game rooms, and even have puzzles that should have been more easy, suddenly more difficult because the room is broken in strange ways.

2nd big problem is the story. The story is very lacking and predictable. There's really no mystery and it's pretty obvious whats going on from the start. I'm not looking for deep plot, but at least Portal had GlADOS. Give some kind of antagonist besides literally 2 types of robots I can't even use my cool gun to fight directly, instead having to repeat the same tired reverse their own energy back at them way too much.
 
Ebonsprocket
101 produits enregistrés
3
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 aout 2023
It's Portal in a parallel universe where the mad scientists invented a gun that messes with time, instead of a gun that messes with space. Kind of.

The idea in itself is brilliant.

The physical paradoxes of time travel are much more obvious than the physical paradoxes of portals, though, and I think that limited the devs a bit in terms of gameplay possibilities. Nevertheless, they found a combination that is fun to play.

1.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 aout 2023
Holy S*** is this trivial. If you look up trivial in the dictionary it literally says, don't play Entropy Center cause that's a bad game.

Talos principle has better time rewind mechanics and that is only 1 mechanic in that game, not even core. Here you can't even stand on boxes you rewind. You can walk on broken bridges and stairs though, so its not even consistent. Also hope you like pressing at broken thing to make thing back together cause you do that a lot.

All the puzzles are so mindnumingly easy that I always get the "document" first on accident because I thought that one was supposed to be the normal exit as the rest seemed... trivial. The documents aren't even worth it. The last one was literally "hey tom, could you file these for me? Thx." THAT WAS THE ENTIRE NOTE! Do these people actually know what narrative is? Or a game?

They seem to have looked at portal and tried to stay as close as possible to the formula without actually understanding any of it.

Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2023
Produit remboursé

Update: Changed my review from Not Recommended to Recommended even though I never got this running on my machine. I have modern hardware (a 2070 Super GPU with an AMD Ryzen 7 and 32GB RAM) and followed all the instructions I got from the devs in their discord server but it never worked. I did play this on PS5 and it was a very enjoyable experience. If the game runs on your hardware I recommend it.

I hate to review this negatively but the game wouldn't start at all and crashed my machine. I had to hard-reboot it each time. I asked in the discord and was told to use vista compatibility mode, run exes in admin mode, and disconnect vr systems but nothing worked. It was literally unplayable.

I'm going to get it on my console but I'm really disappointed I couldn't play it on my PC.

How to beat this game. Figure out the last step. Take your intractable to the last step and reset its timer. proceed to go backwards through the steps until your at the first step. Complete the puzzle forwards using the gun to advance the object. It's very boring after like the 6th time you do it, and by puzzle 8 I started feeling like I was wasting my time. I know the average IQ is double digits now but this is baby stuff.

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2022
Очень душная игра. Когда получил достижение за прохождение 9 главы, я решил посмотреть сколько ещё осталось. И увидев, что всего 15 глав, я просто вышел и удалил игру. Неужели нельзя было не растягивать игру? В связи с этим весьма забавно выглядит цель дойти до реактора (у нас может взорваться реактор, его надо отремонтировать, но ты не иди напрямую к нему, а проходи одинаковые головоломки). И в итоге в течении игры постоянно слышишь что-то типа "ты почти дошёл", "ещё немного", "совсем чуть-чуть", а продвижения не ощущается. Очень однообразная игра. Задолбало. Также есть баги, но каких-то критических я не видел. Из плюсов можно отметить саундтрек, говорящую пушку (иногда говорит забавные вещи) и интересную атмосферу. Убрать бы ещё несколько глав, убрать лишние головоломки и получилась бы очень хорошая игра, но не сложилось =(
 
TricksteR
254 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2023
An unpolished game that doesn't trust you to be smart enough to play it.

Every puzzle is introduced with a tutorial explaining what it is and how to solve it. No thought required

Any deviation to that is not allowed, even to the extent where it will introduce mechanics and teach you them, just to remove them later if they would allow you to solve a puzzle in a way they don't want. For example, early on you are taught you can launch objects. Later, when you need to get an object through a barrier the you are not longer able to launch objects over it, seemingly for no reason.

Voice acting is very good, but there's so much clipping in the environmental objects that it becomes distracting

A game that looks the part, but folds under close inspection
 
Red Bobcat
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2022
This game is brilliant, I can't believe it's not more well known.
Portal 2 is a clear inspiration in terms of narration, characters and even musics but they made their own thing and improved on it.
The Portal aesthetics is what drew me to this game in the first place but it quickly became clear that The Entropy Center was unique and able to stand on it's own 2 feet without relying on Portal 2.
Basically you have to solve puzzle using your Entropy Device, which allows you to "rewind" time for objects and/or scenery. There is a story and it's very well-paced and the ending in particular was amazing and really well thought.
If they're able to improve upon the sequel as Valve did for Portal 2, the sequel might be the new best puzzle/narration game.

In the meantime, if you liked Portal, don't hesitate to buy it.
 
Ashley

Évaluation publiée le 6 novembre 2022
The Entropy Centre

Pretty decent game, like first Portal, but with time-gun instead of portal-gun.
Mysterious environment, puzzles to solve, nice narrative AI, everything is cool.
Beautiful graphics and music soundtrack makes The Entropy Centre a very nice game.

I'd like to have in The Entropy Centre multiplayer like in Portal 2.

Well done game!
Enjoy!
 
👾 Sir_Fred 👾

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 aout 2023
Okay so I've barely played this, but let me tell you how my initial experience went:
1. I walk through an abandoned facility, very reminiscent of Portal but with terminal entries to find. All good so far.
2. I find that some old-looking rubble is blocking my path. The corridor probably collapsed ages ago, but at the very least it must have been before I was within hearing range as I wandered through these easily-echoing halls. I would imagine it was around the same time that the ceiling began to crack and the plants began to grow.
3. I enter a room with a sealed-off chamber, hit a button to unseal the chamber, and wait patiently for 10-20 seconds as a mounted gun does something sciencey
4. I enter the unsealed chamber and press a button on the mount, whereby the gun lights up and talks for 20-30 seconds, introducing itself before explaining that it can rewind an object up to 38 seconds into its past.
5. I then walk out of the chamber, walk out of the room and rewind the rubble that was blocking my path, until it reforms itself as a structurally sound section of corridor.

Can you tell where something went wrong?

I get that the "38 second limit" explanation was a lore-friendly way to excuse Unity engine's limitations when it comes to tracking past positions of objects I mess with, but the game has contradicted itself less than 15 minutes in. I'll probably take another crack at it later since I admire mindbending puzzle games like Portal/Antichamber/Superliminal, but it sure gave a weak first impression
 
Alpine Imposter
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
8.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 novembre 2022
My issues with the game are as follows:

Bad puzzles. The puzzles simply were not very challenging. I'm not some sort of puzzle solving God or anything, but for about 70% of the game I was able to solve each puzzle in a matter of literal seconds after taking inventory of what tools I had access to and learning what every button and switch did. This game also has a serious problem with reusing solutions. Many puzzles have solutions that are virtually identical to previous puzzles. There must have been a dozen incredibly minor variations on "put the box in a couple locations in sequence, then rewind it".

Inconsistent mechanics. Rewinding usually undoes any movement on an object...except when it doesn't. Batteries and crushable boxes instead revert their physical state only. Fall damage doesn't exist in this game...except when it does. You can fall from very high up to no effect but a much smaller fall later will kill you (and this isn't just about jumping out of the map into obviously out of bounds areas, were talking short drops to sections with switches and stuff that would imply you can go there). There is no consistent logic behind what you can even use your rewind powers on. A bridge naturally collapses? Hop on the rubble and rewind yourself up! A button-powered moving platform on the other hand? Absolutely not, it can ONLY move when the button is pressed and cannot be rewound. Despite having an exact copy of Portal's blue energy field that deletes boxes which touch it, the game chose not to put one after each puzzle room like Portal did. So what happens if you sneak a box out of a room? It just magically vanishes anyway. One of the first things shown in the tutorial is that you can pick up objects and launch them, but then you'll quickly discover that you actually CAN'T launch any of the boxes used for solving puzzles! You can't even stand on top of most types of boxes despite them having perfectly flat surfaces, your character just slips off. None of these things are explained or addressed in any way in the game.

Severe lack of polish. You can easily softlock a lot of puzzles and there isn't even a menu option to restart, you have to exit to main menu. At one point while exploring for secrets by simply walking around, I stumbled into an area that was outright missing a wall, opening to an out of bounds void. There was even an elevator you ride at one point that was just put in the game backwards, with support struts facing out into thin air instead of to the wall. Besides that there is a ton of clipping.

Lack of originality. I usually get annoyed when every single first person puzzle game is described as "like Portal!" but this time it's true. In fact, almost every single sub-mechanic from Portal 2 is copied directly into the Entropy Centre. Even the setting is the same: a ruined and long abandoned purpose built facility for puzzle solving made of white tiled rooms with overgrown plants everywhere. You primarily interact with the world by moving boxes around and firing your sci-fi energy gun that has a wisecracking ai companion attached to it. It really does feel like a Portal 2 mod or fan made expansion.

Combat. It's terrible and there's too much of it.

Miscellaneous frustrations. Your gun can shoot a projectile that deletes rewind data from objects. For some utterly inexplicable reason, this projectile is inaccurate and has random spread, which makes shooting anything that isn't point blank very annoying. Bouncy boxes cannot be bounced on while midair. If you fully rewind one to a grounded state, for some reason it is considered to be midair still, so if you don't remember to also hit the "end rewind" button, you'll jump down and land with a thud, then have to redo everything in the room to get back up and try again.

Overall this game was disappointing and not worth the price.
 
The_Breakshift
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Non recommandé
0.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 novembre 2022
If you gonna copy Portal expect to be compared to it.

From the get go the game feels reaaaally cheap. Like someone did it as a pet project. The graphics look outdated like even Half Life 2 and Portal have better graphics and sound FX. The menu, the the textures the physical objects you interact with. All feel like free art taken from a community workshop.

The story is bland and uninspired "Oh, something horrible has happened and you're the only living human in this lab, now you gotta do puzzles to get out". Seen it 1000 times.

The mechanics sounds like they should be fun - you have a gun that can reverse time but its so boxed into what objects you can interact with that it kinda feels like a point & click game. "Click and hold on this and you can continue forward. Great, now click & hold on this" After merely 20 minutes of this I was bored to hell with it.

It's a good game - if you've never played anything better but still if you havent - just go play Portal. It's 1000 times better.
 
Denny Crane - TPF -

Vidéo YouTube™: The Entropy Centre - УПРАВЛЯЕМ ВРЕМЕНЕМ [Обзор / Первый взгляд на русском] 
Vues : 212
👻 Страшные Истории на Ночь с Зоди: https://youtube.com/HorrorZodi 💘 Паблик ВК: https://vk.com/playzodi_official_group 🚀 Куратор в Стиме: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34175412-PlayZodi/ 🎮...


The Entropy Centre - головоломка с видом от первого лица, в которой мы получим способность управлять временем. Игра очень похожа на Portal, это ощущается сразу же. По сюжету, мы просыпаемся в неизвестном месте, в котором больше никого нет, кроме искусственного интеллекта. Мы выясняем, что наша задача - проходить испытания, решая головоломки. Для этого мы получаем специальную пушку, способную отматывать время назад...
Геймплей, опять-таки, схож с уже упомянутой игрой - ходим, решаем головоломки, пытаемся понять, что случилось. Выглядит и звучит игра отлично, управление удобное (играл на геймпаде). Рекомендую.

First up, it looks fantastic. I think it was developed by one person, so big props.
Its WAY to easy tho, nearly every puzzle can be solved in 30 seconds and on the first try. The story is kinda predictable but still good. I would not recommend buying it for the full price, its just not worth it. If you want hard puzzles like portal, this is not the game for you. If you want the same feeling of story telling like in portal, then this is the game for you.

Also, no easter eggs, so dont even search for any.

Évaluation publiée le 3 novembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

FULL REVIEW + SCORES

At its best, first-person sci-fi puzzle adventure game, The Entropy Centre, shines as brightly and mind-bendingly as did the original Portal, its phenomenal sequel, The Talos Principle, and other great puzzle-centric games of the last decade plus.

At its worst, well... *insert clip of game-breaking bug*

Let’s just say that The Entropy Centre likes to get in its own way, often undermining its intense, at-times fascinating plot with forced humor, or compromising its occasionally brilliant puzzle solutions with clunky platforming sections and poor optimization.

It’s not all bad, but it’s certainly not all good.

STORY
  • Plot – 4/5
  • Characters – 3/5
  • Dialogue – 2/5
GAMEPLAY
  • Combat – 3/5
  • Non-Combat – 3/5
  • UI – 3/5
  • Playability – 2/5
CONTENT
  • World – 3/5
  • Objectives – 3/5
  • Bosses – N/A
  • Puzzles – 5/5!
  • Value – 3/5
STYLE
  • Visuals – 4/5
  • Music – 3/5
  • Sound – 3/5

Explanations in video:
Vidéo YouTube™: THE ENTROPY CENTRE – Great Fun... Until it Isn't | Complete Review (Spoiler-Free) 
Vues : 2,665
The Entropy Centre is, in most ways, a poor man's Portal. The premise is alarmingly similar, the dialogue is weaker, the mechanics are less interesting, and the bugs are more game-breaking.
. Cheers!
 
MEGA the micro
85 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
12.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

Definitely inspired by portal. Most of the mechanics and game structure are extremely similar to the point where I think the devs commit idea fraud. However, I really like portal so I'm glad I got to experience something so similar again.

The puzzles had very repetitive solutions. The devs need to understand that after an hour of the game, we know that one cube can be used in two or more places. Instead of the new mechanics changing the solution, you just end up doing the same solution but with different objects. for example, instead of there being one cube and two pressure plates, theres one lazer cube that triggers two lazer receptors. because of this repetitive pattern, I found every puzzle very easy. I think the main problem is that the rewind mechanic is limited and therefore its hard to do things with it. "you can move things without touching them" seems to be the extent of the ability.

Im glad that aria didnt get many lines, it made me cringe, loved astra tho. E was a fun character but there really wasn't much telling me why they were a good robot, and they weren't utilised a lot.

The story was interesting enough for me to spend time looking around at all the computers but the ending wasn't brilliant. Its cool that its a time loop and everything but usually with time loop stories, you should make it so that aria is trying to find a way out of the loop in some way. she just seems to accept that this is her life now. Also, I don't really get the ghosts and the writing on the wall, she has no memory of the loop so she isn't insane enough to write all that stuff, nor does she have time.

I think a good addition would be to have aria realise she's in a loop, add one to the tally mark, then try to find a way to stop it once and for all.

regardless of this, they managed to make a fully fledged game that was good enough for me to play all the way through to the end and I think its incredible that small studios are able to do things like this.

but yeah, interesting to study the game design, not too fun for paying customers.

also thanks for donating to the jingle jam everyone!
 
Sambamuel
275 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2023
Box and Button Based Testing: The Videogame

I feel bad for all of the environment/asset artists that make this game shine visually when the gameplay designers refused to make a decent game out of all that care and love. its such a shame really.

This game is aggressively mediocre. the graphisk and lore is well presented but the voiced protagonist is stupid and poorly acted [always sounds childishly stupid and fails to put together things the audience has with the same amnt of information], as well as the puzzles being very poor. all of the puzzles are extremely simple but rely on the most painfully tedious method to 'solve' them. this is the kind of 'solve' where you know exactly what to do and the entire time you are just fighting the needlessly obtuse mechanics to complete them. the most challenging part of the game is figuring out where you need to hover a box for 10 seconds before you sit and watch it float around the room. the only margin for error is doing things in the wrong order, or worse rewinding 1 nanosecond too long so you have to do everything over again.

its just so un fun and lame. theres never the wheres-waldo style pause other similar games give you. you never have to sit and analyze the room to figure out the solution. its just painting by numbers and the annoying mc and nonsensical environment design leave a lot to be desired. I cant even really recommend you get it on sale- play portal if you havent, if you have play cube. if you have played both then join me in suffering land as we accept that games like this will never be as good as the things that have come before them.

ps: the physics in this game are ASS and SO MANY puzzles rely on them. the bounce pads have a 50/50 chance to flip themselves over or cancel all momentum when you use them. what the ♥♥♥♥ is the point? if you are going to rip off pretty much every tertiary mechanic from portal (cube/button based testing, hard light bridges, bounce pads, laser cubes, emancipation grids... seriously, all taken wholesale from portal) at least have the decency to do it well, for the love of god.

anyone rating this game positively is so dazzled by the eyecandy that they fail to see how poorly this game measures up to its contemporaries- or they just never played them. portal came out in 2007 and this fails to come anywhere close to that in its puzzles. portal 2 came out in 2011 and similarly fails to match up to the environmental story telling and characters that game brought to the table. its just the worst game in its own genre and it deserves 100% of this criticism by ripping those games off so blatantly. do not buy for any amount of money.
 
Virtual_Bĭch
894 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2023
Oof, I really wanted to recommend this game. There is a lot to like - the premise is fun and imaginative, the graphics are great, Aria and Astra are great, and the fact that this was made almost entirely by one guy is an astounding achievement that I greatly admire. However, the game is let down by one rather major flaw: The puzzles aren't fun.

Solving the puzzles is much akin to long division - formulaic, tedious, and requiring concentration without creativity. Almost every puzzle can be solved with a formula: Figure out which gizmo connects to which widget, find out which order the gizmos need to activate in, then do it backwards.
Sadly, the hardest part of the puzzles isn't the solving, it's the execution. Each puzzle requires a precise series of steps to set up and then execute, and if you mistime a jump, or as is annoyingly common, the game stutters at a crucial moment, it means tediously gathering all the puzzle elements and starting again from square 1.

By the four hour mark the game was most definitely a chore, not helped by the poor pacing whereby the games middle act drags on for hours with almost no plot development or interesting lore at all. I continued on because I wanted to learn more about the Entropy Center and experience the story, but I think I'm going to have to call it quits and just watch the rest on YouTube.

Still, there is a lot to love about this game, and ultimately I don't regret buying it, even if I just can't recommend it.
 
not madattak
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Non recommandé
11.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 janvier 2023
99.9% of the game's budget went into looking pretty. The puzzles from start to finish are an absolute joke. The puzzle designers were either not intelligent enough to design an actually challenging puzzle or they intentionally dumbed them down to kindergarten level to attempt to appeal to a wider audience.

I had way more fun in this game just breaking its flimsy physics system and skipping half the puzzles with the bounce pads.

Would not recommend if you're looking for a puzzle game, this felt more like an obstacle course.
 
Mcshuggets
181 produits enregistrés

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
3.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2023
It was almost a tie on whether I enjoyed this game. There was clearly a lot of detail put into the level building and 3D modeling, but the core mechanic of the game is extremely simple and grows repetitive fast. The tie-breaker was the constant obnoxious dialogue you're subjected to between the character and her gun every minute or so. It feels like the game designers gave up halfway, and instead of adding more lore building in the world, they had to shove it in your face with overly obvious and pointless dialogue.

Обычная игра-головоломка. Достаточно сложная местами и приходиться думать. Если кратко, игра для тех кто любит головоломки. Полноценный обзор на сайте wol.su
 
Coup de Grâce [wol.su]
485 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2023
I really hate that I have to give this a negative review. It's a lovely concept for a game, and it's lovely to look at from a distance. However, the deeper you get into it, it becomes clear that the development team are way too ambitious for what they can actually accomplish.

In line with the gameplay itself, they feel like they design most puzzles backwards. They create the problem, and then make a solution for it. They take many shortcuts which cheapen the experience, and seem far too confident in their physics system which is not exactly cut out for the job they are asking of it.

The story as well, while engaging, is very predictable and cheap, and can easily be guessed before any of it really happens. Any remaining secrets or questions are not actually addressed, and it more becomes a medium of exploring the nuances of the situation you're already in, rather than any investigation of how you got here, or any way to resolve it.

In all, if you just want a puzzle game without having to think too much, this game can do it well. But if you want to actually focus and think about the intricacies, the base game may frustrate you more than it helps.
 
Jijonbreaker

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
Hello, greetings so this might be a thumbs down. Personally i enjoyed alot of the puzzles but atlas... No real world building, BEANS subplot maybe? Where is our bad guy? Where is our resolution?! Even if the story goes as it does, why are there not more interations with our companions? Where is the character building why SHOULD I CARE ABOUT MY COMPANIONS AND YOUR GAME IF YOU AINT BUILDING IT?!
TBH To make it short and sweet
Gameplay solid 7/10.
Story 3/10 -
Note: No real characters, no real story honestly redo the story part and update the game it was a sad excuse for a game when the oppertunity is there like come on.
Visual 8/10 Stunning as all hell nice environment but but fix the gun please ugly af.

TBH if you are looking at this play the game but prepare to suffer for like min an hour on puzzles that are sub par at the end, alot of empty world character wise and super predicatble story if you played anything in the genre, you could have made it shorter and more well thought out... last bit was not nessecary. But thanks for the content even if you have to slave through it... Loved it Hated it Never going to play it again no replayablity execpt speedrunning but not going to bother.

Buy it. Play it. Put it on the shelf.
Thats it folks...

Évaluation publiée le 5 novembre 2022
When you try to copy a much better game, maybe not do it THIS blatantly? Swapping portals to a time reversal gun is not exactly huge change, when the gameplay, jokes and the setting is pretty much the same. When I play your game I don't want to think of Portal constantly, because I'd then just go and play Portal. I would've much more easily accepted this game 5-7 years ago, when portal-inspired indie games where all over the place and even then they mostly were inspired, not THIS similar, but now it's just kinda sad.

Vidéo YouTube™: GAYET GÜZEL! The Entropy Centre Türkçe 
Vues : 532
Tersten düşünün. İmkânsızı zekânızla alt edin. Nesneleri zamanda geri alarak usta işi, karmaşık bulmacalar çözdüğünüz akıl almaz birinci şahıs macerası.
 
Elder Games
533 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
9.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier
Good FPS Puzzler probably inspired by Portal

I loved both Portal games and both Talos Principle games and found The Entropy Centre to be a good game, in the same likenesses of these other titles, that I could complete in around 8 hours.

The puzzles were for the most part easily accomplished after one or two attempts but I still came away with a good feeling of accomplishment and when I came across a couple of the more demanding puzzles I felt that I had worked for it.

The story is good, again think Talos Principle 2 or either of the Portal games. It has a good amount of mystery that makes you want to search for extra information to build the storytelling. I especially liked it when the story gave a touch of atmosphere that really drew me in the first few times I came across ghosts I got the same feeling that I got playing Into the Radius .

On my fairly good spec PC (10th Gen i7, 3070, 32Gb DDR4) the game ran flawlessly.

Overall if you like accessible puzzlers (Portal not Myst...) give The Entropy Centre a go its a good one.
 
Willbola

⣿⣯⣿⣬⡹⡄⣽⢻⣷⣾⣻⣿⣾⠹⣿⣿⣿⣷⣿⣿⢻⣿⣿⣟⢿⣫⡿⠿⠟⠿⠛⣟⣻⣿⠿⠿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡾⢽⡿⣿⣿⡿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣾⣿⣿⣿

⣷⣧⣾⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣾⣂⡶⣚⣿⣟⣿⣿⣧⣏⣻⡿⠗⣾⣿⣿⣿⣯⣿⣿⣿⣿⣽⣿⠃⠀⠀⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⣿⣧⣿⣿

5/10
Took until act 4 until I actually had to think about a puzzle and not just solve it right away.
That one only took me 3 minutes
Right after that one puzzle it was right back to easy puzzles
not until act 7 do they get hard
It is a fun game, buttt… all the best parts are just stolen
Wow they stole SOOOOOO much from the portal franchise
Female protagonist with female AI doing the talking and insulting you from time to time
Only birds in this game are crows
Talking tech gun
Laser cube
Companion cube
Faith plates
Treadmill parts
You cant swim
can survive any fall! how? we dont know? never skins leg day?
Malfunctions robots that want to kill you and may or may not be sentient
The list just goes on and on and on
push pull airways.
every good idea in this game is just stolen from portal and a little bit janky
even stole strait up puzzle rooms out of portal
this games got them NO FAITH plates. annnnd im launched off the side of the edge again.
Jump platforms are tiny as hell
Jump plates move when jumped on
Huge pre setup for puzzle with tiny mistakes killing everything
Now im at the point where you solve the puzzle right away but the setup is a ♥♥♥♥♥ and a half with no room for error and you miss the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ jump panel so its back to part 1
Have fun doing the same puzzle 10+ times because you fall short by 1 second……
Enemy bots can fire at you through walls….
grow shrink cardboard boxes are AWFUL!!!! and janky as hell
Do i think you should play this game? Yes
But heres a list of games you should play first that are far more fun



https://store.steampowered.com/app/280740/Aperture_Tag_The_Paint_Gun_Testing_Initiative/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/317400/Portal_Stories_Mel/

Mr. MahMOOD
129 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 janvier
First off, I normally don't write game reviews so the fact I am speaks volumes.
Where do I even start with this game? I absolutely loved playing this in terms of both gameplay and story.
Gameplay was challenging, sometimes frustrating, but it felt soo good once you had an idea of the solution. I played through Portal 2 and the mechanics are similar enough to pick up, but still distinct to make you think through things in a different way. Also like Portal 2, there were sequences where the facility just started crumbling apart around you and you had to use it to your advantage or react in time to save your skin, which I really loved seeing in another game. Only issues I really had was that the physics would sometimes wonk out and mess me up, even if I had the exact right solution, and sometimes the entropy device took a few tries or some readjusting to actually be able to shoot what I was looking at.
Story-wise, I fell hard for this. Normally, I get fed up with time-travel because of all the paradoxes and what-not, but the Entropy Center seems to take this into account not just in your main storyline, but in the worldbuilding done around the facility through the intel. Speaking of, I love the way the worldbuilding was executed. Majority comes from various emails and messages you'll find on computers around the facility, but you also run into presentations and whiteboards showing off the major plot for those that don't want to inspect every computer they come across. The emails though were very realistic so to speak, like you had some of people discussing their issues with work and going through crises over some of the consequences of that work and you also had a chain of people replying "Cat." to a serious work email involving a cat. Aside from that, once the story starting approaching the Big Reveal, it felt like a payoff. It wasn't exactly an obvious twist, but one you could logically come to given the mechanics of the game and it just felt like all the little unexplained pieces so far just clicked as you got up to it.
Overall, new fave for me and if you like puzzle games or especially if you liked Portal 2, I highly recommend this!

Геймплейно игра реально классная, чем-то похожа на смесь Singularity (фишка со-временем) и Portal (геймдизайном и атмосферой). А вот сюжет и наполненность локации в игре, крайне расстроили, если в том же Portal'е, проходя одну локацию за другой ты не на секунду не сомневаешься в происходящем, то здесь данная мысль проскакивает достаточно часто. Но эта не значит, что на игру нужно ставить красный крест, ведь игра действительно привносит что-то геймплейно новое в свой жанр)
P.s. Как говорится, спасибо разработчикам за возможность перепройти Portal 2 :DDD

Ele é facilmente um dos melhores jogos na pegada de Portal que já joguei. Sabe como e quando introduzir novas mecânicas, valoriza os fundamentos estipulados no começo do título e tenta diferenciar em alguns segmentos para fugir da mesmice.
Pouco menos de 10h de gameplay quebrando a cabeça e quase ficando frustrado, mas a experiência valeu muito a pena e, sem dúvidas, The Entropy Centre é um dos melhores jogos que joguei no ano até agora.
 
JohnnyH
317 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
10.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier
Excellent game, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a puzzle game in a similar style to Portal. Some elements are certainly heavily inspired by Portal, but the game manages to do something interesting and different with them. The story is more heartfelt and mysterious than you might expect. The characters are likeable and the writing features a few cheesy jokes but it was so much better than I would expect from what's primarily a puzzle game.

I think there are about 75 formal 'test chambers', with new puzzle elements introduced about every 5, and there are transition sections between some of them that have mild time pressure and/or enemies along with more puzzles. There are also some optional collectables which contain more story information, I did my best to find them all and only got about 2/3rds so that's definitely something to look out for if you like that kind of thing.

It took me about 10 hours to complete and while I didn't find any of the challenges overly difficult they were still very engaging and satisfying to solve. The game doesn't use too many moving parts at once so it's not too difficult to keep track of the different timelines of all the movable objects. I've not even touched the level editor and community content, where I'm sure there's a lot of much harder puzzles if that's what you're looking for.

Ran fine on my (now quite old) i5/GTX1060 PC on Ultra, only a few minor stutters when loading large areas, and the game looks great. Didn't encounter any bugs and only very minor physics engine jank, which comes with the territory for a physics puzzler really.

Considering the very small dev team on this, it's an extremely impressive effort to be on the same level as Portal. I'll be looking forward to any kind of follow up or other games by the studio.

Overall, definitely worth full price if you enjoy puzzle games, and I would recommend it to anyone considering it when on sale.



 
TheGingerHiccup

Recommandé
11.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 janvier
Overall good puzzle game. Def inspired by Portal and similar games.

Compared to something like Portal, this felt a little less polished and more janky. Some of the solutions I came up with for the puzzles left me wondering if I found the "true" solution, or if I'd somehow cheesed through.

Interesting story - the terminals that you'll find scattered throughout the game help flesh out what is going on.

Ran great on my PC. Steam Deck performed well too once I had the settings dialed in.

Якісна 3D-головоломка. Явні паралелі до Portal 2, що ніяким чином не шкодить цій грі. Головоломки можуть бути досить складними, але підхід до всіх однаковий - відтвори очікувані події в зворотному порядку. В грі присутні з десяток різних механік, але (на щастя) в кожній конктретній задачі механік не більше п'яти. Сюжет ОК, є трохи гумору в діалогах. Рекомендую любителям головоломок.

Elemental Paladin
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
7.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2023
Après avoir lu certains avis le qualifiant d'héritier/successeur à Portal, je m'attendais à mieux.
Ça y ressemble au début, on enchaîne joyeusement les salles de tests. Et puis on s'aperçoit qu'il s'agit de puzzles simples mais fastidieux, répétés ad nauseam.
Il y a beaucoup d'autres choses à redire, que ce soit au niveau du level-design peu crédible hors salle de test, des environnements génériques, des collisions pétées, de la "liberté" que le jeu t'offre en te sortant des salles de tests pour t'y renvoyer aussitôt, le sentiment d'urgence que le jeu instaure tout en te forçant à faire différentes salles de test pénibles, etc.
Donc bof. C'est moyen, ça ressemble vite fait à du Portal, mais c'est trop long, pénible et incohérent.
Le jeu a été développé par une seule personne, je salue le travail accompli, mais je ne peux pas recommander l'expérience.
 
eData
465 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2023
Rätsel retten die Welt

Wir sind Aria Adams, Puzzle-Agent beim Entropy Centre. Wir erwachen in einen Raum und können uns an nichts mehr erinnern. Dann lernen wir die künstliche Intelligenz ASTRA kennen. Sie erzählt uns das wir Rätsel lösen müssen, um die Menschheit zu retten...

Das Spiel erstreckt sich über 15 Abschnitte. In jeden Areal kommt eine Mechanik dazu. Die Locations sind abwechslungsreich und sehen nicht immer nach einem Labor mit weißen Wänden aus. Der Fokus im gesamten Spiel liegt auf der Zeit. Durch Nachrichten am Computer oder Präsentationen erzählt sich die Handlung. Es lässt sich gut auf das aktuelle Weltgeschehen projizieren. Man versteht die Idee hinter dieser Firma.

Wenn ihr Spaß an Portal oder Superliminal hattet, dann werdet ihr auch hiermit eure Freude haben. Man merkt das sich die Entwickler am großen Vorbild von Valve orientierten, aber trotzdem ist es etwas eigenes. Die Rätsel können herausfordernd sein. Außerdem gibt es einen Level-Editor. Man kann seiner Fantasie freien Lauf lassen und sich an den Kreationen der Community messen.
 
Sirius
222 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2023
For an 8 hour run time it really felt padded with too many simple and/or similar feeling puzzles. sometimes you;d be in a room with a 'new mechanic' but the solution is once again:
Place block on pad that open exit
Place block on pad that does thing (extends bridge)
Rewind block to pas that opens exit after crossing bridge

The game should have cut these to bring down the runtime or replaced them with more head scratchers. the game has them, the devs were capable, but not enough to make the run time feel worthwhile.

Overall: It's okay.
 
HurricaneOf87

Recommandé
8.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2023
The game is good, but has its flaws. It's too much, I wouldn't say even Portal 1, because even there half of the game was applying what we learned in puzzle rooms outside of them, and here, it's all puzzle rooms. Not counting small sections at the start/end of the chapters, it's all puzzle rooms. Instead of "learn, learn, learn, apply what you learned to traverse enviroment in an organic way", it's "puzzle x4, traverse one room/outside area, puzzle x4, traverse..." and so on for 15 chapters. Don't get me wrong, the game is fine, but around chapter 10 it becomes tedious, even though each chapter has new puzzle elements.

Habe den ersten Run ca. nach 12,5-13h beendet. 

Story 10/5! 
Charaktere 5/5
Gespräche 5/5
Puzzle 3/5

Die Puzzles sind gut gemacht, aber nicht allzu schwer.

Am meisten habe ich mich in die Story verliebt und die Möglichkeit, sich in manchen Arealen etwas umzusehen. Hier hätte ich mir etwas mehr Backstory oder Hinterbleibsel gewünscht als nur die E-Mails. 
Wie war das für andere Operatoren und wie war es sonst im Center? 

Gib dem Spiel gerne 5/5 Sterne. Die Entwickler haben sich echt Mühe gegeben und es hat mich oft, besonders wegen des Humors von Astra, an Portal erinnert.

st2s
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
6.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
Visually stunning but lacking identity.

Entropy Centre is a game that is heavily inspired by portal. It's incredibly obvious. But is it good?

The main plot follows Aria whom has woken up in a facility alone. The game then presents the main goal of the game. The earth has had a calamity and you need to complete puzzles using a time rewinding device to generate energy to reverse said cataclysmic event.

One of the strongest parts of this game is its theming, it's story and the visuals. Honestly I hope that if we ever get a Portal 3 it looks halfway near as good as this game. Some areas are just a spectacle to behold. The game also constantly reminds you of your goal both directly and indirectly as the Earth is in full view looming over the facility (Which is on the moon) as the shockwaves hit areas of the facility causing damage to areas as you progress. It gives that same looming threat feeling as something like the moon in Majoras mask and it's just great. Without spoiling any of the story, some of the beats here are really fun with some little revelations along the way. I honestly prefer the overarching story here to what is presented in either portal game. Character wise, the few characters you encounter and leftover memoirs are engaging and enjoyable with the Entropy gun and the main character having some fun dialog to break things up.

One place where I do feel the game falls a bit flatter is in its decision to look so similar to portal as well as directly lifting a number of elements. Whilst the facility is overgrown, it's a lot of white walls with some damage to it akin to Portal 2. Honestly I wish the game distanced itself a little more in this regard and went with more interesting environments which at times do pop up. Portal had a reason for looking the way it did whereas this game doesn't need to in order to communicate interactivity to the player. In regards to gameplay, a lot of elements seem copy and pasted. Cubes, light bridges, fans that push and pull you, bouncing areas (Gel) laser cubes and turrets. It doesn't feel very fresh and I really wanted the game to do something more. A stand out for me is the transforming gates and conveyors which felt much more unique to this game as well as their interactions.

Most of the puzzles generally revolve around moving a block of some kind in reverse of what you need and then playing through the level reversing what you did with said block. I feel like puzzle diversity is something that is lacking here which is largely due to the entropy gun having the single utility. It also meant that for me personally, the puzzles were generally quite easy with only a few around the 10th chapter or so providing much challenge. I think if the game perhaps mixed up the elements more or gave more utility to the entropy gun it would have allowed for more puzzle diversity such as being able to throw cubes or be able to fast forward objects or having more to interact with. By no means are the puzzles bad and some people may get more out of it than me but overall they're probably the weakest part of the game.

All in all I commend the solo developer that made the game. I think they made a really well polished, well presented game with an engaging plot and characters and a really nifty mechanic. I just hope that any future projects provide more innovative gameplay so that the gameplay can be more interesting and engaging.
 
PKblaze
1,085 produits enregistrés
0

Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
Si j'ai bien compris le jeu a été développé (hors QA/trad/voix/...) par un seul dev et si c'est bien le cas c'est déjà incroyable. Bravo pour le travail incroyable qui a été fait !

Pour commencer le jeu est plutôt beau et je n'ai eut à déplorer que quelques petits bug mineur de collision.
La mécanique pour remonter le temps marche techniquement très bien cependant il y a un énorme point noir : les 3-4 1ères heure de jeux sont pas terrible et représente un espèce de tutoriel sauf que c'est beaucoup trop long et répétitif (au point que j'ai hésiter à désinstaller le jeu ce qui aurait été dommage vu la suite).
J'ai regarder d'autres commentaires négatifs qui allaient dans ce sens et je pense que couper le jeu d'une partie de son début n'aurait pas fait de mal.
Après ce pénible début, le jeu tient bien son rythme et est plutôt cool quoi qu'un peut simple pour les connaisseurs du genre.

En vrac on a :
une mécanique de reboot temporel un peut répétitif, il faudrait p-e une autre mécanique pour casser çà (pouvoir ré-avancer dans le temps ???)
des mécaniques environnemental/de cube (à la portal) différents
de la destruction d'environnement (très bien faites mais reste un gimmick)
une partie "shoot" oubliable
un peut de plateforme (un peut relou lorsque l'on foire son saut et que l'on doit tout replacer)

Avec tous ces éléments il y a une bonne base pour une suite/préquel/autre jeu.
A surveiller

Concrete
1,067 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
30.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
This game is, to me, a masterpiece of game mechanics and writing. The mechanics are extremely fun and often make one feel like the smartest person to ever exist. The level design is rarely a tiny bit wonky, such as with certain rewinds crushing you in the process or springboards that are misaligned a tiny bit. I will admit that I saw several potential ways to break the game that were closed off by an invisible wall, which felt disappointing, but it does show that the developers cared a lot about quality control. One thing I have to point out is some of the chase sequences are slightly annoying because of the fact that they require either foreknowledge of what will happen or a lot of quick thinking to complete. I enjoy the addition of the puzzle elements to the chase sequences, but unfortunately the deaths really clashed with the break-neck high intensity pacing. It's a problem a lot of chase sequences have, so I can't fault the devs for not doing it perfectly.

The puzzle design is fantastic and I enjoyed all of them quite a bit. A lot of the later ones become increasingly fiendish. It really made me feel like I was fighting to get a correct solution so I could complete the main objective, and I enjoyed the rush of finding the solution and executing it. One thing I appreciated a lot is that the devs didn't increase the difficulty simply by adding length or complexity. The difficulty scaling relied entirely on new mechanics and finding ways to combine them and novel ways to use them. The puzzles that took me nearly 30 minutes to solve can be solved in less than 5 minutes, given one knows the solution. There is very little "excess" or bloating in the design, and I appreciate that a lot. The game respects one's time.

The story will not satisfy everyone. There are many people who are unhappy with the fact that the ending does not make a judgement as to what the optimal solution for the plot is. It doesn't hold the player's hand and guide them to a specific conclusion. It's purposefully ambiguous as to whether Aria makes the right choice, whether the loop is infinite or is coming to a crashing halt soon, how much is real and how much is a hallucination. The staff make judgements of people who don't fix their mistakes and yet they exhibit those very same behaviours themselves.

The take-away, in my opinion, is very nuanced. There isn't a definite answer, there isn't a simple solution, and the story is about someone who's doing her best to face an incredible challenge with the limited knowledge available to her. There are people in the story judging from the sidelines who criticise others for making the exact mistakes they do, which points out that learning and changing is difficult at best.

One thing I think the ending is quite clear about is the nobility of Aria's persistence and hope that she can still fix things. Even though she finds many, many signs throughout the game that the problem is impossible to solve, she keeps trying and keeps working to find a way to save everyone. At the end she's fully aware that she's been through an eternity of trying and that she might be resigning herself to a further eternity. She's literally so persistent she's outlasting a self-repairing megastructure on the moon because she refuses to give up hope. This game is very much a psychological horror game, and perhaps follows the format of a Greek tragedy where the protagonist has a "flaw" that dooms them, but not even experiencing the horror or knowing that she has an astronomically small chance of success stops her from trying. Aria knows that given an infinite universe, even something seemingly impossible is just waiting for its turn to happen.

The ending is very sad and feels hopeless, but I think a hero like Aria is admirable because she's willing to do anything and everything to reach her goal.

This is why I love the ending. It's nuanced. It's personal. It's hopeful and morose and terrifying all at once. I think the writers did a fantastic job.
 
RoughLeaf

Игровой компаньон заставляет улыбаться на протяжении всей игры)

Recensione di The Entropy Centre

PRO:
+ Narrativa affascinante, coinvolgente e ♥♥♥ un importante messaggio di fondo.
+ Buon ritmo di gioco e ottima varietà di puzzle ed enigmi.
+ Difficoltà ben calibrata e mai frustrante.
+ Musiche sempre piacevoli.

CONTRO:
- Generale mancanza di originalità.

VOTO:
8.5/10

633 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
9.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 décembre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

It's very refreshing to have a Portal-esque puzzle game, without being blatantly a ripoff! It takes several elements from Portal (the test chambers, the use of cube, button platforms), but brings in several of its own elements into the mix, making it feel more like a spiritual spin-off.
And ontop of that has an actually interesting story, making you question a lot of things, making you think.
Test chambers are very doable, I only struggled with like, 1-2 where I had to look up help, but they were all smart, and beatable in no more than 5-10 minutes!
Highly recommended for any Portal, or puzzle in general fan out there!

Sidenote: I wouldve absolutely purchased this game no problem haha
 
Kevinerino
598 produits enregistrés

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
8.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2023
A good puzzle platformer much in the spirit of Portal.

It can get a bit frustrating since the entire premise is setting up your sequence and then rewinding things but it does a good job of introducing you to the mechanics so you get used to it gradually. Sometimes you realize you missed a step and you have to rebuild that sequence though. None of them are too long and complicated to point where you'll be redoing it more than a few times. I think everything I solved was under 10 minutes with the exception of a few. Definitely challenging but not frustrating. The platforming pieces can also be a problem if you miss a jump and such and have to go back again.

The story is pretty good as well. It seems pretty bland at first but around chapter 5 it really picks up and you start to see what makes it interesting.

Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

If you enjoy Portal, you'll enjoy The Entropy Centre. It's clear inspiration comes from Portal, but with different mechanics. Great story telling, lovable characters and pretty good visuals. Got 7 hours of playtime out of the main story, got this in a collection, so kinda for free.

My only real critique is that the mechanics don't seem consistent all of the time. Sometimes you repair something and it stays there, other times it breaks after you have fixed it, seemed a bit random. Other than that, great game. 9/10

Definitely inspired by Portal but the mechanics are different enough and work very well in that it doesn't feel too derivative. The world is also interesting in how the puzzles work into the story.
Puzzles themselves are fun, though sometimes you will kick yourself for not figuring it out 5 minutes sooner.

Dialogue is great too.
